content: Having been to the night safari and the zoo I was curious to see the river safari and I was not dissapointed I enjoyed the nice calm pace of the displays. The only thing that was a little dissapointing was the Amazon ride this should be included in the price not an added extra .It was a warm day and some of the monkeys were not visible which I understand. But the giant pandas are a great sight to see and are well worth the visit in themselves.

title: Quite disappointing
content: Aside for some big fish, and the two pandas (if you're lucky to see them), not much of an experience. I would not recommend the amazon boat ride. We saw two monkeys from afar and it was so quick that we saw the jaguars for a few seconds. It's a bit of a rip off.

title: Great Day out for the Family
content:
The River Safari is located next to the Singapore Zoo, adjacent to the Upper Seletar Reservoir. To begin with, the complex begins with a walk along covered areas with displays of habitat depicting various rivers of the world like the Amazon, Mekong etc. There is an interesting selection of Fish, reptiles and amphibians.
Some where along the winding exhibit is the giant Panda enclosure where you can see 2 Giant Pandas. There are also a couple of Red Pandas. Both make good photographic subjects.
We broke for lunch at Mama Panda, a Chinese fast food. this was a real disappointment.
The boat ride was a short 15 min cruise of the reservoir where we saw a couple of giraffes and elephants. Not much to talk about.
As we headed towards the exit we entered a huge airconditioned area housing various fish and a large aquarium.
Great place for young kids with lots of different things to see. Of particular note is the place is wheel chair friendly.

title: More about Pandas than rivers.
content: Actually a bit of a disappointment. Fairly basic aquatic displays, short "boat " ride during which you don't see a lot and the standard tourist fare. The highlight attraction seems to be the pandas on display that are on loan....what they have to do with any river I'm not sure? We came as part of a package including "Night Safari" , if I had made the effort for just his I would've been unhappy.

title: Best way to watch fish
content: Has one of the biggest aquariums in Singapore with walrus and other beautiful species of sea animals but it does not only contain that also reptiles and kinds of monkeys, the cat family and specially unique pandas that pose brilliantly for a picture

title: Customer service
content: I went to river safari singapore on 25 Dec 2016 with my family. We took the Amazon Quest boat ride n when i was about to leave the place i realised i had left my son's water bottle around the area i was at earlier. I sought the assistance of the staff, Mariana. She was so patient and understanding. She went to the extent of back tracking with me to where i had started just to find the water bottle. It was a long journey but she did not give up. At last we found the water bottle. Kudos to river safari for having a staff like her!

title: River Safari- Singapore
content:
River Safari - Singapore
One of the must visits when in Singapore
- Compulsory Visit if with children :)
- Can spend hours walking around
- Pandas . YAY
- Aircon areas in between - So no worries about weather being hot
- Eating options

Can spend whole day if you wish
else keep 2-3 hours minimum .

title: Only to see pandas
content: This river safari is created for ppl to see pandas only - nothing else worth mentioning. We finished the whole park in 2 hours time, since the boat ride was suspended as well. It was very expensive to pay for a ticket that last you for 2 hours tour only, moreover boat ride is chargeable as well. Apart of seeing some fishes in their tanks, the pandas would be the main attraction. However, you need to be lucky to see them as they will spend most of their time sleeping, unless you don't mind wait for them to wake up - could be hours! Paying the full price ticket just to see the pandas is really NOT worth it, I think. But if you are a panda lover then it would be different story.

title: It's an aquarium with short boat rides!
content:
The title is quite misleading. I initially thought that it is a journey through the river. Actually it consists of three parts.
1. Walk through an aquarium, a Panda enclosure. This covers the 85% of the animals in River Safari. You can find different sections in the aquariums belonging to rivers like Nile, Ganga, Congo etc.
2. 15 mins boat ride in a lake. (River Safari Cruise - Charged extra)
This is a very boring boat ride. You may see Giraffe and Elephant during the ride. (From the zoo area). Not recommended.
3. 10 mins boat ride through a simulated amazon river surroundings. (Amazon River Quest - Charged extra)
This covers the remaining 15% of the animals. A very short ride and not recommended for the ticket price.

Other details:

1. River safari is 2 mins walk from the Singapore Zoo. Popular route is bus 198 from Ang Mo Kio terminal.
2. Camera can be used at all places. Be sensitive not to use flash whenever instructed
3. Do not disturb pandas by making noise
4. Pandas may not be seen if sleeping in some corner
5. River Cruise and Amazon River Quest may be cancelled if it rains
6. Buy Park hopper 4 in 1 ticket (Bird Park, Zoo, River Safari, Night Safari) online and save money and time. Present ticket through mobile. No print copy required.
7. Food and drinks are expensive. Bring your own to save money.

You may skip the river safari if visiting SEA aquarium in Sentosa and the Singapore Zoo. It is a repeat except for Panda.

title: Decent zoo with lots of fishes and panda
content: Attractions will be Jia Jia and Kai Kai. Have catch both their glimpses in large air con room. Have shelter so even if rains also no worries. Showcase lots of fishes from different rivers throughout the world. If u have not been, can go visit lovely panda. Normally I will go zoo and river safari on same day to save on expensive parking fees. Good place for visitors and tourists.

title: Pandas
content: Did this as a park hopper with the zoo. This is the newest attraction after the zoo and night safari and the planners considered Singapore's tropical and wet climate, hence the whole park is fully sheltered (great for rainy day). In my opinion, the greatest attraction is the pandas (I only see one up close). It may be good on its own, but if you visit immediately after the zoo, you may not be wowed by the experience. Nevertheless, seeing the panda is definitely worth the price paid for the entrance tickets.

title: Saw the adorable panda
content: At same place with singapore zoo. I would recommend going here together with singapore zoo in one day. They have the panda. The kids enjoyed it.

title: Good for Family Activity but Not Very Exciting
content:
As with anything else in Singapore, the River Safari is well designed, carefully thought of, attraction.
Cleanliness, decoration theme, and supporting facilities (i.e. toilet, walking path, restaurants, etc.), come naturally adequate and well maintained.
The highlight of the park will be the Red Panda and the Giant Panda.

On the down side, the size of the whole park and also of the individual displays are quite small, combined with the number of visitors, it can really feels cramped.
With the amount of fish being promoted put inside such small aquariums, it really kills the excitement (in exception for 1 big aquarium where the manatees are).
The Optional Add-On River Cruise while doesn't cost much and give you that relaxing stroll along the actual river, is a merely 10-minutes sit with nothing much to see but trees (and giraffe and elephant in far distance, belonging to the zoo).

Overall, given the remote location and the amount of time required to reach it (using public transport, you must take MRT combined with bus trip), it's only worth to go if you have plenty of time to kill in Singapore.
Perhaps if combined with the Zoo and Night Safari (also been there on different occasions) it will worth the time, but then the ticket cost might not worth it.

Visiting River Safari with my 2-years old daughter does make good experience for her, but really nothing exciting for myself.

title: If you like animals you will enjoy this place
content: It will take nearly an hour or two to see all the animals. We can see Panda, red panda, different type of fishes, monkeys, polar bear etc. finally we travelled in the Cruise ,it was just a 15 minutes but you will really enjoy it.

title: It's not the animals, but the environment, that is worth being there
content:
I have not stepped foot into River Safari ever since it was opened in 2012. I went only because my children have been asking if they can go to the zoo, and to look at animal exhibits.

If there is one good thing about River Safari, it is that there is space for people to walk, run and enjoy themselves in nature. Yes, there are animals to see, including the red pandas and giant pandas, which I have never seen before. There are also fun things to do, like taking a cruise and a boat ride, and posing for photos with animal statues. But for me, I like the natural setting, and the opportunity to take scenic pictures of Mandai area. Not something I get to do on a daily basis.

What I don't really like is the implicit idea that everything you want to see or do costs money. For example, you pay $5 for a river cruise. You pay to keep the photos the staff take for you (at the main entrance and just before the panda exhibits). There are booths placed strategically to get you thinking whether you want to part with you money (like cafe outlets, photo booths). It's probably the tourist mentality that will get you to part with your money (which I did). But somehow I just don't like the idea of income generation in every part of River Safari. Just too commercial for me.

title: Place to see giant pandas
content: Do this instead of the Zoo - we took public transport to here and the Zoo, river Safari and night safari are all beside each other - the river trip is great and it skirts around the zoo so you see a the animals there as well - follow it up with the night safari and you will have got the best two of the three - at the end take one of the five dollar private coaches back to the hotel area - no need to pre book.

title: Normal place to visit
content: River Safari is just a normal place with not much animals unlike ZOO. Its took about 2 to 3 hours or even 1.5 hours to finish the whole journey. Nothing much to comments. Just an average place.

title: Not as exciting as the zoo
content: Most of the area inside is indoors. It is a small area compared to the zoo. If you have time for only one to visit, stick to the zoo. Not much choices for food at all. I think younger kids would find the zoo more exciting.

title: River Safari will feel great if you enjoy it for cheap tickets
content:
River Safari will feel great if you enjoy it for cheap tickets. This is not a great place like Singapore zoo but Ok to visit once. Rides are not that great.

But if you manage to get cheap or free tickets from travel agents or qoo10.sg then definitely visit there to have some nice clicks.

So go ahead and visit River Safari asap ....

title: First class viewing experience with air conditioned comfort
content:
This is a relatively new extension to the Singapore Zoo, and I am very impressed with the modern facilities and cleanliness. It is a breeze for those with young children, as the sheltered and air conditioned walk ways and viewing areas are well maintained with proper (air conditioned) rest rooms.

The place is very educational for young children and the place is safe for them to roam around - galleries are enclosed with railings and carpeted walkways.

There's a couple of restaurants at the end of the attraction, reasonably priced too.

title: Walking with nature
content: Spend half a day here with nature and get to see exotic fishes, panda and monkey. Find out first the feeding time and plan your tour to your preference.

title: Nice to visit
content:
Walking required. Personally i kinda like it as its away from the city crowd. Purchase your tickets online as there might be some discount (compare prices whilst u are there. There is free wifi so u can purchase them at the counter).

Lots of photo taking opportunities. However, please skip the cruise (both of them). Its S$5 per person but its a complete waste of time and money.

title: Poor food standard
content: All the food:Panda paus, fried dumplings and coffee we ordered from the Panda Mama Restaurant were cold. This wasnt the case when we visited the River Safari in 2014. We were expecting at least warm food and were sadly disappointed.

title: A very good place to enjoy nature with family.
content: Our family visit Singapore Zoo and Jurong Birdpark a few times a year. Yet I didn't expect River Safari to be as good as the 2 famous parks. Large Aquariums and Pandas are obvious attractions but the scenery is outstanding as well. While River Safari doesn't have water playground but our kids can appreciate the nature and animal kingdom better.

title: A little suprised
content: So I am not a big fan of zoos, or animal parks but the river safari is very good. It is a very nice and calm place to walk around and see the animals. I think we where there for around about 5 hours. Loved loved see the giant panda and the red panda. It was something good I was not expecting it to be. Seeing all the different fish and marine animals good too. We did do the river boat trip at an extra cost, it went for less than 20 mins,fun little ride don't get scared of you hear people screaming there is really nothing scary in the ride. Totally recommend checking it out l.

title: Enlightening
content: As we have been to Singapore a few times & seen many of the sights, this was new to us & seemed interesting. We weren't disappointed, as was educational, even for an adult, interesting too, with typically beautiful Singaporean gardens and greenery. Would highly recommend this tour for young & old.

title: A Unique experience
content: The wide varieties of animals species made it one of the "must go" tourist attraction in Singapore. Young children get excited with the giant creatures such as crocodiles, big fishes,giant stingray etc in the aquarium setting. the different theme based on the different river around the world made this place unique traveling experience. Although it look weird that the giant panda were placed at river safari instead of zoo, nevertheless we enjoyed it very much.

title: Entertaining afternoon
content: The first stop on our list; good to go here before the night safari. The only thing we didn't plan for was the exhibitions closing before the park actually does, so check this first. Sadly we missed out on the pandas, but the squirrel monkey exhibit made up for it! This was interesting- you can walk through their cage and watch them jump the trees above you! The exhibits of the 7 rivers were great, although not as vast as I imagined. Still as great way to see a lot at once, and the safari itself was a nice way to relax after the walk

title: Manatees <3
content:
I came here to see the pandas up close. Unfortunately, only had the chance to see Kai Kai. Jia Jia was in another area and we could only see her from the live video.

Didn't expect that animals other than pandas would steal my attention here: Manatees. There is a very very big aquarium with many many cute manatees here which has captivated me. Totally in love with this animal!

Had a panda bun at the restaurant/ cafe there. The bun was really cute. But taste wise, not really special.

Hope they will open more animal exhibit and attractions, because the value for money is not so good for the amount of exhibits and attractions they have now.

And hopefully they can provide more buses from more areas in Singapore.

title: The Safari was very useful to me
content: I was impressed by the way this place is organised. It is no doubt an attraction to those who wish to explore the creatures under the sea. I've experience both Amazon River Quest and River Cruise and I prefer the first one. I will try the Night Safari next time.

title: Like an aquarium, but not really
content:
The River Safari is Wildlife Reserve's latest attraction. It's like a zoo and an aquarium mixed together, and is definitely worth a look.

It's quite compact, and can easily be finished (if you walk briskly and traffic is moderate) within 90 mins, and will take 3 hours tops if you stop for their feeding sessions and for meals. There are no trams or animal shows in the River Safari. There are two boat rides, one is the Amazon River Quest and the other is the River Cruise. Both require additional tickets.

The place is sheltered, and there are some fully A.Ced areas where you can seek refuge from the tropical heat. The park is literally just one long pathway, so you wouldn't have to worry about losing your way or your group. It is also stroller and wheelchair friendly.

There are some interesting creatures to see, like the pandas, the giant mekong catfish and the manatees. I was also very excited to see the giant anteater on the Amazon River Quest (a boat ride with some shallow drops, thus the height limit). They've just opened a touch pool (mid Nov'15), where you can come up close with sea stars, sea cucumbers and the horseshoe crab.

There is a restaurant in the park, the panda buns are a novelty and some snack stations and drink vending machines along the way. You can bring your own food in but there are not many points to really sit and eat. The food is not halal certified although the staff informed us that the food is prepared using halal sources. I recall seeing only one water fountain.

If you had a day to spend, consider doing the River Safari together with the Zoo OR Night Safari. If you could only do one, while the River Safari has some novel creatures, it is not as diverse as the zoo. Still a fun outing for the whole family :)

It's easiest to go there by cab or private transport, but there are some shuttles from the city that would be a cheaper option if there's only 2 of you. For the cheapest tickets, I've always found that buying direct (airlines, hotels) is best but some travel agencies might have good bundled prices. Other than buying from the ticket counters, there are iPads set up where you can buy your own tickets and get a credit card discount.

title: Different kind of zoo
content: This attraction offer the river ecosystem. The interesting one is the flooded Amazon ecosystem where there is big aquarium filled with giant fish, including dugong. I've tied the Amoson quest ride which we travel with boat to see some of the animals found in Amazon forest. The ride is interesting but too short for me. The other attraction that also interesting is to see red pand and giant panda.

title: The zoo and night safari is better
content:
It takes around 2 hours to do everything and a taxi ride there is under $25. If it's raining the river cruise and river quest rides get suspended so don't buy your tickets to those attractions in advance.

I bought tickets to the river cruise and it immediately started raining for the rest of the day so we couldn't do it or the river quest. The otters and pandas were cool but overall there wasn't much to see. The zoo and night safari are much better, the river safari is skippable.

title: good place for family holiday
content:
Kids love the safari experience and animals especially the panda
Smart idea with the panda cafe serving panda bun and coffee. Take the kids there for a break
The only dissapointing items for us when we went there, it was cloudy and stormy and they cancelled the boat ride. So it is wise to call them prior to visiting especially on cloudy day to make sure that the boats are in operation.

title: River safari
content: This is the second time I have been to this zoo. The first time not all the zoo was opened. I really enjoyed this zoo my favourite was the pandas and the Amazon boat ride, will go again with my family.

title: River-themed wild life park
content: Said to be Asia's first and only river-themed wild life park, this newest addition to Wildlife Reserves Singapore portfolio, is home to thousands of giant pandas, stingrays, squirrel monkeys, prowling jaguar, fresh water aquarium that re-creates the Amazon forest during its rainy season. Awesome experience!

title: Rivers intro
content: The variety of fish from various places is informative. Take time to see the enclosures. The highlight was the red panda. As it was raining, the ride was closed off. Do arrive early to enjoy that as well.

title: Pandas, hedgehog, and lots of fish
content:
Visited on a rainy week day. No crowds so we didn't have to queue for any of the attractions. Buy your tickets online for more discounts. Free admission for Singapore citizens and permanent residents if you visit on your birthday.
Amazon River Quest boat ride costs $5 for adults, ride was short but quite entertaining, and we didn't get wet so don't bother getting ponchos. Both River Quest and River Safari rides are weather dependent, so it's best to purchase your boat ride tickets just before boarding because no refunds will be given if rides are cancelled due to bad weather. Most parts of the park are sheltered so we were able to see most of the attractions despite the rain. Don't miss the African hedgehog encounter at 3pm, just outside the panda enclosure. Cutest tiny albino hedgehog I've ever seen.

title: Panda:-D
content: First time go here still not many animal seconds time way much better. I seen real Panda nice experience.

title: Very interesting
content:
With only half day to spare we chose to do the River safari (instead of zoo or night safari) and were certainly not disappointed.

We had the opportunity to see the animals according to their habitat: From the Amazon to Ganges display with the species found in that area.

title: great experience
content:
Great new zoo full of really great aquariums featuring huge manatees & other cool exhibits like Giant Pandas. I have a mobility issue but this did not hamper my experience as I was able to hire a free wheelchair. I could even go on the amazon boat ride which was a lot of fun but it could have gone a bit slower to give you more time to view the particular animals in this zone.
Overall a lot of good old fashioned fun.

title: Nice and educational place
content: It's a nice place to just walk around and look at the animal. You can see some of the animals that you never see before (not even on tv). Too bad we only saw Kai Kai the panda and the other one (Jia Jia) might be relaxing in her executive lounge :). We didn't try the restaurant there but did visit their retail shop to buy some small merchandise. The boat ride was a bit dissapointing, not because we need to pay additional ticket, but because i feel that the boat move too fast and we unable to enjoy the journey as well as spot all the animals along the ride since the enclosure located opposite each other, so when you try to spot animal on your right, you will miss the one on your left. It's just dissapointing, specially since we don't come during peak period, it's great if they can slow down the boat so that we can see more of the animal.

title: Amazing
content:
The Singaporeans known how to showcase aquarium animals. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy the pandas were visible , so to the manatees which were highlights for me. We were lucky to go on a week day and had no crowds to deal with. It is mostly under cover so would not matter when you went.
As with all of Singapore it is clean and well thought out. The only disappointment were the river cruise where you really don't see much, and the Amazon experience where the little boat goes way to fast to actually see or appreciate any of the animals - all that seem to live in small quarters.

title: Absolutely disappointing.
content:
Ive been to the night safari n zoo (though not recent) but by far river safari is a major let down. I felt like i was just visiting some aquarium. To begin with, the design seems weird. Most of the time, the animals are hidden. The display signs of the animals are confusing. There's a few kinds of animals in an area but the sign doesn't explain them all.

I didn't understand why we had to pay extra for the cruise only to see 'borrowed' view of elephants and giraffes from the zoo. (Yes, u pay sgd5 just to look at giraffes n elephants that are sitting in the opposite zoo from a cruise) and you have to play another sgd5 for another river ride. The River ride was too fast you couldn't hardly see any animals. Overall, perhaps good for very young kids and old folks friendly. But I was expecting something on par with the zoo or night safari.
Will not visit again.

title: Hyped off
content: By the name it feels that u will be on river. But thats not true. River ride is only for 10 mn . Rest its more like underwater world. If less time, u can easily skip it.

title: A great exhibition of the greatest rivers of the world :)
content:
A well-organized park with two sides separated by water in between, this is where you'll get to learn about the greatest rivers of the world with the creatures typically found in those rivers displayed in big glass tanks here (some really big taking up the whole wall on one side of the room like at the Mekong area) and some information about people's lives around the rivers nicely presented by means of things like some Mark Twain audio, the Canadian nickel & a beaver hat and some model log cabins at the Mississippi River area and things like the step-by-step process of rice growing in the Mekong delta at the "Mekong River area".

On the left side of the water are the areas for the Mississippi, the Congo, the Nile, the Ganges, the Mekong and the Yangtze in that order; just after the Yangtze is the Giant Panda Forest with two beautiful pandas (kept in separate rooms), I was especially impressed by the second panda which I believe was a female that put up a great show walking around and eating bamboos and such; and after the pandas is a polar bear tank where I was lucky to see a big polar bear swimming which you may or may not see depending on where the bear is (apparently, it's a pretty big tank that maybe even connected to the Singapore Zoo nearby!)

The right side of the water is all "Amazon-themed" consisting of the Amazon River Quest boat ride along a man-made canal-like waterway resembling the Amazon River with the creatures of the river such as monkeys, wild pigs, flamingos and even jaguars (all in a natural setting except jaguars which are behind glass) to be seen on the 'river banks', the Squirrel Monkey Forest with a big Anaconda snake in a glass tank at the entrance, and the Amazon Flooded Forest with a REALLY huge glass tank containing manatees (which I interestingly learned there are relatives of elephants!) and a fairly realistic display of an Amazon flooded forest with two model houses (one on each end of the display area behind glass) and huge tree trunks half buried in water between the two houses.

Also, there's actually something to do "from" the right side (which otherwise is all "Amazon-themed" as mentioned above) of the water separating the two parts of the park, and that something is the River Safari Cruise for about 15 minutes in the waters adjacent to the River Safari land with animals like giraffes & elephants on land to be seen from the boat.

Coming by MRT, the station to get off is Choa Chu Kang (red line) where you'll have to get on the bus (can find out the bus number on the River Safari website) on the far side of the bus terminal adjacent to the MRT, and the bus ride from the MRT to the River Safari takes about half an hour. Also to do here (according to your budget of time and money) besides this are Singapore Zoo and the Night Safari, and they actually have "combo tickets" at special prices.

title: Beautiful place to visit
content: There are many big fish and animal such as jaguar. However, sometimes you cannot see them as they go to sleep go hiding somewhere.

title: very interesting place /1
content: Came down for the Safari Boo event for my children . Not disappointing at all ! very pleases with the event, only bad thing is the humidity of the place especially now is the haze period affecting Singapore. Overall nice experience with the cool exhibits shown

title: Pandas! Ok, when you have extra time
content: We did not plan on visiting this part, but the combo offer was interesting and since the bus ride out into the boondocks took so long, we wanted to see as much as possible. On first entrance, it appeared deserted ... they told us also upon entry (but I doubt after any chance to get money back) that this one ride attraction they have is currently down. SO, we followed the path and enjoyed a quick glimpse at a shy panda and then enjoyed the rather brief and not very spectacular 'cruise' ... Not a highlight, but when there, why not ...

title: Worth for the Pandas
content:
I loved the Panda!! That was the main reason why I went..although the only panda that was outside was sleeping and he was on his own. Was wondering where the others were..?

We also were on the little boat that drove us around a bit..too short unfortunately and the animals were mostly hiding :( But great idea..the boat should go a bit slower so that you get the chance to look around a bit better.

Rest of the river safari was nice and interesting - but when it comes to fish the SEA Aquarium is much nicer.

title: Safari boo
content: We are regular here with 15min drive fro home and a zoo friend plus member. The Hallowe'en theme event this year are excellent for local young childrens. If you are foreign visitors, the panda and manatee are the highlights. Give the boat ride a miss. It does not provide a proper view for most of the animals. Pity that they relocate my favorite Jaguar from zoo to the boat ride.

title: can give it a miss!
content: If you are checking out to buy the park hopper ticket in Singapore. Just go for Jurong Bird Park and Night Safari. You could easily give a miss to the River Safari and Singapore Zoo.

title: If time constraint avoid it
content: MOst of the animals on the boat ride are visible in Zoo, so avoid it. There are aquariums inside which are ok but if you visit SEA aquarium then this is nothing.

title: A must visit!
content: Even though the Amazon river cruise was closed for maintenance this must be on any visit to Singapore. The aquatic exhibits are first class. One Panda on display, the female on closed circuit. Cafe had good food choices. Worth a full day with Zoo as well.

title: A Safari of its kind!
content: We took the river safari when we were there in Singapore for almost 10 days. We had plenty of time. In this, you ride a boat, they lift the boat to a height and then allow it to move with the force of gravity in water. While moving, you can see the animals and birds on either side.

title: Great viewing opportunities
content:
Our visit to the River Safari was a pleasant experience made even more special by the antics of a panda. Only the male came out to strut his stuff...the female chose to be shy and retiring but she was visible on cctv. The aquariums house multiple fish of all shapes and sizes. Some are enormous.
The only disappointing thing was that the boat trip was cancelled due to thunderstorms so plan your journey for a fine day (if that's possible in Singapore!)

title: Excellent
content: A great place made even better by the pandas. One was being a bit lazy but the other was eating and wandering around exploring. Extremely well done with great staff

title: 'Pandamania'
content: If you are expecting this to be on a Par with Singapore Zoo you will be disappointed as there are not very many interesting exhibit unless your a fish fan. The River Cruise is ok for small children. The Amazon Safari is a Disney themed ride and a nice way to see the animals in their habitat. When we went to visit the Pandas, One was sleeping and the other was missing. We went back in the afternoon and it was worth it to see the Pandas up, eating and generally having fun. A memorial experience.

title: Went for the Pandas
content: A beautiful environment. Wasn't disappointed. Only 1 Panda out and he was a delight to watch... Eating, playing, scratching. A great display all around enjoyed every part of the zoo ... Including the Panda Cappucino 😊

title: One of the best safari in the world
content:
Singapore has done well for our zoo and Safari in many ways. Yes, I'm a Singaporean but I have to say we have one of the best zoos in the world.

First, the exhibits are well maintain and clean. The animals are well fed and you can view the feeding daily. *Do note that some animals eat only once per week. I went on a Saturday and I got to view most feeding sessions from 9.30am onwards. Plus, the feeding sessions come with a guided tour by the zookeeper, so you will know what and when the animals eat.

Second, river ferry and boat ride are enjoyable. Sit back and relax. Enjoy the quiet and beautiful reservoir while on the ferry. See the giraffes and elephants housed near the zoo and night safari too. After the ferry ride, check out the boat ride. The ride is about 10min and it takes you close up to some beautiful animals. The river ferry and boat ride are chargable.

Third, not to miss out the stars of the river safari, the red panda and both pandas Jia Jia and Kai Kai. Be sure to stay for awhile to check out some panda actions... Like when they roll down the slope or chew some bamboos.

Well, you will definitely enjoy it and take more pictures.

title: Quite nice and clean
content: Most people come by to visit the two pandas. Other animals / exhibits are nice and well maintained too. We enjoyed the river cruise too (not included in the tickets' price). Do try the panda buns sold at the restaurant or some kiosk, the buns are quite nice.

title: Visit the Pandas
content: Meet the 2 pandas from China.They are housed in a special climate controlled enclosure. Be prepared for not much action though, as they are either sleeping or lazing around. Check for their feeding time, when they may wake up to feed.

title: Worth a visit
content: Extremely well planned taking you through different rivers of the world. Very informative. All exhibits excellently looked after. Fish tanks very clean. Panda enclosure very good, but I think Hong Kong enclosure better. Walked round twice. Very enjoyable day. The short boat ride around the lake peaceful. The manatees had a calf.

title: Entertaining for the kids
content: We visited with 4 kids and it was a great venue to spend a day on the outskirts of Singapore. The underwater viewing at the end was absolutely amazing, and my kids was just gazing at the manatees for half an hour.. Would recommend.

title: A morning of delight viewing nature fauna
content: The River Safari is a great family entertainment consisting of seeing various animals such as a playful polar bear, panda bears and a rare red panda among other creatures as well as fishes from various continents such as piranhas, manatees, Amazon rainforest animals, most spectacular was the jaguar. There is a ride that costs $5 SD for adults &3 for children called Amazon River Quest over water that is worth the money. There is sufficient food concession to meet any food desire.

title: Good Place - pandas are a must-see
content: After doing the zoo which is great, this was a bit of a come down in comparison - but only in comparison. Having said that, myself and family (2 children, 5 and 11) loved the pandas, and the Amazon boat ride (slight grumble that you have to pay extra for this). It is definitely worth doing if you have time after the zoo though.

title: Could Be Better
content: There is a lot of good things here, but I would have liked to have seen more of the animals that live close to the rivers without having to pay extra for the Amazon for example.

title: Must see for the Pandas
content: The Panda's in Singapore are not in the Zoo but the River Safari near the zoo. At 1st we were disappointed that we had to visit a 3rd Zoo. There are some nice exhibits including a covered Monkey enclosure you can walk through. Be careful as they may poop on you. 1st time we saw the Pandas one was indoors (she is pregnant) and one asleep. Later they were both out and about and it was pretty amazing.... worth the admission price for sure. Can get some brilliant pictures. You must go!

title: Not as impressive as it can be
content:
We went on the Night Safari and the River Safari on different days. The Night Safari was excellent but the River Safari was not as good. You get to see the pandas, which is cool but that is really about it. The Amazon River Quest was good but short. The River Cruise, on the other hand, was a complete waste of time and money.
Overall, I am not sure why the River Safari needs to be separate to the Singapore Zoo. A separate price of admission hardly seems justified.

title: Love it!
content:
The park provides you a different kind of aquarium cause definitely its a fresh water kind of tanks! Many weird and never seen before animals.

The biggest aquarium really catch your breath away.. This park also is not that packed compared to sea aquarium. The pandas are not really cute as they only sleep and hide. So make sure you dont just wanna see the pandas, it maybe dissapoints you.

At first i expect it would be hot but turns out i was wrong, there are roofs all over the parks so you wont get tanned :p

However, the amazon quest (with additional s$ 5 for the ticket) are not really worth the money. The rides move so fast you cant even take a while to see the animals. And so sad to see cheetah in such small spaces...

But in my opinion, this zoo is worth one visit only and they should update the tanks with more and weirder animals to add more value and make the guests want to come back.

title: A lovely refreshing walk
content: If you are at the zoo then walk next door to the River Safari. Its a nice refreshing walk around - with a lot of the walk being either across the water or just near the water. Interesting to see the fish and other water animals and a bonus to see the Pandas .. There is even a boat ride and a small amusement type ride as well.

title: MUST MUST SEE!
content: First off, Singapore is the perfect example of what a country should be like. Visited with friends from Trinidad recently and only had one afternoon, was it was a long transit stop to NYC. On the recommendation of the taxi driver, no less, we decided to do the River Safari, which is immediately adjacent to the Singapore Zoo. Everything, from the layout, to the attractions was perfect. Very educational and informative. The displays are extremely well designed and the highlight, the pandas, were incredible. The only downside, which is no fault of the Safari curators, was the haze over the city, which rendered the air quality poor and which had to force the shutdown of one of the open air cruises. Otherwise, highly recommended!

title: Panda enclosure closes before 6pm....sucks
content:
As Friends of the river safari and zoo I am very disappointed to hear that I can't see the Panda till 6pm. Today we waited till after the showers and we were there by 5.20pm to be told Panda enclosure is already closed. When it is mentioned that River Safari is open till 6pm and Zoo till 6pm. So that means there is no point coming later in the day to visit as there will not be anything to view. The river safari does not have much else besides amazon boat ride where you pay extra to see the Jaguars and then the Red Panda and Giant pandas..which are the highlight...so today with my 2 niece's just starting their school holidays we did not get to do either as by the time we walked to the Amazon boat ride it was closed due to inclement weather and then we walked to the Panda enclosure to be told it was already closed.....it is very disappointing visit.
So I guess you can see anything in the last hour at the River Safari?

title: Educative
content: It's a wonderful place to take school going kids. Not only is it educative, it is also fun filled and very informative. The place is divided into zones and it gives an in depth knowledge of that particular place. The giant fish tank is one sight not be missed. Children will be glued to this attraction for hours. It's so breath taking. The next attraction is the red panda. It's in an open cage along with giant panda. My girls loved the boat ride. Overall it was great fun for the whole family.

title: so many to see so little time
content:
We scheduled our trip here for only 2-3hours, turn out you need to spend more than 4-5 hours here..so many things to see, all well maintained and well prepared.
The fish tank, aquarium, river history and the highlight perhaps the Panda Dome, both of the Pandas looks so cute and calm. The river cruise and amazon ride only took 10-15 minutes each and most of the animal seems to lazy to showed up. However, this is totally worth your visit and surely will entertain and educate the kids.

title: Awesome
content: This was a great way to spend an afternoon - even though we got soaked by a thunderstorm on the boat ride! Each exhibit is well presented and the highlights are the giant pandas, otters and manatees. The manatees are absolutely worth the price of admission alone.

title: A must do in singapore
content: This place was the highlight of our trip. Simply amazing. Very well organised, Staff were very helpful and everything about the place was just superb. When going to the park there are two boat cruises. One is the river safari and is more of a scenic tour and the other is the amazon which has animal's in it (recommend).

title: River wildlife and other attractions
content: You get to see Pandas, Red panda and lots of freshwater reptiles, fishes and animals. The Pandas belong to China and will return to their motherland in 2021.

title: More than we expected
content: We found this to be a very pleasant morning looking at the various animal exibits, relaxing ride on the water and the little boat ride through the animals, they are so close. One of the Pandas was in its sleeping area but thats couldn't be helped. We had no idea about the size of the aquariums, that was a surprise, in particular the massive Mantees that we watched feeding. Overall we found it very well organised and worth the trip out to the zoo. The total admission also included a $5.00 voucher to spend at the shop.

title: What a Shame!!
content:
An awful shame! Very nice facilities brought down by awful customer service!

My wife & I pre-purchased tickets to all three of their parks (River Safari, the Zoo, and the Night Safari) online before we left home. It was expected to be a highlight of our trip. Put simply- If you are short on time, or do not have very flexible travel plans- DO NOT PRE-PURCHASE TICKETS! The discount is not worth the lack of flexibility they provide.

We spent $100 on the pre-purchased tickets! My wife & I avidly visit zoos all over the world, but have NEVER spent that kind of money on a zoo facility in one shot (the only thing that comes close is the San Diego Zoo & Safari- our favorites in the world- which we did on two separate visits).

So, its damn expensive. Therefore expectations are high. And, I have to say, it was worth it for the first hour of our visit. But, then it started raining (pouring actually)- and we had only visited a PORTION of 1 out of the 3 parks. So- we went to customer service to confirm that we could come back to see the other two parks another day. We were told no.

No. No way, not a chance. The only day we could return was 8 days away (we were going to Malaysia for a week the next morning) and you have to visit all 3 parks within 7 days with the pass we purchased. Nobody would make an exception- not customer service, a manager, nobody... the fact that we were only there for an hour, and had only seen part of 1 out of 3 parks didn't seem important to them at all. And they were rude about it, as if we were ridiculous for asking to use our $100 purchase on a day it wasn't pouring! So- that was upsetting... but we sucked it up and just trudged on in the pouring rain.

But- the worst was yet to come... even though we toughed it up and were willing to (and did) explore the parks in the pouring rain, the MAIN ATTRACTION of River Safari (the boat ride) was CLOSED! (and would remain closed even after the rain stopped!!!) They would not even let us come back to experience the attraction that they had shut down!! So- we could not experience the #1 aspect of this park, even though we were willing to make the trip back!

And here's the kicker- the most obnoxious piece of their customer service that day: Moments before the rain kicked in we purchased an ADDITIONAL ticket (only about $10 for the two of us) for a 2nd boat attraction that was not included in the $100 price tag. So- they closed down THAT RIDE TOO. Fair enough- it was raining and thats their policy, so be it (though they also did not re-open this attraction when the rain stopped). The obnoxious part- AGAIN- is that they would not let us return to use these ride tickets!
So- instead of giving us a refund for tickets we purchased MINUTES before the rain started, all they would do for us is say we could use the $10 as a STORE CREDIT!

A store credit!? We did not want a t-shirt or souvenir- we wanted to EXPERIENCE THEIR ZOO!! I have to say, my wife & I were totally enamored with Asia, and in love with Singapore in particular. But, this complete lack of caring about customer satisfaction was shocking to us. Money was the bottom line to them, clear & simple- no exceptions, no gray area.

I've encountered places before not being flexible about refunds, and thats to be expected. But- to not let us return after spending over $110- to use the tickets ONE DAY past the 7-day window, when they themselves were shutting down large portions of the park? Its unacceptable and a total shame! The facilities at River Safari were new and seemed quite pretty and well done... but without the two boat rides we missed half the park, and it was absolutely not worth it!

title: Beautiful
content:
We loved river safari. The amazon boat ride was very cute. The huge aquarium with the manatees is gorgeous. We just sat and watched them for ages. Very peaceful and relaxing.
The only part we didnt like was the river cruise. It was very boring n basically just showed animals from the zoo.

title: Panda lover paradise!
content:
I dragged my partner with me to the River Safari as I'm a bit of a panda fanatic and was desperate to visit Kai Kai and Jai Jai before we left Singapore; but this place has a lot more to offer than just the giant pandas!

It can be a bit complicated to get out here if you're a tourist traveling by public transport; it would have been 3 buses, or 2 buses and a metro trip for us to travel from our hotel (roughly a 1 and 1/2 hour journey). We chose to save time by taking a taxi which cost around $20SG and took roughly 30mins.

As previously stated we were mainly here for the pandas but the aquarium sections were also very appealing and nicely laid out with lots of different levels to view the fish and animals. The amazon safari boat trip was also really cool; we saw lots of animals including napping jaguars which are usually very shy and difficult to spot. The ride goes a little too quick to get good photos though. I was also able to feed some of the animals and you can walk round a monkey enclosure for that more interactive feel.

We did get to see both pandas being active and playful but by nature these animals are quite sleepy and lazy at times and to really see them sometimes you have to be patient and hang around and wait. A lot of the people who entered the enclosure at the same time as us just waked round complaining that the pandas weren't out and completely missed them! I would recommend to aim for late morning as this is when pandas are generally more active.The gift shop has a lot of nice things and most of the prices are reasonable, and the panda cafe was fully on theme. Edinburgh Zoo could pick up some tips from this place for sure.

A lot of the River Safari is either inside or covered with air conditioning to keep you cool and as tourists we really appreciated that. There's plenty to see and do (for all ages) and we really enjoyed our visit. Would love to go back!

title: Magnificient ambience
content: This is a place where one enjoys the beauty of a forest in the boat ride and then the man made habitats for the endangered animals. The biggest attraction are the white and red Pandas. The day we were there, they were probably in good mood and so had a very close look. The Amazon quest ride should not be missed. The different river sections are very well organised.

title: Amazing animals and beautiful surroundings
content: We really enjoyed the opportunity to see such variety of animals in our time there. We needed at least 3 hours to see things more than once. The flow of people and signage are really well organised. The boat rides on the river and the Amazon Quest were lovely, if only too short. The little trip, however, was not really about river life but glimpses of edges of the animal enclosures in the zoo. But we saw every animal advertised in the brochure and it was still fun. The exhibits were amazing, in particular the tanks with large fish and mammals. We could not have enough. A little inconvenience was having different sections charged separately, and we would have preferred a ticket to cover the entire experience.

title: Nicely Done
content:
This is a thing to do before the night Safari, the park is well maintained, the boat ride itself is pretty short but still interesting.

The main thing over here are the Panda's, over than that there are just Aquariums and all, but its a thing to see.

title: Not worth a second visit
content: The only star attraction is the 2 panda bears and nothing else. Even then it also depends on ur luck tt day as to whether u can spot it. This shows capitalism at its best as instead of merging both the zoo and river safari they separate them into 2 diff places so tt they can earn more fr tourists and locals. It is so overpriced and there are so little things to see and the 2 boat rides which cost a grand total of $10 shd be alrd included in the super expensive admission ticket which btw is $28. The 2 boat rides are not worth it too as u really see nothing. Will not come back again even if it is free. Really not worth my money and time to come here and no halal food too so malays beware. Only 2 pathetic chinese restaurants there and the panda bao there cost a whopping $2.90!!!

title: Very Hot
content: As usual, the safari was very well organized. Went there with some friends, i found it so hot. Would recommend this place for families with small children. For adults, it was kinda boring. It was good but i won't want to come back again unless i bring my kids. Very hot, please wear sunglasses, hat, and comfortable shirt and sandals/shoes.

title: Unique approach to an aquarium
content: River Safari is another section of the great Singapore Zoo. It is our favorite, and we could return for more visits. It gives an excellent insight into the marine world in various regions of the planet. There are boat rides, walks through tunnels with marine life playing above you, there are displays and tanks with examples of the world's marine life. The displays are connected by covered walkways and makes this an all weather attraction. And, for some reason, the Giant Panda exhibit lives here as well. The whole park is woven together seamlessly to create a most excellent experience.

title: Interesting & unusual fish, sheltered walkways, good underwater viewing areas.
content:
It was raining when we went on a weekday, so it was very quiet, which was great, although the 2 boat rides didn't work until later in the day. The walkways are all covered so don't worry about the weather & it is all wheelchair accessible.
We ate in the River Safari Tea House before we went in, which was ok. Allow about 3-4hrs, more if you have curious kids. The exhibits are well signed & clear, although they generally tell you more about the species than the individual animal. There are loads of fish we had never heard of, so it was really interesting to see & learn about them. The giant river otters were great, as were the huge underwater tanks, & Kai Kai the panda was funny scratching his bum against a tree, but I wasn't happy with the very small enclosure for the red panda, who really didn't seem happy.
You don't really need a map as you just follow one path through regions & areas. The bats & monkeys are great too - just don't try & touch them!
The staff everywhere were friendly & helpful.
The boat rides - the cruise was relaxing 15 mins on a totally calm Upper Seletar Reservoir, but we saw nothing, & the Amazon Quest ride was pretty naf really - nothing seen & no real purpose to it - a bit unnecessary we thought, again no animals seen nor any real sign of any.
Overall, a very interesting day - we enjoyed it, worth a visit & very easy to get to via bus/MRT - allow 45 mins approx from the City.

title: Good for kids, not for adult
content: It's good place for kids . I expected much more interesting things there however it was nothing much to see. The only thing appealed me is Jia Jia and Kai Kai panda. But they hided from customers so the only thing i saw was...their back.

title: Great river rides and pandas!
content: I would characterize this primarily as an add-on to the Singapore Zoo, with the biggest bonus being the panda exhibit and the leisurely boat rides . There are a few rides, which are definitely of value (though you are not guaranteed to see animals on the rides; they may be hiding - I was a little disappointed to not be able to see the anteater) . If your primary interest is aquatic/river life (ie, if you want to see manatees up close) this is the park for you. Manatees galore! If you want to spend time with the pandas, this is the park for you. We got to see pandas feed, which was fabulous! But for the most part, this is a lot of information about wetlife and ambhibious/fish life. Not for everyone.

title: Scuba Tanks Optional
content:
If you want to see fish and reptiles that are so rare that you either have to go scuba diving or see them in a National Geographic underwater special then go to Singapore's River Safari (Actually some of them you wouldn't want to see while diving because they would eat you!!).

The park is laid out in a U-shape with most of the really impressive fish along the first half of representing all the major rivers around the world.

Strangely, half way through is a panda exhibit where you may glimpse one of the two pandas on loan from China. I say "may" because they are so shy that they had to install cameras in their dens because they spend so much time in their. In fact, the day we went, the female even managed to find a hiding spot away from the cameras view, so we just saw something panda-like on the TV screen. The male was sleeping spread eagled in his pen.

Take the bridge across the lake to the second half, and start by taking the gentle river raft trip. Animals were quite shy here too but it was mid-day, when all intelligent creatures should be taking a siesta. After that I don't remember much of anything worth noting here.

One real plus to the whole River Safari park is that most of it is under a roof or awning so you are out of the direct sunlight, which is a real plus in this tropical heat.

title: Good day out
content: The river safari was great. There are two optional boat rides which I recommend doing. One goes around the lake area and you can see elephants, giraffes and other wildlife. The other is like a ride, it was good but we didn't see a few of the animals. It is worth the money and interesting to see the wildlife from rivers all over the world. The only problem we had was getting there too early as we had a ticket for the night safari too and had to wait. We needed up doing the zoo as well. You can easily do all three in one day

title: An Aquarium about River Wildlife
content:
This all turned out to be a bit different to what i was expecting - but not all bad. The advertising has a picture of a boat cruising down a river. You do get to go on a boat for a short time eventually.
We brought a combo package to the Zoo and to the River Safari with the entrance to each being about 30m apart. The safari is more an aquarium that is about river wildlife and covers all of the major rivers in the world. If you are into aquatic life you will enjoy it and there will be several exhibits you will not have seen before. They have clearly spent a lot of money on this park which is reflected in the standard of the exhibits. You stroll from region to region across long boardwalks before boarding a boat that takes you for a short trip out onto the reservoir that borders the zoo. You get to glimpse a few of the zoo animals from on the water but there is not much else to see.
The whole place is wheelchair and pram friendly but be warned if you are going to double this up with the zoo and make a day of it there is a serious amount of walking involved. If you are travelling with young kids you might want to flick this and just do the zoo and finish in the zoo in the water park for kids - take bathing costumes. Having said all that if you really need to get up close with a Panda then you cannot miss this.

title: Showcasing Marine River Life from Around the World
content:
This is the newest addition to the Singapore zoo complex and attempts to showcase marine life from major rivers around the world.

The park spans both sides of the upper Selatar Reservoir and covers the Mississipi River in North America, Congo and Nile in Africa and the Ganges, Mekon and Yangtze rivers from Asia on one side. Across the bridge on the other side of the reservoir is Wild Amazonia which showcases the plant and marine life from the Amazon (South America).

All the exhibits are essentially giant tanks containing the marine life from the river. To give it an authentic field, the area around the tanks has been decorated to look like the part of the world the rivers belong to.

The Amazon portion also has two boat rides - one (River Safari Cruise) around the reservoir and the other (Amazon River Quest) which takes you around the Amazon rainforest.

Don't miss the Giant Panda forest which showcases two Giant Pandas in their natural habitat. Same goes for the squirrel monkey forest where you can walk among the monkeys. Just make sure you don't have any food on you. Manatee feeding is also a must see. There are portals around the tank at various levels so you can watch the manatees feeding from below (underwater) or above.

Worth a visit if you have a half day. If you are adventurous, you could even do the Jurong Bird Park, River Safari and Night Safari in one day since they are located close to each other. If you plan to do this, make sure you buy the park hopper ticket which covers multiple parks and is cheaper than buying individual tickets for each park.

title: A different animal park
content:
This is one of the zoo park sub complexes. It has three components to the visit.

The actual park has seven big tanks representing the seven biggest rivers in the world. Besides having the accurate flora and fauna of the river the decoration is in tone as well.
Then there is the Giant Panda Forest. It sports two giant pandas (Jia JIa and Kai Kai. ), a couple of red pandas and various birds.
Then there are the two rides of park. One is a lake ride on a big boat with english commentary guiding you through the surroundings. The other is Amazon River Quest. A rollercoaster type of ride which takes you to a beautiful landscaped part of the park with wild animals just a reach away.
For those of you in the first row - the first drop really gets water over you, so protect your cameras ;)

title: Conveniently next to the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari
content: An easy attraction you can do, right after the Singapore Zoo. It's definitely smaller than the zoo itself, so it is not strenuous to cover the grounds. Many interesting river creatures and it's generally shaded, so it won't be too hot to walk around. I would recommend doing this attraction AFTER covering the Singapore Zoo, to cool off.

title: Could be better
content: There are some very impressive fish tanks here but I was a little disappointed overall. The girl who spoke at one feeding time I saw was difficult to understand. The size of the fish is amazing and they are only babies. Go only if you want to !

title: Plentiful of Room for improvement
content:
This attraction has lots of room for improvement. It is not an attraction which I will look forward for a return visit.

Admission tickets aren't cheap, and river rides should have been inclusive in ticket price.

River Safari cruise was extremely boring. A fifteen mins boat ride and we only saw two white rhinoceros, one elephant, two giraffes, all from a distance????!

Amazon river ride was pleasant and somewhat more enjoyable. We got to see more animals.

The only attraction would be the pandas. The female panda was no where in sight! It seems like this attraction was established just for the pandas, and remainder was grabbing some animals from the zoo nearby, flamingo from hiring bird park, crocodile from reptile park and fishes from RWS!

Food and beverage was overpriced. A bottle drink from the vending machine cost $4.50! That is how much half a carton would cost in the marketplace! I don't see why management would sell these beverages at such a high cost?!

We tried the panda bao ($2.90) each, taste was normal. However the panda cappuccino ($6.50) was took a while to be ready and was not hot when served.

Parking was expensive for a public attraction!

title: Lots of Fun and Beautiful Forests
content:
This new attraction side by Singapore Zoo is truly a hit! The Panda forest is awesome! They have Kai Kai Panda who is soo lazy just lying on her bench. Although it looks thinner than some I saw in China or Ocean Park Hongkong, but it is amazing that Singapore could bring this exotic animal.
And they have also a common squirell monkey forest which several monkeys can be playing freely around you. Beautiful!!
The Amazon river cruise is fun! Although not much animals we could see along the journey but it was a brand new experience for me. Love it!!
The giant aquarium is great also.
Really really reccomended for you and the whole family. This is how to enjoy a living zoo in a much more fun way!
Get a free hop on buses from certained and scheduled bus stops near tourist hotels in Orchard-Bugis-Marina and depart from Suntec City. You may buy entrance ticket plus return transfer ticket also in Suntec City. The bus ride to Singapore Zoo complex in Mandai took about 30 minutes without traffic.
Enjoy!!

title: Where are the animals?
content:
We visited the river safari and left feeling disappointed. The exhibits are small and many of the animals weren't available to be seen. The pandas which for many are the main attraction were laying in an area with an obstructed view.

Quote of the day: "The animals are the boss, if they don’t want to be seen, they won’t be" - unnamed tour bus guide

I did enjoy the aquarium, this was the saving grace of the visit, otherwise the trip was a total loss.

title: 2nd to Singapore Zoo
content:
We went as a group of 2 couples and 1 baby during Singapore's National Day, after a great time at the Singapore Zoo.

I heard so much about the River Safari and was raring to try out the river ride but apparently it had already been fully filled. Do book early to avoid disappointment!

The rest of the exhibits are large enclosures which weren't that exciting compared to the Singapore Zoo.

The highlight was seeing the 2 pandas, Kai Kai and Jia Jia, though Kai Kai was very shy, hiding among the trees.

title: A good idea but poorly executed
content:
We visited this as part of our zoo ticket but left feeling disappointed. The exhibits are small and many of the animals weren't available to be seen.

The pandas which for many are the main attract were not out when we first went past, or the second time. We decided to give it one more try and got lucky just before we had to leave. The river cruise was pointless with nothing to see and the same was true of the safari where the animals were out of sight.

This is a good idea but very poorly executed, save your money and spend it on something else.

title: Another Singapore attraction done well
content: The River Safari at Singapore Zoo is done really well with lots of exhibits themed to the the largest Rivers in the world and their inhabitants. The highlight for me was seeing the Panda Bears, although they were sleeping they are such beautiful creatures. I would definitely recommend a visit.

title: Pandas are the star attraction!
content:
An interesting way to spend a few hours is to visit the River Safari in Singapore. A fairly new attraction it consists of a number of large aquariums with species of fish from various parts of the world. Very educational for young ones (and old) as each area has quite a bit of information on the various fish etc. The best part is seeing the two giant pandas who are VERY cute - even though they tend to be asleep for most of the time! The monkey area is also worth having a look at as is the adventure river safari ride. Not Universal Studios by any stretch of the imagination, but still a worthwhile attraction to visit if you have done everything else in Singapore!
The attraction is next to Singapore Zoo and as it should only take you 2-3 hours to visit, a good idea is to combine a trip to both places on the same day.

title: Captivating But Could Have Been Better
content:
Visited River Safari on a weekday morning. Best time to visit when there are not so many visitors around. Came in upon opening time. Wished the staff were more enthusiastic to receive their first visitors. A warm smile and greetings would suffice or something creative to create the kind of mood for a safari. Hardly saw any keepers or staff near the exhibits except at the river cruise counter or entrance to some of the special exhibits.

Nevertheless, a good mix of animals seen on display. Enjoyed watching Kai Kai, one of the panda bears having his breakfast up close. That's the reason it's always good to come early. Loved watching Inuka, the polar bear swimming in and out.

Must not miss entering the spider monkeys enclosure. But be sure to keep your sweets and candies safely hidden cos they can smell it a mile away. Saw a lolly taken away by one of the spider monkeys. The safari should have more of such enclosures where visitors get to be really close without any physical barrier between them.

2 water activities you should not miss- River Cruise and Amazon Quest (entrance fee of $28 does not include these 2 rides at $8). The river cruise takes about 15 minutes around a water catchment area. If you're lucky, you'd get to see elephants and giraffes by the river. We saw 1 or 2 wild river otters. Yes, and that's it.

Amazon Quest was alright. It was another ride but on a motorized raft which fits about 8 people. You pass by some animal displays, mostly primates. Quite comical to hear them saying... "Look to the right and you'll see..." You look to the right and you hardly see anything but lots of flora.

If you have a lot of time to spare, it's nice to just sit down and watch the huge manatees, enormous fishes, etc. swimming under water. It's like looking into a gigantic aquarium.

For Muslim travelers, it may be useful to know that there are at least 2 halal food outlets - KFC and Ah Meng Cafe. The first serves fast food while the latter, Asian street food.

title: Had a very good time.
content: It's a very nice place to visit. I visited River safari with my wife and really enjoyed. We really had a very good time. It's very educational for everyone. We really had fun and nice time.

title: Some wow factors
content: If you like aquariums then this is a must. I do not want to give too many spoilers just to say this is a very well planned and thought out attraction. We did both the boat trips and would recommend them as they did enhance the day. A top attraction.

title: Amazing and Educational
content: River Safari is very educational and fun. The aquariums are huge and spectacular especially the tube where you could see the otters swimming above you. The panda exhibit is nice, chilly and quiet for you to relax and observe the panda. The manatees AMAZING huge view of those amazing marine mammals, once you're walking you can see different view of the manatees and dugongs too! The boat ride (not the amazon river quest) had some nice views it is very interactive you can see some animals from the Singapore Zoo too! The Amazon River Quest was short but very exciting there are animals in there that you can't see without going in there.

title: Great set up with one flaw
content:
There is no questioning that this is an amazing place to witness life in and around the major river systems of the world. Everything is of the same high standard and quality as the other Singapore zoo attractions.
My only criticism is that after being told my eldest daughter was not tall enough to go on the Amazon Quest boat ride we discovered that this ride is the only way to see a lot of the Amazon animals (including the Jaguar which is her favourite)
I have no problem with height restrictions for rides. We expect it when we go to an amusement or theme park. I didn't expect to not be able to see a lot of animals when we go to a zoo because my child is too short to go on a ride.
This is a bad planning decision and the reason they are not betting 5 stars

title: An enjoyable experience!
content:
Visited this attraction as part of a bundled package which offers a 50% discount on purchase of zoo+river safari ticket for SG50 celebrations. Fortunately, we started the journey when the feeding of animals also begin (at around 9.30 am - note the park opens at 9 am). This made an otherwise uninteresting walkthrough zoo into an interesting, interactive, fun and extremely memorable experience. Unfortunately, we didn't experience the boat rides as we had the zoo to cover also, but I'd think it would make the experience even better.

Although its called a "river safari", actually its a single pathway walkthrough park with animals on both sides. Its really half zoo and half aquarium and has various mammals, reptiles, fish, birds etc. The giant pandas, red panda, mekong river exhibit and flooded amazon exhibits were truly breathtaking and is well worth the visit.

Getting there is easy by MRT and bus (take bus 138 from Ang Mo Kio station or bus 927 for Choa Chu Kang station) The river safari is located a few meters away from the zoo and night safari, so if you've got the energy, you can do all three in one tiresome day. This is a must visit attraction if you want to see the Giant pandas!

title: Enjoyed the beautiful aquariums
content: I really loved those huge aquariums showing all kind of fish and turtles. The aquariums are very beautiful giving you a good impression on how this animals live in the water. It was particularly funny to walk through the tube with the otters swimming all around (and over) you! The huge aquarium with the manatees was stunning. However, I can't help wondering why the pandas are at the river safari. I would recommend to visit the River Safari, despite not even having done the actual boat ride (I had no time).

title: Pandas in residence
content: Didn't enjoy this place as much as the zoo next door so to be fair this place does give you info on the various famous river systems of the world. Highlight for us was seeing a Panda, this is a rarity for some of us so this made the entry fee worth while.

title: Well, they have the panda.
content: Having read the previous reviews, we went with managed expectations. We went to see the panda and that is definitely the main attraction there. I did also like the concept of categorising exhibits by the rivers. And did enjoy a lot of the exhibits. But it does feel like the zoo is much more value for about the same price, and much more fun as well.

title: Nice place to take shelter
content:
Been to River Safari 3 times over the last year or so. Thankfully 2 out of the 3 visits were free tickets from friends.

Display/ General overview:
Without doubt, it is well-designed. And it is also well sign-posted. Lots of covered walkways. If you like to whine about the hot weather then this is the place... But River Safari is just an enlarged version of the small aquarium you find in many zoos. Just that Wildlife Reserves Singapore decided to expand it to become a standalone attraction and charge a separate admission for it. Cha ching!

Rides (River Safari and Amazon River Quest)
The boat ride was one of the worst way to spend my money. I have no qualms about zoo having something Disney-like. But at least make the 15 min worthwhile for visitors. If you are lucky, you can see up to 3 types of animals. Yes... 3 types of animals. Basically, the ride brings you to part of the zoo and a small part of the night safari.

The amazon river quest is an amusement park water ride. For a water ride, it is too slow and not exciting but for a tour, it is really fast until you could hardly take a decent photo. So you have a choice to make... take a photo or just soak in the sight. The problem is there is no guarantee you can see the animals this way. The fun of going to the zoo is to see the animals and try to spot them. But the river quest took that excitement away.

For the budget visitors/ travelers...
There is no water cooler (drinking fountain) in the River Safari.
So either you suck it up by drinking tap water (faucet) from the washrooms or just pay and pay for bottled water. By the way, tap water is clean and drinkable in Singapore. We have pretty good water purification technologies here.

Food is expensive even by themed attraction standard. A set meal at the only quick service restaurant is between S$15- S$17 excluding drinks. The only thing worth buying is the S$2.90 steam bun which looked like a panda. You can get the $6 panda themed cappuccino if you like a hot drink in our hot weather.

If you never seen a panda then go. If you seen panda before, don't bother unless you scored a free ticket.

title: interesting day trip
content: Having already been to the Singapore Zoo I was looking for something a bit different. This place certainly lived up to expectations although not as remarkable as the Zoo. I certainly felt like it was worth the money, both informative and entertaining.

title: Just go for the pandas
content: I went because of the pandas and it totally worth it. But if you're not a panda freak like me, let me tell you that the River Safari it's lame. The boat ride it's only 15min and we can't really spot the animals because it's too quick and far. We're also told not to stand up in the boat, being sitted just make even harder try to see something in the woods. The rest of the safari, the fishes for example, way better to see in the S.E.A. Aquarium at Sentosa. But, again, because of the pandas I would go again a thousand times.

title: Okay not to put on top of your priority list
content:
If you've gone to the Singapore Zoo, you may well skip this one.

This park offers several displays of fishes and aquatic animals, two pandas, two boat rides but there is really nothing special about them. The boat ride takes you to see the backside of the Singapore Zoo so you're actually be seeing the same giraffes and elephants. And frankly, I don't think I need pay to to see a 'kapok' tree from a distance.

If you've gone to see the aquarium at Sentosa or even in Hongkong Ocean Park, you won't miss anything if you don't see the aquarium here.

I've you've gone to see most of the attractions at Singapore, it's okay to come just to be able to say 'I've been there' but it's also okay not to put this on your top priority list.

title: A Walk Through Aquarium
content:
I really expected to be on a boat when my sister booked the river safari for us. The idea Safari is misleading. The tickets were a birthday present.

There was some valuable educational information about the different rivers in the world and I found the information interesting. The tanks were impressive and well kept.

We chose this over the zoo, because it was undercover and so would be cooler.

Pretty much all a big aquarium. my Brother in law loved it, because he loves fish.
I have to admit I got a little board with all the fish, and very few other animals there. Two red panda and a panda bear, a polar bear and some otters were the other animals.

Maybe the Zoo is a better option if your not a fish person.

title: More amusement park than safari!
content: Nice add-on at this location, but unlike the main Zoo or the Night Safari, this is more amusement park than nature park. Best attraction are the pandas thrown in to attract visitors!

title: Worth it to see the pandas!
content: My husband and I spent an hour and a half here and felt we had wasted both our time and money. We walked the entire park seeing hardly anything. I was so excited about seeing the pandas, but one was sleeping and the other was missing. We stayed for 30 minutes and then left. The boat ride was not worth the money as I couldn't see the animals because the boat was overcrowded. We reached the exit and all I could think about was how much time and money we had wasted. My husband wanted to leave, but I just had to try one more time to see the pandas! I walked all the way back to the panda exhibit and on my way was amazed to see all the animals that were missing the first time around! When I got to the panda exhibit, they were both out and moving around!! I stayed for a long time watching them and taking photos that I will always treasure!! It was worth it, after all!!!

title: Must Do!
content:
THE PANDAS!!
There are only a few select locations in the world that have pandas for public viewing! The Singapore River Safari is one of them! They were amazing and close for viewing. I essentially went to see the pandas but ended up really enjoying ever other exhibit! It is unlike no other zoo as river animals are not your typical creatures. We thoroughly enjoyed the boat tour and the short boat circuit! It felt like you were on a true river safari! Highly recommend this park for people of all ages.

title: Over rated!
content:
Sounded like a great experience but certainly didn't live up to the hype on the brochure
If you book tickets check that you are getting both rides or you will have to buy tickets when you get there.
The River safari only shows another view of animals that are in the main zoo! .. that's if you can see them!
The Amazon Safari is a canal ride and is over before you can blink and most exhibits were empty ... no one could spot any animals.
Seriously the only highlight was the walk through the aquarium before you get to the rides!

title: Great Disappointment
content: Hardly 2 Hour time is enough for River Safari. If climate will allow otherwise no use to go there. Amazon Ride is good

title: Finally saw the Giant Panda, Red Panda, the Dugongs were the highlights!
content:
