We chose River Safari to see the Giant Pandas, but we also saw other great animals at river safari. The Giant Panda is cute, but maybe a bit too lazy, the rarer and smaller red panda while not as cute in the pictures, was more fun to watch, definitely has more character than the Giant Panda.

But the dugongs stole the show. Floating "gracefully" and lazily, Dugongs aren't as common as some other creatures in most Zoos.

We tried the panda themed café, we tried the red bean dimsum, price was reasonable and to be fair, it tastes good!

title: The pandas are great
content: This is a significantly smaller attraction than the Singapore zoo and is best visited as a combo ticket (in order to take advantage of prevailing discounts). The pandas are most impressive but most of the other attractions are fairly average. You have to pay extra for the boat rides: we did the Amazonia, but note that children need to be at least 106cm tall. The dugongs at the end are also good. No drinking water fountains as with the zoo so as to maximise gouging potential.

title: Beautiful!
content:
Definitely worth giving a visit. If your planning on doing the zoo I recommend doing both on the same day and visiting the river safari first and heading to zoo in the afternoon.
We visited both parks on a Friday, the river safari was very quite when we arrived just before opening. We were one of the first in the park and it was really nice to enjoy it by ourselves.
The two pandas Were the highlight along with the boat rides and giant otters.
As it wasn't busy it only took us 2 - 2.5 hours to enjoy the park and gave us plenty of time to head to the zoo after.
Also if you are going to the zoo and are planing on purchasing gifts check the river safari gift shop before you leave. When we were there the river safari store sold similar items and had a special deal with your ticket purchase if you spent a certain amount of money you got a discount which the zoo store did not, the river safari store is also accessible from outside the park so you can go back and purchase items after you have explored the zoo.

title: Good place
content: This is next to Singapore Zoo. Here Aquatic animals and other few animals are kept according to different river themes. There are small and huge aquariums and sea creatures which are worth seeing. The boat ride inside the river safari gives 2 options. One is outdoor boat ride and other is Amazon trail. Later is of short time but good one. Pandas are nice. If you have already visited SEA aquarium in Sentosa island, then you may find few creatures are repetitive. But it is different experience being here. A worth visiting place for people having interest in nature and creatures. ಜಗತ್ತಿನ ವಿವಿಧ ನದಿಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ವಾಸಿಸುವ ಜೀವಿಗಳ ಆಧಾರದಲ್ಲಿ ಮೀನು ಮತ್ತು ಇತರ ಕೆಲವು ಪ್ರಾಣಿಗಳನ್ನು ಇಡಲಾಗಿದೆ. ದೊಡ್ಡ ಅಕ್ವೇರಿಯಂ ಇದೆ. ಅಮೇಜಾನ್ ಕಾಡಿನ ಪರಿಸರದ ಒಳಗೆ ಹೋಗುವ ಬೋಟ್ ರೈಡ್ ಇದೆ. ಒಟ್ಟಾರೆ ಪ್ರಾಣಿ ಹಾಗೂ ಪರಿಸರ ಆಸಕ್ತರಿಗೆ ಒಳ್ಳೆಯ ತಾಣ.

title: Amazing dugong exhibit
content: Dugong exhibit was incredible, but boat ride was not that great. Have heard that the actual river safari is better though so will try that next time. Overall exhibits are very well set up, and if you are going to the zoo and can get the package deal it's worth it. Would not pay the full ticket cost for entry however.

title: Wild Safari!
content: Go visit during off peak or during weekdays as we did. No queues in the attractions, as well as the boat rides. The River Safari Cruise boat ride was so-so because it just circled the lake. Make it an optional ride, if you have time to spare. The Amazon River Quest was better as you get to see wild life riding this boat.

title: One of the best to do in Singapore Zoo
content: Was really a nice and very interesting part of the Zoo as it doesn't just show animals but also to sensibilise the visitors to care about the environment and that they can influence it by their own consumption of fisch and other goods.

title: Rather disappointing
content: The actual boat trip is only 15 minutes - I know it is advertised as such. But the only wildlife we saw was the back of the giraffes we had just visited at the zoo and the back of some elephants. Glad we did not pay a lot of money for it as it was not worth it at all.

title: Around the world's rivers in 3 hours!
content:
Thanks to the Golden Jubilee Weekend that my boyfriend and I got to enjoy the 50% discount for the Singapore Zoo and River Safari promotions.

This is my boyfriend and my first time visiting River Safari. I was simply awed by the sizes of fish found in the different rivers of the world.

As we only had 6 hours to visit both parks, we didn't stay too long in each 'river'. However we still enjoyed ourselves thoroughly as we looked at the different species of animals and fish and reptiles found along the rivers of the world.

Of course the highlight of the trip was a visit to the Yangtze River which I wanted to see the panda. But I the end, our hearts were won over by the Red Panda who endeared itself to many visitors!

The Amazon Quest was really interesting as we got ready to go on an adventure. However do not sit on the first row unless you do not mind your shoes getting wet! When it happened to us, we both were just laughing so loudly!

The River Cruise add on a nice tranquil touch to the trip as the boat ride brought us away from the crowd. It was really peaceful to be out there in the boat, looking at the sky touching the greenery of another side of Singapore which we city dwellers never get to experience much.

We really enjoyed our trip a lot and it was definitely a great place which add on to beautiful memories for both of us.

We will definitely come back again!

title: Pandas were the main attraction !
content:
Went for the river safari with my wife in April earlier this year. Having visited the zoo and night safari previously we decided to try it.
It wasn't as good as we expected it to be. The only highlight was the panda enclosure. There are two rides in the safari as only one was complimentary with the entry ticket we had to pay for the other .try and avoid the nature safari . A total waste of time. The Amazon river quest was better but lasted for like 5-7 mins and hardly saw any of the animals as they were hiding and the boat moved really fast.
Overall was a nice experience.

title: Love the panda!!!
content: It was not so much of the fish part but the pandas were awesome!!! However the pandas itself was probably the only interesting attraction there.

title: hidden cost
content:
If you do not pay an extra amount for the ferry part, you would only visit 60-70% of the total spots. Even you paid for it, you will never think of coming back again to river safari.
The only reason attract people to this place is PANDA. how pathetic!

title: Informative park with an interesting ride
content: The highlight of our visit was the Amazon River Quest ride. Don't sit in the first row though or you'll get drenched. The pandas Kai Kai and Jia Jia were very cute. Very informative and you do get close to some of the creatures that naturally live in or near the rivers around the world. The large aquatic tank where you can view dugongs and other river creatures was awesome. We spent 4 hours in the park and had a really good time!

title: It's very good!
content: If you are looking for a place that educates you in some way, this is the right place to come! It's built uniquely with covered walkways for most part -it shows you history of great rivers and then has half open water tanks set in natural surroundings that contain various fish. The pandas are a big attraction too and so are many animals on the Amazon river ride. They charge extra for the river boat ride and Amazon ride so best is to buy all tickets online you get some discounts. Ideally go early morning at 9 we spent 4 hours there at a leisurely pace. My mother in law was visiting and has leg trouble but we got a wheelchair and she could see everything. Very well designed

title: Around the world's rivers only at River Safari Singapore
content: Yesterday we went to one of the newest attraction in Singapore situated beside the famous Singapore zoo in Mandai - River Safari. It was one of the most unique, inspiring and relaxing attraction I ever visited around the world. It was a rainy day but the attraction itself is mostly wet proof - tents, covers, and mostly indoor and very well air conditioned. I personally like the way they organized the zoo according to the largest rivers in the world as well as definitive information about the animals and their current status in ecology. In addition to freshwater fishes, amphibians, reptiles you will also have some mammals like the River Otters, Panda, Manatees, Red panda, Capybara, Jaguar, etc. The Amazon river quest was a very unique combination of zoo and ride (with drops) although you might be only luck to see some animals unless they hide with the exception of Ibis and Flamingos who are very much visible. The River boat cruise is a wonderful experience to see that Singapore truly treasures and protects their remaining nature reserve - bonus are some wild birds who called the zoo their home. Overall the journey takes you around 3 hours to visit the whole park and the bonus part is you could catch a glimpse of some animals found in the Singapore zoo thru its backdoor. Food and refreshments are also readily available including wheelchair accessibility and clean restrooms. If you are a tourist I recommend buying the tourist package worth 36 dollars so you wont have to line up and buy separate tickets for Amazon river quest and the boat cruise. Truly a magical experience I had with my parents at the River Safari.

title: Unexpected delight
content:
We bought a combined ticket in advance and were less enthusiastic about this park, expecting it to be on a river safari (!!). In fact the river trip is the most disappointing part, lasting only 15 minutes and just seeing a few animals from the Zoo. But the rest of the park we loved.

We had expected it to take about an hour, but this was 4 hours of fun with gently walking and made easily accessible for wheel chairs and buggies. The whole park has covered walk ways so you are cool and never in the sun for the whole visit. Plus, as the less popular attraction, the park was reasonably easy to negotiate with fewer people to walk round.

Overall I would really recommend this place. The pandas were of course wonderful as was the monkey trail, Once you get past the animals in captivity issue. There was lots to see, and our kids were genuinely excited to see round each corner. If you are on a budget take a picnic and drinks, the prices are eye watering.

Getting there on public transport was an event and took 90 minutes. MRT from Singapore to Ang Mo Koi and then bus 138. Once off the train getting to the bus is well signposted and just needs the navigation of the usual Mall experience. The bus stop is also well signposted. The bus is exact change only $2.20 adults(I think) but you can use your EZ card on the bus as well as the MRT, just tap on entrance and exit. Strangely the bus was only a single decker, so be prepared to stand for the 45 min. Journey or push to the front of the line!

At the park there are coaches advertised that will take you back into town for $5 per person, and this takes 30 mins with designated drop offs. They have a time table so check before going into the venue. When we left at about 5 the taxi rank was very long, with no waiting taxis, but seemed the popular route back into town.

title: You need at least 4 hours
content: We took an "organised " tour to this and they spoiled the experience. It was so badly run that we only had a bit over 2 hours to see it, nowhere enough time. Taxis are cheap in Singapore. It is worth paying for one to go here.

title: Nicely organized zoo
content: Nice park. The River cruise goes very quickly and it is difficult to see the animals. The pandas are amazing and a main attraction.

title: Worth it only to see the Pandas
content: If Pandas weren't my favourite animal it really wouldn't have been worth it. The Pandas & Red Pandas are awesome and some of the parts you walk through we're good too but the river safari itself is rubbish as is the amazon river ride.

title: Don't miss the panda!!
content:
The river safari is a very relaxed way of watching the animals.

There is more shelter hence less warmer than the zoo.

It's amazing the different range of animals the zoo has.

We did the river cruise which is okay and nothing great. The Amazon quest was closed when we visited. Have heard that is good fun.

For us the highlight was the panda

A must do when in Singapore.

title: Enjoyable Birthday Visit
content: Found out a week before my birthday that one gets complimentary admission to Zoo, River Safari and Night Safari on one's birthday. I went there on my birthday this year in July. It was my 2nd visit to River Safari. Compared to this, this place is fully shelter, good to walk with under the hot sun. This time, I enjoyed myself even more.. love the manatee pool , and also managed to follow the feeding session, and the animal encountered. A very enjoyable birthday visit. :D

title: Loved this place
content: I don't understand the bad reviews, my daughter and visited the river safari as part of a 3 in 1 ticket with the night safari and Singapore zoo. We did the River safari first really enjoyed the pandas both Red and Giant, nice enclosure and air conditioned which was nice as it was 38C. The aquariums are excellent with some amazing species including freshwater sting rays, giant Mekong catfish and some nice reptiles. The area is well designed and the walkway is excellent. We went on the Amazon ride which was fun but don't expect to see too many animals. The spider monkey enclosure is excellent and we saw jaguarundis as well as some big snakes. The river cruse was good but we only saw elephants and giraffes. Much better than I expected after reading the reviews, if your into freshwater fish, like log jam rides or want to get up close and personal with spider monkeys then go along you'll enjoy it.

title: Exciting short boat ride
content:
It was an exciting short boat ride on the last sector although the journey was short was it was adventurous as we rode down a man made path through a section of the zoo. To be exact it felt like a roller coaster ride on waters.
The first sector was a lot of walking studying the different life along different rivers of the world. Very educational. The highlight was seeing Kai Kai and Jia Jia the two pandas from China. Then it was a leisure river boat cruise. Very relaxing.
I would recommend to spend the entire day at the zoo and river safari as well as the night safari. Don't miss it.

title: Not worth the expense
content:
After looking forward to visiting the river safari, we too were truly disappointed . It's definitely not worth the entrance fee. The Pandas were the highlight of our visit, as for the amazon boat ride we saw very few birds and animals all we saw were the Jaguars, a few monkeys and some red birds, the automated boat travels far to fast, and the automated commentary is even faster than the boat.
The only other things on display were various types of fish, so don't waste time by visiting this place.

title: A nice alternative to a zoo
content:
We visited the river safari as part of a 3 in 1 ticket with the night safari and singapore zoo. We went to the night safari first then the river safari. We'd never been to a river safari, but assumed it was a zoo but with more sea animals and fish. We were correct.
It was a quiet day so luckily we got around everywhere without any bother from others.
We had rides on the boat ride which made a nice change, a bit like a log flume with animals around us. We luckily just managed to get the last river boat cruise around the large lake, it was nice because we could see the giraffes and elephants from the nearby singapore zoo. Knowing now what it's all about I wouldn't go back again, only because I've been and don't need to go again. But if you have time to kill and fancy it try it!

title: Boat Ride & Amazon River Quest: Disapointment
content: This was our 2nd visit to River Safari. In the first visit, two major attractions (boat ride & Amazon River Quest) were not opened yet; thus, we had high expectation to take these attractions in our 2nd visit. However, the reality was much below our expectation. The boat ride was just like riding an ordinary boat and we saw only a glimpse of giraffes and elephants from a distance. The next ride (Amazon River Quest) did not come close to its name. The boat moved quite fast so we did not have enough time to see the surrounding animals. Further, there are not many animals to see and in quite a few cases we could not find an animal at all.

title: Can do better!
content: Thick Singapore foliage offers a great opportunity to explain creatures of a tropical forest such as the Orangutan (ah ment), etc...touted as one of the worlds most exciting zoo/ safari experience, the River Safari's boat ride is painfully low on detail. There is also very little to see except for the thick foliage...the narration/ customer engagement could improve..

title: Good Attraction
content: We have visited this place with a special visitor from New Zealand. He came to Singapore on an exchange program with the school. Although the weather was hot, everyone enjoyed the place especially the boat ride.

title: Expensive hardly any animals
content: Not worth the money. I mean the river quest and boat cruise are ok u get to see an elephant from far. And lots of fishes in tanks but its not mind blowing for the prices paid. River safari makes it sound much more amazing than it actually is.

title: Good attraction to visit
content: i enjoyed the river safari for the most part. The pandas were very lively on the day that we visited which was great. The boat ride however was disappointing. It was very short and there were very few animals to see.

title: wonderful place in very hot Singapore
content: I never thought Singapore is very hot., But Inside the Zoo i felt good. And river safari is really very good. especially Jia Jia and Kai Kai pandas.

title: Great place to Visit!
content:
Visited the place with 3 other friends and we enjoyed it tremendously.
We went early to avoid the crowd and heat, which worked great for us.
We spent about 2.5 hours in it, so after spending the morning there, it was lunch time.

Took the additional boat ride which was a little disappointing considering the additional costs. I'd still recommend it but do choose a day whereby it is not gonna be too crowded or you will have a hard time enjoying the exhibits.

title: Second visit
content:
This was my second visit and was an add-on after we had finished visiting the zoo. Hint: On exiting the zoo walk to your left and you'll see the signs for the entry.

As on my first visit, I enjoyed a leisurely stroll past the aquariums until we reached the Pandas. There is, of course, no guarantee that the Pandas will be out of their dens and visible, however this time we were lucky and one was outside grazing on bamboo.

On this visit I realized that I had actually missed about half of the exhibits on my previous visit. After exiting the Pandas we walked down to the bridge and I realized that last time I had not crossed the bridge. This time we walked across the bridge and on the other side was the Fragile Forrest, the huge Manatee aquarium and various other exhibits.

So, don't think that the only reason to cross the bridge is for the river cruise because about half the exhibits are on the other side! I felt a bit silly when I realized what I'd missed last time.

I'd say that the River Safari is a good add-on after the Zoo, however I don't think that it's worth a separate trip from the city.

title: Nice attraction
content: My sons really enjoyed the marine animals there. Quite an interesting collection of exotic crocs and fishes. The Pandas are lovely. The Amazon ride is OK. I liked it when the boat was elevated to the river level. The Boat Cruise is not as interesting. Buy your tickets online to get a good discount.

title: Two words...don't bother!
content:
This recent entrant into the Singapore Zoo/Night Safari complex really is a waste of money and time but for the panda exhibit and manatee pool.

Exhibits were not well set out...a bit of a pack'em and stack'em concept with little thought given to education and a lot of thought given to how to squeeze every last penny out of you.

The worst part of the whole experience was the boat ride (we chose the quasi-log ride). An additional $5 per person netted you about 10 minutes with a fabulously cheesy tacky commentary that was not in sync to the location of the boat and left you feeling entirely ripped off by the whole experience.

Money definitely not well spent.

Avoid...avoid...avoid...

title: Great to see river inhabitants which are hard to find.
content: Like SEA, they have various of river inhabitants, some of the greatest are manatee, giant mekong catfish, carp, and stingray. They also have the Nile crocodiles are mesmerizing. My only complain will be, it's hard to take a great pictures of them because of the sunlight reflected by the glass. There are two main attraction which you can choose, i don't really enjoy the river adventure, the boat moving too fast, and it's hard to see the jaguar being active at morning or noon.

title: A leisurely place to visit
content:
The place is nothing fantastic to woo about but you can bring your kids to learn a lot about fresh water animals, insert and fishes. There is also quiz to entertain you.
Pay a bit more to cruise the seletar river and Safari quest.

Time needed: Two hour

title: not worth it do Zoo and Night safari
content: not really worth the visit, the boat ride is only 10 mins at the end and you struggle to see any animals. you do get to see the giant panda's but if you are visiting the SEA aquarium you would be better off with the Zoo and Night safari rather that this.

title: Spectacular enclosures!
content:
Great enclosures and nice sunset!
Do look out for the pandas - Jia Jia and Kai Kai and the humongous fishes! Don't forget to take a river tour on the boats (comes at an extra cost) and snap some amazing shots on the boardwalk! I advise you to come in the morning as all the enclosures will be open to the public.

title: Must see panda, but feel being rob when buy meal at mama panda
content:
Yes the goal is to see panda, very cute panda , love it.
After that, I'm buy a meal for my kids, and guess how much i must pay for a meal ?... S$ 17.(look like a kid meal for me).. Whoa....
Overall, the most interesting attraction is panda
So, if you want see Panda, consider not to buy meal in there

title: Would prefer S.E.A. at Sentosa than River Safari
content: The whole experience was a lesser experience than S.E.A. at Sentosa. The only interesting attraction was the Amazon River Quest, which my 7 year old nephew and 4 year old nice enjoyed. Nothing much interesting in my opinion.

title: Fun new zoo experience
content:
We went to the River Safari earlier this week after booking online before we went. We got both boat rides, which we all enjoyed.

The highlights were the pandas (although we only saw one) and the manatees.

We caught the SaEx bus there from Farrer Park MRT and had 3.5 hours there, which was plenty, including lunch. Caught the SaEx bus back into the city afterward, which was very convenient.

title: Alright if you haven't got much else to do
content: I went on a weekday to avoid the crowds. It took 3-4 hours to complete the entire tour. There was nothing particularly memorable about visit other than the panda waking up from its nap and taking a poop. Do this if you haven't got anything else planned, it's not entirely bad but don't make it a priority.

title: A day well spent
content:
Adjacent to the Singapore Zoo, the River Safari is the latest addition to Wildlife Reserves Singapore's stable of world class wildlife parks. It is eminently suitable for families with young children due to its compact size and rather shaded environment. Our family spent the larger part of the day there and did not end up tired and hot, due to the seamless migration from one river zone to the next, unlike a day at the zoo which could send one going off in different directions.

Of greatest value, we found, was the educational aspect. The accompanying text to the aquatic enclosures was simply and sufficiently written, appealing to both adults and children. Undoubtedly the Giant Panda Forest was the highlight, and we were blessed to have been able to catch both Jia Jia and Kai Kai in their respective enclosures doing what they do best - eating bamboo shoots.

Avoid weekends if you can. We were glad to have visited on a weekday when we did not encounter queues for viewing of these delightful creatures, nor for entry, food, other facilities and the boat rides. If pressed for time, you can forego the River Cruise around Seletar Reservoir. The Amazon River Quest boat ride offers more sightings and thrills.

All in all, we were glad that we devoted time for this splendid new attraction.

title: Definitely worse of Singapore Zoo collection
content: This place was smaller, emptier and less "finished" when compared to all over attractions in the zoo collection. There was a lot of walking with no animals and only informational signs. The whole place felt like it wasn't actually ready for the public. It also felt as if they'd shipped some animals to this attraction from the zoo, called it something else and charged extra/double ticket fees. A bit cheeky in my opinion. The giant pandas were very sweet though and their habitat seemed rich in stimulus, the animals appeared happy. The red panda's habitat seemed a bit small and the animal looked bored. The large aquarium was very interesting and definitely the highlight of the attraction. Overall, not recommended.

title: Not a Safari
content:
If you are short of time this is easily avoidable. Except that the pandas are amazing here. The boat ride is Definitely a waste of time and money. Easily avoidable. It's a 15 min boat ride and that's it.
The only thing worth the visit there is the Pandas. Gorgeous Pandas. Your kids would love them. So you can actually just rush through the exhibit avoid the boat ride and head straight for the Pandas.

title: Disappointing.
content:
There was so much hype bringing in the panda, Jia Jia and Kai Kai so I expected quite a lot from this place but ended up with a huge disappointment.

In my opinion, the Zoo and night safari are good enough already. In fact, I highly recommend Zoo because it is so much bigger and there are a lot more animals.

title: Trip highlight
content: We did this on our last day in Singapore and was lovely. You will learn from the boats travel video, it last approximately 40mins ride but all went well.

title: Mystic Rivers
content: All the wild life found in the rivers around the world are kept the star attraction being the pandas also the red panda's.great Amazonian gaint fish something you only will get to see on tv,Purchase the park hopper pass.

title: Bit dated,pandas worth it ,otherwise go to zoo
content: As part of deal got river safari added on for $5 ,doesn't take a long time the fish tanks / aquariums felt pretty old ,to be fair did not get on the river boat ( to hot after spending 6 hours at zoo ) but looked at everything else ,pandas were great and could have stayed for an hour or more watching them ,but overall park just felt dated

title: Clean fun & open greenery
content: There's so much to see all various animals and flamingoes down along the Mandai river. The attractions are nicely spaced out so get a chance to stretch your legs. Sunny blue skies with breeze blowing fresh air to breathe. Panda and various monkeys will keep you enthralled watching their antics. Lots to photo and there's a loop around by "ferry" as well as a boat ride in Mandai reservoir. This interesting place has something for everyone to enjoy.

title: It was great, bit quick
content: I should start out by stating that we went to River Safari (RS) straight after the Zoo. After you've seen the Singapore Zoo any other exhibit is a bit of a let down. Don't get me wrong, the RS was very educational and informative. But it was quick. I feel like they could add more attractions, exhibits, or even animals. The biggest attraction of RS was the pandas. Which seemed out of place when the whole point of RS was rivers and water conservation. I liked RS, but if I had planned a whole day for this I would have been disappointed.

title: Fun educational river safari
content: Very fun, educational river safari! Lots of exotic animals such as panda, manatee, giant crocodiles, Python, jaguar, polar bear, and other unusual fishes! Very well- maintained facility and cleanliness.

title: Sensational River Safari
content: Our visit to the Singapore River Safari far exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed every moment of our stay and would recommend you go if you have time on your hands as it probably took a few hours to go through, looking at all the attractions. We saw our first Pandas and numerous other fish life that amazed us. The attractions are incredible! Plus you can get a meal there as well....! A very clean cafe with proficient staff and good food at reasonable prices! Don't take a taxi, it's very easy to get a train and then change to a bus...very cheap and you get to see the sights and experience the friendly local people. A must do when you go to Singapore!

title: Nice place
content:
This place is not crowded compare to Universal Studio given its main attraction is fishes (and a pair of panda).
Not as many attractions as Singapore Zoo, but it was a nice place to be especially if you like to see fishes and try to avoid jumpinh into huge crowds.

title: Waste of time and money
content: We visited this as it was a latest addition from the last time we visited in 2006...........It is nothing but a ride on the boat around the zoo which shows you animals from far off........which you can actually go and see inside the zoo.......this attraction can be replaced by other attractions in Singapore as it is a total waste of time

title: Cool animals
content: The River Safari has some really cool aquatic animals, including manatees! The tanks are organized by region where the animals could be found. We did not take the River Cruise or Amazon River Cruise because the former seemed to just be a boat ride on the river, and on the latter it seemed that you could see animals that were at the zoo, right next to the River Safari

title: Fantastic River Safari
content: Throughly enjoyed the River Safari. Best part was seeing the two Panda Bears and the incredible Polar Bear underwater.

title: Pleasant day out
content: The River Safari was a nice day out. Its not too exhausting (not like the zoo) so if you want something less taxing then this might be for you. The animals are all displayed according to which river they live in and quite a bit of information is provided. In Singaporean fashion everything is very clean and ordered. The Amazon boat ride is closed for maintenance for a couple of months (so I can't comment on that). My favourite part was the boat ride in the main lake. I got to see the giraffes from the water. I love those guys!

title: Need to make it a bit adventurous/Excitement/Thrill
content:
River Safari is a place where one can actually take a glimpse of living creatures like fish/animals found in rivers like Amazon, Nile, Ganges etc. So, if you are an admirer of animals/fish or have inquisitiveness, you may like to spend your time along with your kids. You can also see Panda in a forest surrounded by Perspex. One can also enjoy Amazon River Quest & Boat ride.

It's a short tour of apx 3 hours & the management may like to review whether existing attraction is good enough to attract tourists on such a high package. More adventurous/thrill rides may be introduced or else it will be classified as "Aquarium" only in near future.

title: A Different 'Zoo' Attraction
content: The River Safari focuses on animals and fish that may be seen on or in the many great Rivers and a choice of a boat ride within a river allows an up close view of many animals that are normally reclusive. The area is linked by a board walk and includes a panda enclosure with the most agile and cute Panda in a huge jungle surrounded by Perspex, an aquarium with a range of other animals. The directions were a little difficult to follow and staff were keen to take photographs at a number of 'experiences'. Ideally a second boat trip (a choice was required between the safari boat or a river ride) that takes visitors down the river should also be part of an inclusive deal as the experience was completed in around 2-3 hours and was of a similar charge to the Singapore Zoo.

title: Nice but a little boring
content: There weren't not much to see. The panda was really adorable and riding boat might be a little boring.

title: Nice collection of under water creatures and cute pandas
content: We spend several hours in River Safari as our kids love to see the animals up close. There is good collection of all kinds of living creatures that live in the water. The area that we can see the pandas and red pandas is nice and cool. You can add more excitement by joining the Amazon River Quest and be prepared to get wet if you sit in the front row. The manatees shown in the aquarium are so huge, in fact, they are the biggest we've ever seen. We really enjoy visiting the River Safari. Free wifi is also available through out the park.

title: not worth the visit
content:
We went to the river safari and walked by numerous tanks of fish and went for a less exciting ride on the boat. Then went on the even more less than exciting ride on the rapids ride.
The only exciting sight we saw was the swimming of manatees around in a very large tank and a baby manatee playing with the vacuum hose of the person cleaning the tank

title: Day out with the family
content:
It's a small attraction, with small exhibits inside, and an average internal ride (which you have to pay for if you don't have a membership).

we purchased the annual membership and used it several times, so it worked out well.

but for a one-time fee, it is expensive, and the attractions are just not that exciting.

there are some highlights:
1. the crocodiles -- if they moved -- were a visual treat
2. the manatees ... those fellas are huge
3. the pandas
4. the giant catfish
5. the little monkeys ... watched them excrete on a poor unsuspecting lady once

ok, so i'm bumping this to an average rating on account of the manatees.

food is expensive. bring your own.

title: A must visit place!
content: They have pandas here! Great atmosphere. Many covered areas, not a problem to visit on light down pour days. Animals look healthy and well fed. An educational visit definitely.

title: A local experience
content: Went with a group of friends with children. Enjoyed watching the pandas and the cruise. The rest of the place was subdivided into famous rivers of the world and with fishes in the tanks. Good for those who love watching these fishes. There was just...More

title: A total waste of time and money
content: River safari is a big disappointment. The pictures look very attractive but going there we were extremely disappointed. It was more like an aquarium and not a safari. The entry ticket is also quite high (28 dollars) but does not include the boat ride. Walking...More

title: River Safari...An extremely enjoyable experience!
content: My friend and I went for a day trip to Singapore's newest wildlife park, River Safari. Located next to the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari, this park has a wide collection of aquatic creatures. Each are divided into 7 major river systems across the world:...More

title: Did not enjoy
content: The pandas were the hit, however they were lazy and hiding when we got there. the river tours were not operating either, a waste of money i feel.

title: River Safari
content: I am quiet disappointed with River Safari. I am expect something awesome like Singapore Zoo but it's not really special after all. It's true that they have hundreds of river specimens and some of them were endangered species, but I don't think i want to...More

title: River safari
content: Took public bus to river safari which stops just outside. First stage is walking through different aquarium areas where there is information on different rivers and aquatic life from different parts of the world. Pandas were the highlight and definitely worth seeing. Both were awake,...More

title: See Pandas and river creatures set in the natural habitats!
content: This park is located next to Singapore Zoo and Nigh Safari. The most famous exhibit here is the Pandas, which are on loan from China. You enter an air-conditioned building, which is set to be like a forest. Depending on the time of the day...More

title: A disapointment
content: We paid for this and went before the zoo - total waste of money and time as we went on a boat around the island with a brief history lesson. Managed to see an elephants back from a distance and no other animals at all....More

title: River Safari
content: Its a lovely amazing safari for kids as well as adults. It has been planned in a very attractive way and you must visit when in singapore

title: Interesting mix - aquariums, panda and river rides
content: A really enjoyable morning out. We went by public bus that stops at the entrance. Lots of fish in tanks and pools, then panda and even a polar bear. The first river ride was a little disappointing as many of the animals were hiding however...More

title: good day out
content:
Good attraction if you have already done the Zoo and bird park, takes about 3 - 4 hours, well laid out and covered walkways through out, so the rain or excessive heat from the sun wont be as issue. the highlights are the Pandas and the large display for the manatees with a small auditorium style seating to realx and enjoy these great mammals.
there are 2 boat rides - the river cruize or the amazon river quest, the amazon river quest is the better of the 2 as you see more animals.
The only negative is that there was no vegeretain food available inside, so if you are vegeterian plan ahead.

title: Small, can be covered within 2 hours
content:
A really small park as compared to the Singapore Zoo, the only real thing of interest (to me) in River Safari are the 2 pandas. The rest are mostly just fishes swimming in tanks.

There are also 2 rides you can enjoy within the park, each costing 5 SGD, or 8 SGD when you buy both. I happened to go for both and I will just say that the Amazon ride went by really quickly and don't ever get a seat in front. There's a reason why it's called the 'Splash!' seat. As for the River Cruise, get a seat on the left as that's the side closest to the animals, and also the side that doesn't leave you hapless in the face of the merciless Singapore Sun at 3 to 5pm.

I finished the park in 2 hours, but had more time to kill as I was going to Night Safari later. I ended up returning to the pandas' enclosure, where I enjoyed the aircon and watched JiaJia amble up and down the length of her enclosure and KaiKai eat bamboo for a good 1.5 hour.

title: Educational with a large aquarium
content:
The River Safari can be toured in about 2-3 hours leisurely on a weekday, including a 15 minutes River Cruise and 10 minutes Amazonia Boat Tour. The attraction ends at a large aquarium which has many large fish (catfish, and carp, etc).

Quite educational for family with young children, and I highly recommend the Amazonia Boat Ride which we saw 2 jaguars.

title: Unique and educating
content: I havent seen freshwater exhibits quite like this one. Although the aquarium tanks at the first part of the tour were so so, but the Manatee freshwater aquarium were quite an exhibit. With a large, flat glass panel that spanned the entire wall of a dimmed auditorium-like room, it was hard not to be impressed. You feel like you literally stand at the bottom of the river, looking up. It was serene, beautiful and educating at the same time. Dont forget the panda exhibits : Jia jia and Kai kai are super adorable !

title: Pleasant for animal lovers!
content:
The Amazon River Cruise is quite entertaining with the animals close by. The other river cruise (the one is the Reservoir) can be quite fun if a few animals can be spotted. The forest area surrounds the reservoir and the animals roam free, so if it is not too sunny neither rainy, then at least elephants can be seen from the boat.
The 2 pandas are adorable, especially if they have just woken up from a nap and are stretching. The polar bear can also be viewed.
All in all not a bad attraction to spend about 3-4 hours with family/friends.

title: Rip off
content:
Just attended the much lauded Singapore Zoo River Safari, now wishing I hadn't bothered. Aside from the fact that the whole attraction hasn't been finished and is staffed by untrained simpletons, it is actually comprised of four components.
1. A walk through average looking aquarium tanks.
2. A stroll past a Panda.
3. A 10 min putter on a boat in a large loop looking a Singapore Zoos fenceline seeing nothing but one elephant, just.
4. An optional ride thru an extra few animals at an additional cost to the already expensive entry tickets.

Avoid the River Safari. IT REALLY ISN'T WORTH IT.
I honestly wouldn't take anyone here even if it were free.

title: Learnt lots about rivers of the world
content:
It was pouring with rain when we visited however it is all undercover. We really enjoyed the wide variety of exhibits & the great information about each river.
Friendly staff and the whole place is well organised.
I think families with children aged 8-18 years would really enjoy it.

title: Meet Tjia Tjia & Kai Kai
content: Here we can meet Panda -Tjia Tjia and Kai Kai, lucky enough both Pandas go walk around n we can have pictures of them. Have many collection of river fish ... Specially Cows n Calves. Inside did have river cruise or boat ride, superb experience that Singapore did have wild scenic view.

title: If you have time and nothing else to do...
content: I went to the river cruise boat ride and the river safari on the same day as I went to the zoo, after the zoo in June 2015. You can see everything you see in the zoo trip, at the safari but not in such detail and close up. So the zoo trip is much better. I wold not recommend the safari boat ride. The safari itself was nothing great. I would give it a skip completely. There is the giant panda, some fish exhibits, the boat ride, a store and the only think you would maybe enjoy is a large tank with large fish in it including Manatee. There is a theater like seating area and if you have time to spare then watch this like you watch construction.

title: Not worth it...
content: A 15 min on the boat with a distance view of greenery and nothing much. you can avoid the river safari and instead spend your time watching the zoo and the various other activities and sight seeing around River safari.

title: My kids were not really excited but enjoyed squirel monkey
content:
Overpriced, not worth for money, the ticket plus boat ride is s$33, my kids were not really excited when they saw the exhibition, we covered that in just a couple of hours, no animal show, Amazon quest is a 10 min boat ride and there were not much animal around, even they charge s$5 for that ride.

The only thing my kids enjoyed was the squirel monkeys, they come near and thump around

title: Don't miss the squirrel monkeys!
content:
Everyone comes here for the pandas, and they are so adorable... But they're quite often found sleeping and the crowds they attract make it hard for one to really appreciate them.

The highlight for me has always been the free ranging squirrel monkeys who have a whole enclosure to themselves. They're free to come right up to you and they can often be found sitting on the handrails right along the guided path of the enclosure. They're simply one of the cutest things on this planet so you must make sure you don't miss them.

The Singapore Zoo is a magical place and hands down the best zoo in the world. The River Safari adds to what is already something that is a must see when visit ting Singapore with children of all ages.

title: Avoid it -- sheer time waste
content:
Don't know why we did this, plus the Amazon River quest. The River Safari is totally overrated, we found it absolutely waste of time and its tiring to walk upto the boarding platform and then have a sun bath in the middle of the River. All we saw was tail of an elephant, nothing else. No animals nothing to see actually.

Avoid at all costs, save time and money!

title: Average exhibits compared to the zoo but worth a visit
content: Worth to visit once just to see the panda. Smaller scale compared to the zoo and we finished the park in 2 hours. For someone who has limited time on hand, I would recommend the zoo over this river safari.

title: Nice place for children and adults
content: Enjoyable place for the kids and adults alike, the place is mostly covered so it is nice for those that dont want to be in the sun much. The highlight would be the pandas.

title: Interesting aquariums and displays but small
content: I enjoyed my morning at the Singapore River Safari as part of a four park package. Being a weekday there were fewer people so there was little waiting time at the attractions. The pandas bears were active, the aquariums were clean and full of life and the manatees were swimming. Unfortunately, there is a smaller range of animals when compared to the nearby zoo, the "monkey experience" only opens in the afternoons on a weekday and the river boat ride that was necessary to see several animals (deliberately no pathways?) was an additional cost! ($5 each trip). Unfortunately, the Safari Cruise was included in the package. This 15 minute short trip by boat on the lake was ordinary at best - it could have been much better and should travel further and for a longer period of time. Basically the "Cruise boat" sailed past a few cages from the nearby zoo and Night Safari. We saw very little. The staff were generally friendly. I travelled to the River Safari by public transport from the city via bus then MRT and then bus (cost under $2 in total). For the return journey I travelled on one of the buses offering $3 fares direct to several key locations in the city.

title: Great visit
content: A great place to go just to see some of the wildlife that Singapore doesn't have. A nice place to bring your kids sight-seeing.

title: Great
content: We decided to do the River Safari as we had been to the Zoo a couple of times now and the River Safari is a fairly new attraction in Singapore and it is attached to the Singapore Zoo. We arrived by public transport which is really easy in Singapore using the MRT and buses as the Zoo etc are quite away from the City . We purchased our entrance tickets and began a leisurely stroll through the River Safari which tells the story of various River systems throughout the world , with wildlife from all of these regions . It is a really good example of a well thought out concept . It is both Educational and entertaining and also is not completely taken over by stupid Tourists and their "Selfies". We paid an extra $5 for the River ride which I felt was great value, although you may not see all of the animals as they are in there natural environment and can be hard to see. It is still worth it.

title: Peaceful and leisurely
content: Enjoyed the river safari a lot because unlike most Singapore attractions (and most of Singapore), it isn't packed to the gills with noisy people pushing their way around. You can take your time, wander around the outside areas, then go inside and sit and watch the manatees which is quite calming. No there's not as much to do as the zoo, but that's kind of the charm really, you can spend a few hours or however much you want without feeling pressured to rush around just to take your snapshot of every animal. Sometimes it's good to just sit and watch them for a bit rather than running from point to point.

title: a memorable experience
content:
i guess the best part about this place was the amazon quest..they take u through the boat , and along the way u see plenty of animals in its environment...perhaps thats the reason they have named it the river safari..
there are plenty of animals to see in the river safari, but if u are visiting the zoo, or the night safari, one can miss this one....!!!!
my kids had a lovely time though ,at this attraction...and if u havekids too, u must see it...remember u will have a marathon walk though ...

title: Only for Panda and RS BOAT
content:
Getting here, we exit at ANG MO KIO MRT, then took the escalator as we turn right going down, walk straight, then another elevator to go up. Then you will see bus terminal. Look for BUS NO. 138 to take you directly to River Safari. I also recommend To purchase EZ Link for your convenience for payment at the MRT and at the bus.

Last year we were here, the Pandas were asleep. We got lucky this year because one panda is awake and eating. What an experience!

I also recommend to take the RS boat, additional payment. But its worth it. Another way to enjoy the safari for close encounter.

title: If It Is Raining Don't Bother
content: I purchased entry as a package with Singapore Zoo. This park is relatively new and some parts and exhibits arent actually finished. The day I was there it was raining, so both boat cruises were suspended for the day (which rendered parts of the park inaccessable). The best part is probably the Panda (because they seem to be quite rare- even in captivity) and Squirrell Monkey exhibits (because you are inside the exhibit with them and up very close while they swing around the trees). This park took only about an hour to go around even walking slowly, so if you do go, packageit up with either the Zoo, Night Safari or both.

title: Not what I was expecting, but more than meets the eye...
content: Looking at the River Safari website, I must have missed the concept of what it actually was, and that there are several parts to the visit. First there is the exhibits associated with the major rivers of the world. These are giant outdoor aquariums where you wander by (under shadecloth) with fish literally swimming up to your nose. Then there's the Panda enclosure. Dont forget to look up for the Red Panda. Not as big, but as cute as their 'not closely related' black and white relatives. From there its on to a sedate river cruise (15 mins) which - when we were there - had no waiting time. What you see depends on time, weather etc. From the water we saw giraffes quite close as they were at the back of their zoo enclosure shying away from the hundreds of tourists there. Also an elephant. Not a highlight part of the visit by OK if you don't have to wait long. From there to the Amazon River Quest ride. Need to do it twice - once to look, another to photograph!. Then there's a wander through the squirrel monkey forest - an enclosure where these small creatures dart over you, under you, and sometimes in your bags (and prams!). Finally there's the Amazon flooded forest - a giant aquarium with multiple underwater views and an 'on top' view. Leave time at the end of your trip to just sit and watch this exhibit. There's the usual food, photos and souviners - all of which we bypassed. Got an express bus from the CBD (with a hotel pickup) - easiest and quickest way to get there. After thinking we'd be in and out quite quickly, spent 4 hrs plus there. Well worth a visit

title: Pandas
content: Loved the trip to River Safari. The boat ride was good but the Amazon quest was worth the extra money. The highlight had to be the Pandas, went early but they were sleeping. Went back after the boat trips, so glad we did. They were both out, moving around and were so entertaining. Very lucky to have seen them both. Great day.

title: Fun educational experience
content:
I wanted to give a positive review after reading the recent less than positive reactions. I think this is an attraction that people will experience differently depending on their expectations and interests.

We were 2 adults - 20 something age son and middle-age (sigh) mom. We enjoyed the River Safari, relaxing in the air conditioned facility and reading the information about the fish and animals in the different river systems. I think it was interesting for us since it was possible to approach as an "educational experience", not just seeing different fish swimming in large tanks. The river fish aren't as colorful as those that we saw at SEA Aquarium in Sentosa, but that's the point of River Safari - we could compare the different river systems and their wildlife. Perhaps it helps that we are from the Midwest USA and experience freshwater Lake Michigan and Mississippi River ecosystems. River Safari expanded on this background.

I was aware of mixed reviews as we walked through the facility and we commented that we were pleasantly surprised based on others' feedback. We thought that the exhibits might be more interesting for older grade school age children who could appreciate the environments being displayed. (We both work with children professionally.) There were many families touring with us that had pre-schoolers, however. I didn't see anyone who looked bored. My only thought was that I would have liked more - not that I thought River Safari as it exists now is small, I just enjoyed the displays so much I would have liked more of them.

The red pandas were active while we were there - cute, cute, cute. Only one of the larger pandas was out - sound asleep. Still, it was fun to see pandas.

We took both the River Quest and Safari Cruise. I made the mistake of sitting in the sun on the Safari Cruise. Few animals were out and there was a young child who continually shouted his excitement at seeing the lone elephant, so we couldn't hear the commentary. I would skip this ride next time. The River Quest was fun. The animals were out and close to the boat for viewing. I enjoyed this ride, but it is short. I would skip if the lines and wait were long.

I would definitely return to River Safari.

title: An Average Attraction Overall
content:
My trip to the river safari was back in 2014, in short the main highlight for the entire park would be the panda and the river cruise, the queue for the river cruise would take a bit of your time over there as well.

To summarize my experience for river safari, if you're a keen animal lover my advise would be visit the Singapore Zoological Garden which is just a few min walk away from River Safari...... Unless you are there for the panda....

title: Different experience from normal aquarium
content:
What would you expect from aquarium?

Normally, you can see shark, coral, dolphins and sea lion shows...etc., but none of the above can be found in the River Safari.

Yes, we are talking about rivers.

The River Safari guide you through the Mississippi River, Congo River, River Nile, Ganges River, Mekong River, Yangtze River and definitely you can't miss the Amazon River.

You can see over 200 species of animal which are living in or around the rivers, from those over 1000kg Manatee, the Jaguar to the small monkeys. Some of the animals are not easy to be found in other aquarium.

And don't miss the Amazon River Quest. A tip for you: don't try to capture the animal by your camera, watch and capture them by your eyes and mind.

Lastly, the food in the mama Panda kitchen is quite nice, unlike other theme parks.

title: Amazing to get to see the Pandas
content: The ticket to the river safari was discounted with the zoo ticket, if one could visit both on the same day. We entered at around 3.00 pm after visiting the zoo in the first half. The boat cruise was just a ride on the Selatar reservoir and was quite mundane. But I guess tourists might find the history and the scene fascinating. especially the efforts taken for its maintenance. The amazon river cruise was very artificial and needs much imaginative improvement. The queues for both were long and the wait time was as long as 40 minutes. The only spectacular thing to watch in this part of the zoo are the pandas. We could watch very closely their antiques and it was a real pleasure. As are most areas in Singapore! very beautifully maintained. But unlike the zoo, not worth going more than once, unless of course you are a panda fan.

title: If you an animal lover, this is your choice.
content: Nothing special, because I have been many zoos. It was okay. You can enjoy your time with many kinds of animal.

title: If u are a fish lover
content: If you are the fish lover ,you must go for this place. Different kind of fish , colourful and huge. Interesting with panda can try to visit,if not i rather choose for zoo. The price is not cheap and the boat ride is only abt 15 mins.

title: can give it a miss..!
content:
What a sham! It is so average its not funny. Complete waste of time. The only thing worth seeing were the Pandas (thankfully airconditioned compartment), but all the animals are so fed up of tourists and the heat that they turn their back on to you or hide in the bushes!
No effort is made to feed the animals or do something so the tourists get their money's worth of visuals! We took the Amazon boat ride and didnt see the black cat. It was hiding! only saw a few flamingos.
Most of the animals are behind a glass wall, you cant even tell if its alive or not.
Be prepared to deal with the heat! They need to install water mists systems and large fans like in other countries safari parks!
There are dining options inside and outside, but mostly Singaporean and Malaysian
cuisine! Its about time they need more variety added which need not be super over priced just because its a tourist attraction!

title: love the amazon boat ride
content:
We (me, my husband, and my 4.5 year old son) went to visit river safari after we visited the zoo.
I thought it would be boring but I was pleasantly entertained during the visit.
Bought the entrance ticket+boat ride. There are two boat rides, the cruise and the amazon river quest, we took the latter one, and it's so much fun!
The track for river safari is very clear, so we just follow the track throughout the "river" which actually collection of aquariums filled with animals that fit the river theme. There are quite a lot of enormous aquariums, and it's amazing how everything is so neat and well kept.
There also two cute pandas here (I don't really understand why don't they put the pandas on the zoo).
No water tap, food is available in front of the next door zoo.
I think two hours visit of the safari would be enough.

title: A real surprise!
content: After walking the Singapore Zoo for most of the day, we decided to check out the River Safari next door! It was a real surprise - really interesting, easy to navigate, great exhibits. The major river zones of the world were explored. A real surprise was finding the the two pandas living there - and a wonderful walk through enclosure with monkeys! The displays are all freshwater environments so very different to the normal aquarium. The last aquarium you come across is breathtaking - a giant freshwater aquarium that is viewed below and above the water. The dugongs and large fish had so much space! There is a river "cruise" - not worth the $5 for the trip! It only goes out onto the resevoir and you get told about giraffe hair and ostrich eggs. The river "ride", though, is really good as you get up close to numerous riverside animals - it was good fun. If you're going to Singapore don't miss going to the River Safari!

title: Small but nice
content: Lets face it... the only reason I came was to see the pandas. I was not disappointed! I could have watched them all day if I could. There were also other highlights such as the manatees, but otherwise it's pretty much ~$30 just to go and see some pandas. I was expecting more stuff for the price but it is pretty small. It is wheelchair friendly. I'm not sure I would go back again but it's definitely worth ~$30 to see the pandas, red pandas (firefox!), manatees, and other stuff at least once in your life if you haven't seen them before. If the pandas weren't there, it probably wouldn't be worth $30.

title: PANDAS
content: Yes!! The highlight was the pandas for us. After being told buy our hotel that there were pandas in the zoo witch unfortunately there weren't we then brought tickets for the river safari witch was an awesome experience it is a bit of a walk around, however there are some awesome animals that you may not have seen anywhere else. They also have a smaller ride there as well witch takes you through some enclosures and things all so much fun truly and awesome experience. We did singapore zoo, the night safari and river safari in the same day :)

title: Unexpectedly small zoo
content:
This zoo wasn't what we were expecting. First it was small and easily accessible for young kids to walk around which was great. But it was more of a one way tour last various enclosures than a "river" zoo as perhaps we had expected.
The river safari ride that apparently books out sometimes was very overrated. It was really just a short cruise around the back of some enclosures - for example the jaguar park cruised past with nothing to see. My four year old loved the "ride" though so maybe it was designed with kids in mind.

title: Fantastic! Pram/Wheelchair friendly.
content:
I spent a lot of my childhood at the Singapore Zoological Gardens and the River Safari (along with Night Safari) are in the same area. Everything is well presented. Area very easy to move prams and wheelchairs around (Except for one ride which is clearly highlighted on the web site)

Panda's are in an air conditioned area which is popular for many reasons. Feel free to go early to the panda's but as the river safari area is not very big, you can double back to the beginning.

We had a fun surprise when we started with the morning feeding session with the snapping turtles. It turns out that the feeding session leads into a little tour from start to end exhibits with little breaks in between. Our keeper was very jovial and presented things well. Certainly a great experience for children and adults alike.

The little ferry ride around the reservoir is very cleverly done as well. You see into part of the zoo enclosures and the reservoir is so well forested that you would never know you were in the middle of the vibrant city.

Highly recommend a visit to the River Safari. Go early when it's still cool though.

title: Pandas away to mate!
content:
From the zoo, we walked to River Safari where aquatic animals are grouped according to their habitats in the great rivers of the world. It was interesting to see and relate them to the rivers. The walkways past the aquariums are sheltered, providing a comfortable visit.

Unfortunately, at the Giant Panda Forest, we did not see the 2 giant pandas as they were removed for mating! However, we saw the red pandas. The multi-storeyed aquarium at Amazon Flooded Forest was very interesting.

Both Singapore Zoo and River Safari are fantastic zoos and a great opportunity to learn about and appreciate the animal kingdom.

title: Admire Pandas, not behind glass walls
content:
I have visited several zoos, but Spore has done it very well to exhibit the pandas in a cool enclosure but with open- concept so you can admire n take pictures of JiaJia n KaiKai without the glass walls which prove to be challenging for aspiring photographers.

Don't miss the Boat ride ($5 additional)... Though the ride is short, you get to see several other animals not visible when u are on the walk path. I especially enjoyed seeing Jaguars (much more majestic looking than leopards) n bright red colored birds, etc....

River Safari also offers water related creatures, like Alligators n there's also Alligator-Turtles with alligator like mouth/beak! Also a underwater theater where u view stingrays, manatees, and many other fishes...

title: I went there for the pandas but found some of the exhibits interesting too :>
content:
I had wanted to visit River Safari for the pandas, and after my friend told me it's "pretty interesting", I scooted down the moment I could go on leave. We arrived around 9.15am the day before Labour Day and were one of the few people roaming around as it was a workday. We took our time walking around and had a bit of fun playing spot-the-creature as we moved from tank to tank. There were many swimming creatures and some caught our attention with their metallic skin, duck beak-like mouths, giraffe print etc. The paddlefish is quite a hoot. The two huge crocodiles were stunners with armour-like hide and powerful-looking tails.

We did not manage to spot all the animals, as can be expected, and did not get up close and personal with the monkeys as the Squirrel Monkey Forest area was open only after 1.30pm on weekdays, so if the kids want to do this, do check the opening hours.

To reach the pandas, you have to cover about half of the entire route, so that might take 1 hour, depending on how much time you spend gaping at the piranhas, queer-looking catfish etc. We finally got to the pandas. Jia Jia was about to, ARGGGH, retreat into her cave when she heard a snap. Something had fallen to the ground. She looked down and saw a bamboo stick, so she sat down and proceeded to chomp on it. She spent quite a bit of time doing this, so we went to see Kai Kai, who was also chomping away, but on his back with his legs splayed open. He really looked like he was having a good time. When we went back to Jia Jia, she was still busy with her food. They munched and munched and munched. Finally, Jia Jia got up and walked around the compound, giving us slow fingers a chance to take multiple shots of her. Thank you JJ for your cooperation!

The red pandas were cute too. One climbed onto a tree branch hanging overhead and I saw it peering down at me, perhaps weighing its chances of successfully landing on my head and making a break for freedom... Another one walked round and round near the glass enclosure panels, much to the delight of camera-toting school children. I could not decide if the red panda was stressed or if it was simply scent-marking. The shop near the panda compound carries merchandise not available at the shop near the entrance, so if you see something you like here, buy it there and then, especially the panda-themed stuff, as this shop has the entire collection.

I like the manatees. The scene was kind of dream-like with the blue water and dim lighting. I saw two manatees getting intimate and later one hugged the other from behind, awwwww.

We took the Amazon River Quest ride. The staff kindly asked if we would mind getting wet, and then made arrangements for us to sit in the third row so we could stay dry. The boat ride was short, maybe 10 minutes, but it went pretty fast so we were busy whipping our necks to the left and to the right. There were wolves and flamingoes and tapirs and monkeys etc and we came pretty close to the red birds, but we did not manage to see everything.

I think I saw at least one new exhibit under preparation, so I might make another trip, but not anytime soon, cos I am not into swimming creatures, so the pandas made all the difference to me...

title: Panda
content: Well worth a visit, at the time of our visit the Panda were awake and walking around, this is the first place i have ever been to that have see that normally the Pandas are a sleep and don't for get to do the ride

title: WELL WORTH THE EXPERIENCE
content: Having already been to the adjacent attractions of the Zoo & Night Safari & with limited time on this trip in Singapore we were fortunate to be able to catch a SAEX Bus right outside our Hotel - The Peninsular Excelsior. Because we bought the entrance & Bus tickets on the Bus at arrival we were given a discounted price. For example our return Bus trip cost $10.00S & obtained a few dollars off the entrance fee. Our tickets also entitled us to a "Free" boat trip down the "Amazon River". The exhibits take you along covered walk ways past aquariums & live animals from the Mississippi ,Nile ,Ganges, Mekong & Yangtze Rivers. Beautifully done.

title: ok ,,,, once and done
content: The river safari is right between the Singapore Zoo and Night Zoo. It is a separate park and requires a separate ticket. It is not as big as the zoo. It is more of an enlarged aquarium with some animal exhibits. There is boat ride along the lake which is not really worth it. The log type ride is refreshing but you do not see too many animals and since it is constantly moving, you do not get a really good look at them. If you have a whole day, you could do all three parks but it would make for a very long day. The exhibits are interesting covering the different major river systems of the world but I do not think it is worth the separate admission. This falls into I did it once but probably not again.

title: different look of singapore
content:
For children and more green and nature feel, try river safari. located in a 1 stop area along with the singapore zoo and night safari. from city center, around sgd20+. if not, can use MRT and continue with bus.

the highlight of the place are kai kai and jia jia the panda which nested in a cooler area. the place is well built to accommodate the wild life.

there are several place to dine near the ticket counter.

with additional sgd5, which can be bought inside, we can ride a small boat in the amazon river, pay attention to the children minimum heights for the boat trip.

title: Well Worth A Visit
content:
Wasn't sure what to expect here but its basically a reproduction of various famous rivers from around the world with giant pandas & all sorts of other wildlife, alot of which is underwater in superb aquariums.

Our visit included a really good boat trip which I would like to have repeated but even though the place was empty we were told we couldn't (not sure why...).

Unfortunately we had a limited time here & would like to have stayed longer but its a lovely place, full of interesting stuff & well worth a visit.

title: Wonderful visit to see the pandas!
content: We visited here in December 2014 on our stopover in Singapore before our return home to the UK- we loved it. The highlight was the pandas - they were beautiful and the boat trip around the reservoir was good too. We dropped into Mama's Panda Kitchen and tried the Panda Pau dessert, it was very nice!

title: Really enjoyable day out
content:
I really could not make up my mind about this one, after reading the reviews I was not that keen to go but had promised my daughter we would see the pandas. And very pleased we went.
We enjoyed the boat ride, maybe we are better animal spotters than others, or maybe the animals just happened to be out when we did it! It helped that we went midweek - I imagine it would be very frustrating to fight the crowds and wait in long lines for what is admittedly quite a short ride.
Loved Kai Kai, the otters and the manatees, and the other less dramatic exhibits were also interesting & well done.
Would really have loved to have done the zoo too, but time did not permit. Still happy with our choice though, we saw a lot of animals we had not seen before.

One thing which was frustrating was trying to get to the zoo in the first place!! Remembered that we had to get tickets at Suntec. Which turned out to be an enormous maze of shops and offices. NOTE: Get off at Esplanade MRT and follow signs to Suntec City Mall. It'll save a lot of time. The ticket booth is next to the Adidas shop on the outside of the Mall (Nicoll Hwy) You can get off at a number of stops along Orchard Road on your return trip. (think you may also be able to get onto the bus at those points too …)

title: Ok OK.. not compulsory
content:
We visited river safari, it took about 3 hours to see all and do the boat ride. Its good for first timer, but i think SEA world at Sentosa is much better than this. Anyways if you have no time and want to see one aquarium then this is a choice. Underwater world at sentosa is other choice. SO dont have all three in yur visit list and have only one of this.
CAUTION : Nothing vegetarian option for food inside, Be prepared if yu are vegetarian and with children.

title: AMAZING PANDAS!
content:
We only visited here, as I've always wanted to see Pandas and thought this opportunity was too good to miss. We had a short day in Singapore from the cruise ship. Had done no homework on the zoo, just knew where the Pandas were and was determined to see them! I hadn't realised how far out of Singapore the zoos are. We took the MRT from the cruise terminal and was told it would probably take us an hour to get there. In fact it took nearer 2 hours in the end! The MRT train took 30 mins to get to the stop we needed, then we had to cross over the road/underpass to the bus station and get the bus to the zoo. This was the unpleasant part of the journey, as it was stuffed full and stopped at practically every stop! We paid approx. £13-14 each to enter the River Safari. I personally don't think this is too expensive, the attraction is very modern and well kept and they're having to care for rare animals/reptiles, which must cost a fortune with all the specialist care and attention they need 24/7.
I have to admit, as time was very limited for us, as we had to prepare ourselves for a possible 2 hour trip back to get our ship, time was very precious, and as my only real purpose was to see the pandas, I literally rushed through all the reptiles/fish, with only a fleeting glance, as I didn't want to shorten my panda visit.
The Panda enclosures are lovely. They are very pretty and attractive and SO cool with the air con, which is a welcome feeling against the heat and humidity of Singapore! You are told to whisper only and not use flash on your cameras. The Pandas weren't out when we arrived, and their food was being laid out and hid. We waited for a short few minutes for the hatch to go up and then there was a collective gasp as Kai Kai poked his head out and plodded out into the enclosure! It was a feeling I won't forget! I felt very honoured to be able to witness such a beautiful, rare animal so up close and wow, was he on form! It was as if he was performing for us! The keepers hide/place his food and titbits well, so that everyone can get a good view of him as he wanders from one area to another. He obviously knows where the food is going to be and is proud to put himself on display - he was awesome! We then went through to see Jia Jia. She is apparently much shyer and doesn't always make an appearance, but we were lucky and she had quite a good romp about to find her food, though she didn't put herself quite on "display", as Kai Kai wanted to!
Our long, uncomfortable bus journey had been worth it, once we'd seen the Pandas, it is something I will always treasure. And thankfully, the bus ride back was only about 25 mins and much more comfortable!
The souvenir shops in the River Safari are well supplied with a whole host of goodies and in my opinion, well priced and not too expensive. I also think the same about the small amount of food and drink we bought here too. I feel they could have priced things higher and people would still have bought them, so it was nice to see them not abusing the situation. Rest rooms were clean, modern and plentiful.
I wished we had more time to visit the main Zoo, as I'm sure that must be amazing if the River Safari doesn't compare, as in my opinion, it was full of amazing creatures, all well housed and cared for.

title: rather disappointment than satisfaction
content: As compared to the other parks, unfortunately this was no good. By the time we arrived at past 10 am, the next available boat slot was after 3 pm. The property isn't that big, for sure not that big enough to spend 4+ hrs waiting for the boat slot, with 3 young kids. The pandas compound was good, but apart from that nothing special. Personally wouldn't recommend, not worth it, unless if seeing the giant pandas is your main goal.

title: As only Singapore can do.
content: Fantastic !!!! To be able to see all the creatures of each of the major rivers is amazing. The 2 Pandas were awesome & 1 in particular was very interactive, climbing trees etc. the Amazon River cruise for $5 was great value. The entire park was extremely well done.

title: Pay if you want to see all the sights
content:
The place has a good collection of aquatic and amphibious animals living in the various river habitats. Half the park is friendly to families with prams and young children as there is a path for prams.

As for the other half. I would say it is not very welcoming.
First of all, that part is only accessible via a boat ride, which you have to pay additional to get on. This means that you are forced to pay additional if you want to see all the attractions, not sure why that is excluded from the entrance fee. It is understandable if the additional is for riding on the boat, but there is no other way of exploring that part without paying to take the Boat.
Secondly the park also states that only people who are able to get on the boat on their own can use the ride. This excludes families with children and the disabled.

So, in summary, this is a place with many unique exhibits, but unfortunately these exhibits are not for families with children and the disabled.

title: Not comparable with the zoo
content: It's not there yet. The Singapore zoo is outstanding. One of the best I have ever seen. The Night Safari is really fun but the River Safari is not yet ready to follow the great experience you can get in the outstanding and stunning Singapore Zoo. Esp when the giant pandas are away then it's not worthwhile the money. They need to upgrade or lower the prices. Prices for rides have to be paied separately (and quad again).

title: Pandas are great
content:
This won’t get a return visit. We went later in the day with the intention of then going to the night safari. What a disappointment. The boat rides are very average and you do not see much – in fact I believe a lot of the animal enclosures on the theme park style ride were uninhabited.

After seeing all the park we were out in under 2 hours which meant we had a long, long time to fill in before in was night safari o’clock.

The Pandas on the other hand were great. I had never seen one before and got excellent views of both pandas.

The pleasure of seeing them made the trip worthwhile otherwise I would have been real disappointed

title: A good addition to the SIngapore Zoo attractions.
content:
The River Safari is the only attraction int he Singapore Zoo we haven't been to so we decided to give it a go. The displays for the various great rivers of the world are interesting with information and trivia all over the place.
The attraction is not as huge as the zoo but the layout is good. We also enjoyed the ride in the Amazon River section which was fun and interesting, bringing you closer to some animals and birds of the region.
The fish display was good. There were really huge manatees in the aquarium and very playful otters.
The pandas were a letdown as they were both asleep during our visit but the pair of red pandas were adorable!
