The River Safari together with The Singapore Zoo and The Night Safari are must-see places. They are very beautiful and the displays are informative.

title: River Safari experience
content:
My hubby and I took my little girl about 15months to River Safari on a weekday to avoid crowded.
Unfortunate it’s start to pour heavy rain when we reach, but we still proceed ahead
Once we went in, we are glad that most of the area are sheltered.
There is stroller rental available at the ticketing counter. If not wrong, the rental cost S$9.00

On the Panda area, we only managed to see Kai Kai. For Jia Jia, we saw her inside thru the TV screen.
Look like she’s too shy to come out.
Not forgetting to enjoy the Panda Bao in the Panda café and Panda cookie are available for purchase
And due to down pour, we got our refund on the boat ride which we used to buy souvenir from the shop
My girl enjoy looking at the big fish aquarium at near the end of the journey.

The whole area aren’t that big, a couple will be enough to cover.
Overall experience is good

title: Worth a look if you are going to the zoo first
content: Can spend around 2 hours here. Panda exhibit was really good, and a nice cool relief from the hot/humid weather. Lots of aquariums. Our ticket included either the cruise of boat ride - we chose the boat. It went very fast and didn't see many animals, and was over after a few minutes. Given how great the Singapore Zoo is I was a little disappointed. However glad I went on the same day as my visit to the zoo so didn't make a special trip. Photo as you enter is against a green screen, would have preferred a real photo

title: Not very impressive
content:
What they have in this place is more of a 'river exhibition' than a river safari. There are exhibits about 5 different rivers of the world, their vegetation, aquatic life etc .. and then there are fishes in aquariums. To their credit, some of these exhibits are really good. But do not expect anything out of the ordinary. It is just like walking through a museum/aquarium. We found it quite over priced at SGD 26.

The highlight of this was viewing the giant pandas. We were seeing pandas for the first time in our lives. Just because of this we did not end up regretting taking the river safari.

We also took the amazon river quest for an extra 5 dollars. This was a fun ride but ended too soon at 10 minutes.

Overall this is a good experience, especially if you are interested in seeing pandas. But can be safely skipped without missing much if you are hard pressed for time.

title: Wonderful concept to showcase animals!
content: This is one of the main attractions that you'll have to visit when you're in Singapore! If you are an animal lover but don't have the luxury of time visit the zoological gardens for the whole day then you should visit this place. 3 to 4 hours is all you need to see all the exhibits and have fun! The pandas are definitely the highlights. The boat right in my opinion wasn't that worth it as it was short and some of the exhibits were under renovation. Overall, visiting the River Safari is really a memorable experience!

title: Not that worth it
content: The River Safari is way overpriced. At 28 per person (internet price) + 10 for 2 boat rides, it should have been a day-long attraction. In reality, it only lasted us 2 hours - and that was because we went around the thing twice. The exhibits are not that interesting - I don't know if the river safari should be blamed for that, considering that fish, regardless how 'unique', pales in comparison to its mammalian counterpart in the neighbouring zoo. There are 2 boat rides - the first takes you around the lake, the second is a theme-park-styled ride. The first one was boring. There was nothing to see. The guides tell us that if we look hard enough/ are lucky enough, we might catch a glimpse of the giraffe/ other animals in the neighbouring zoo. well, no luck there. The second is way too fast, as echoed by other reviewers - out of the 20 animals you're supposed to see, we probably only managed to see a total of 6 - 7 between the two of us. Overall, I believe those two rides should be incorporated into the $28 ticket price; they're just not worth the extra $10. Also, I don't see the big fuss about the pandas. They hardly move. Of course, it's not their job to entertain us. But to house them inside a giant air-conditioned room that mimicks Chinese mountains, and to set them up as the 'main attraction' of the safari is just too much, iom. The only thing that was interesting was the last part - the amazon rainforest flooded 10m+ tall.

title: Not as impressive as the Zoo..
content:
I must say, was not so thrilled with this place.. I prefer the bird park or zoo anytime..
It was quite sparce, n not much animals or exhibits to see..
The main attraction.was the Panda's.. Tt too was such a let down as most times both panda's were sleeping in.sum corner.. Nothing much too see..too photos of e fake panda figures more dan e real ones..
The boat ride was e biggest joke! It was like a boat ride along a narrow drain.. Unlike the huge boat and vast river tt it was advertised as.. No animals were in sight also.. The most boring ride ever..
Less dan half a day is needed to finishing the whole "safari"..
I wud suggest gng to the zoo or night safari instd..

title: Only if you have visited the zoo and if you have a full day.
content:
We purchased a double pass for the zoo and the river safari. The zoo is excellent, 5 stars and spent an easy 4 hours and thoroughly enjoyed it! If you have a choice or time to do one. Go to the zoo!!! Only do the river safari if you have time to go and happy to spend 30+ dollars on something less value for money than the zoo. Finally important to note. You will only need 2 - 2.5 hours in this park. You need minimum 3.5 - 4 for the main zoo if your gonna plan to see both.

The fact that the "river safari" has two pandas on the front of the flyer should have been a bit of a warning. The park is quite good as I will detail but only as we were fortunate to see the pandas and we had just spent a great time at the zoo.

The start is ok, quite a step back from the zoo and being literally surrounded by animals and nature. The river safari is more a "work in progress" and is more a walk through as opposed to a maze of animal enclosures. The pandas were great, but we were lucky as it was feeding time for one of them after a ten minute wait.

The included boat cruise was quite disappointing. Not much to see and nothing new that wasn't seen the zoo. Miss if short on time. Quite accidentally we found ourselves in a little bird/reptile show that was actually quite cool. Got close up to birds and had photo opportunities. This was near the waiting area for the boat ride/near the cafe. We skipped the Amazon boat ride so can't comment.

The remainder of the enclosures/tanks with animals and fish were quite good and the species were interesting, especially the larger aquariums! Pretty neat.

Overall this visit was good, very much inferior to the zoo but the pandas and aquariums were highlights. As stated earlier visit only of time permits. Go to the main zoo first!

Note: we took the train/bus from the city. This was excellent but did take approx 1 hour from the city.

title: Not good for aquatic/marine life but for Pandas, take your decision
content:
As the name suggests, River Safari is meant to be for aquatic/marine animals. It does have this but not enough to compare it with other similar attractions at Singapore, i.e. SEA Aquarium.
River Safari is located adjacent to the Singapore Zoo, so you may think of covering both the attraction at the same day. River Safari will need about 2 hours to complete the round.
To distinguish itself from other similar attraction on aquatic life, River Safari has designed on the lines of major rivers of the world. It has Amazon, Congo, Ganges, Nile and Yangtze rivers. The exhibitions for these rivers are very small, and do not have enough exhibits. Except for Yangtze, other rivers have very less space and animals for exhibition.
There are two boat rides, I would suggest for Amazonia quest as the other one is a cruise ride and not much interesting. Amazonia quest ride is about 5 minutes, and it takes you through wild life of Amazon rain forests. You can spot animals during your ride.
The star attraction of this River Safari is two giant Pandas, Kai Kai and Jia Jai, male and female respectively. I found that these two pandas mated here for the first time and therefore they are Singapore's pride. I agree, as Pandas are shy creatures and having them mated here is a big step towards their conservation.
The key point is that if you wanna see Kai Kai and Jia Jia then you have to go for River Safari, otherwise this attraction can be skipped in my opinion.
Opposite to Panda exhibition, there is a glass wall to view Inuka (polar bear at Singapore Zoo). If you have missed Inuka during your Zoo visit then you can view it in River Safari. Check the feeding times of Inuka so that you do not miss it.
Overall, an average experience, not much to see and do inside and the attraction does not meet my expectations.

title: Nice place but don't ride the Amazon River Quest
content: The place is so nice and the animals is quite a lot, but don't ride the Amazon River Quest, not many animals shown and some of them are not seen

title: Can be skipped
content: Nothing much to see. Some animals were hiding. We didn't see the pandas because it was their mating season. The highlight was the River Cruise but it was just 10 minutes long.

title: Great little zoo
content: There is a section of the zoo that you can only see the animals by a little boat ride like Cheetahs and wolves. We wanted to go back and see them but the only way was to pay for the ride again which went past their enclosures to fast.

title: Not what i expected
content: This park is actually quite small. Not a huge lot to see. Best part is seeing the red panada and the 2 panadas. This was a great experience. The river safari wasn't much to get excited over didn't see many animals except from the singapore zoo. Not a place i would go again too.

title: One of the best attraction place to visit in Singapore
content: I have been there with my family and friends and we had a great time. It was started raining when we arrived but around 80% is shattered so we didn't face problem. The safari is divided into the Rivers of the World and Wild Amazonia. One of the main attractions is the Giant Pandas. Well, boat tour is abit useless since nothing special so see. Overall, it's worth to visit there.

title: Well laid out, needed more info on boat trips
content: We purchased a joint night and river safari ticket. Upon arriving at the river safari, we headed for what we thought was the only boat trip included in the ticket price. We arrived at the cenrtre at 9am, but then Found out the first cruise was not until 9.30, and that this a river cruise where you may see a few animals. Another ride was available for five dollars to go within the park grounds to see more animals, but this didnt start until 10am! Apart from this, an enjoyable half day out, especially seeing the pandas!

title: Should have gone to the zoo
content:
We've done the zoo on a previous trip, so chose the River Safari this time - we should have stuck to the zoo!
The park is well set out, with a lot of information, but it wasn't really what we were expecting.
The Amazon boat ride and lake boat ride cost extra. I enjoyed the Amazon ride, as you were very close to the animals. The boat on the lake wasn't really worth it, as there was nothing to see (far off elephants and giraffes from the zoo and night safari enclosures.
Glad we did it, but wouldn't do it again. If you have limited time, chose the zoo and night safari instead

title: Not Good
content:
The highlights are the panda which are very cute and the big aquariums which displays fresh water fishes. the boat ride is not a highlight believe me!

I would recommend doing the zoo instead of the river safari because it is bigger although zoo have a different classification of animals than river safari

The boat ride in river safari is very short. like less than 10 mins or so. and it is not an actual boat. it s like a tram moving through a rail like a train and around it is man made nature with water all over. I swear when it started moving, you can smell the very strong stinky odor coming from the water or somewhere else which i can compare to a strong urine smell of different animals which by the way, you will smell until the boat stops.

title: Educational but the Pandas are the highlights
content: In a way it is like a mini theme park with the boat rides, and lots of information on the rivers of the world. The Amazon flooded forest was particularly interesting with a good number of the manatees swimming slowly and graciously amongst other species. However, the highlights of the park is really the 2 giant panda Kai Kai and Jia Jia even though they don't belong to the rivers! To fully enjoy these adorable creatures you have to wait patiently for them to appear closer. We were lucky to have Kai Kai rolling on the ground and even did a sommersault in front of us before it disappeared behind a closed door. Also Jia Jia was sitting in close range eating bamboo for a good 10 minutes at least. We must have spent at least an hour just to watch the 2 lovely pandas in action!

title: Interesting Information
content: This is the third part of the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari, both of which we have visited many times before on our trips to Singapore. The River Safari gives great information on the major rivers in the world. The most exciting part was seeing the two pandas. They were situated in their natural habitat and was great fun watching them eating. The information on all the rivers was great. We took the river cruise (extra fee) and not really worth it - it was a boat that just went for 15 minutes and showed us the back of the Singapore Zoo and we saw Giraffes and Elephants and that was it! The actual River ride was worth it!

title: Surprise in Singapore
content: Singapore is not just an urban city. Still has its natural environment, wildlife. Good for bird watching.

title: Interesting but the main attraction are the Pandas
content:
Some interesting features to the park - boat ride is good and the aquariums are interesting and give a good perspective of some of the endangered species.

Some of the species that have featured on the TV series River Monsters can bee seen in the aquariums

Probably the main attraction are the Pandas - if you get the timing right they are active during feeding otherwise just tend to sleep..

Many of the prepaid tours give you the impression that you have around 4 hours, however we found this is pick up to drop-off so you only really have around 2 hrs at the park.

title: Nice attraction for kids
content: Pros: - a large collection of freshwater fish, with the extra: the giant pandas and Amazonian animals (when you take the boat ride for extra $5) Cons: when we were there, the anaconda wasn't in the cage and squirrel monkey cage was closed for maintenance

title: The boat ride has nothing to see
content: Visiting with my family, we find some interesting fresh water creatures in Aquarium, but we do not see anything interesting on boat ride.

title: River sarfari
content: Best attraction in Singapore. Absolutely loved it. Saw pandas and more animals that you could imagine The aquarium is fantastic. So close to the zoo you can even see their polar bear swimming in its enclosure

title: Better than expected
content: As we walked into the river safari the heavens opened up and it absolutely poured but this didn't matter as the walk ways all had covers over them with the exception of the boat cruises. The safari was amazing to see so many species of fish and animals. But the highlight for me was the red pandas and the giant pandas. I didn't realise how big the pandas were. One was happily munching on bamboo and the other was pacing around the enclosure. The red pandas were sleeping up in the trees. So well organised and spaced out. Booked through duck tours and this meant that we could take our time and on the hour go out the front to meet the bus to take us back to suntec City.

title: Relaxing attraction - Visit Singapore Zoo and River Safrai on the same day
content:
It was raining day, but we are glad that it was all sheltered. No worries at all. Probably, It was due to the rain, the whole place was windy and the "forest" environment makes us feel great and relax. There are big fish tank with big fishes ( not as big as sea aquarium), 2 Pandas (Jia Jia and Kai Kai) and boat rides available with extra charges. I think the boat ride cost $5.

There is a Panda theme restaurant, you might want to try it. Everything with Panda design, Panda bun and coffee with panda shape. So Cutesssss!

For tourist: You can plan to visit Zoo and River Safrai on the same day, if you have time continue with Night Safrai during Night time. (You can buy combo tickets at Changi Airport).

You can travel by tourist bus which is cheaper than Taxi. If you would like to go for cheaper transport, you can take train and bus but i wont recommend you do it. I feel it too troublesome and time consuming.

Transport :http://www.citytours.sg/attractionsbusschedule.html
Train and Bus:http://www.zoo.com.sg/visitor-info/public-transport.html

title: A good change of scenery
content:
Enjoyed my experience here after the shopping and sight seeing exploration around Singapore. This is where I could relax and just watch the animals while their time away in bliss. The pandas are the main attraction. So are the aquarium with otters and manatee. With covered walkways, one can walk in a leisurely pace rain or shine. Also took the River Quest 10-min boat ride, which was worth it. You get to see more animals up close.
I spent abt 2-hrs here and was a nice reprieve from the rest of Singapore. Commuted to the location with public transportation (train and bus) which took me >1hr to get to from the city.
There's a large food court that's share by the entrance to Night Safari, The Zoo and River Safari. So no worries if you got hungry or thirsty.

title: Good but can be a lot more better
content:
Singapore Zoo a lot better and more worthed. Anyway I come here as per my son request. I buy ticket online as it is cheaper.

Come quite early in the morning and we go straight to Amazon River Quest. This boat take about 10 minutes ride. According to me and my son, after the giant panda, this is the best attraction in River Safari which is quite interesting There are 3 shallow slides during the entire ride but we stay dry as we sit in the middle. Actually that time during our visit, nobody taking the boat, so only two of us in the boat. We can't spot too many animals as per sign during the boat ride. We only can spot Jaguar, few types of monkey and flamingo.

After that we take River Safari Cruise. This attraction not really interesting and kind a boring. We can spot Giraffe and elephant but quite far from eye sight. Best spot is seeing stork (kind of bird) gather and flying around near the dock.

Then we go to see Kai Kai and Jia Jia (the giant pandas). We consider very lucky today. Can see both of them munching bamboos and crawling around This is best attraction in River Safari Other than that we also see the Red Panda.

We also go inside squirrel monkey forest and can spot two monkeys.

More boring part is actually river of the world. It can be more better. There are a few types of river such as Congo River, Nile River etc if not mistaken the aquarium Mekong River is quite bright and nice for photo taking. I can see that this area will be expanding very soon also as construction in progress.

The tunnel is too dark. However inside the giant aquarium, there are quite some manatee that are quite cute especially during feeding time.

Their OTTERS damn cute and loving. We manage to spot them cuddling each other inside the water while we are in the tunnel.

As for me this visit is more to educate my son about the rivers and animal. Their facility like tag, recording. Etc really not bad.

Signage (especially don'ts) quite clear

Staffs are friendly and always try to accomodate safety concern in very polite way.

title: Interesting but could be better.
content: Probably worth a half-day visit. Interesting themed safari showcasing marine creatures& mammals that inhabit the 7 major river ecosystems of the world, ranging from the mighty Amazon to the exotic Yangtze river in China. The latter river flowing through Sichuan which is probably the only reason why the famed giant pandas are included here and not in the neighbouring Zoo. Would have rated the visit a 4 if not for the disappointment of the Amazonian River boat cruise (additional charges apply). Here, the fast flowing waters thrust a boat and its occupants through a river course set out to replicate the Amazonian rainforest habitat. Sadly, the exhibits were packed too closely together, givng passengers scarcely time to view the creatures in the enclosures. It would have been ideal if the cruise could meander over a longer course over a larger area so that the animal enclosures could be adequately spaced. As it is, passengers on the boat could only glance in quick succession at the exhibits as the close proximity between exhibits meant that the next enclosure is round the bend or on the opposing bank of the river. One would have either to return for a second ride or try to stop the boat from progressing in order to thoroughly view and appreciate the animals featured in the exhibit.

title: Worth trying
content: Actually i enjoyed the river safari, even it is a short journey - 10 minutes- but it was amazing for $25. But the main zoo is much more interesting. Singapore zoo in great place to spend half a day. I love it

title: OK
content: We were bit disappointed with the exhibitions. There is no need for this to be a separate entity. It should be part of the zoo at same price. It is waste of money and time. It takes only 1-2 hrs to visit it all. Just go to the Zoo and skip this.

title: Meh!
content: Not nearly as nice as the two adjoining zoos. The main draw is a pair of giant pandas, who have a pair of red pandas for neighbors. There is a small number of additional animal exhibits, plus two boat rides. One takes you in a loop around the reservoir, and you see the backside of a couple of exhibits from the zoo and night safari. The second is a disney-style ride, where you get a minute or two in front of each enclosure. If the critters aren't out, you have to purchase another ticket to ride again. Even if you take your time, you can see everything in a couple of hours.

title: Don't bother - it's an overpriced boat trip
content:
This was our second trip to Singapore Zoo in 2 years and the last time we came here, the walking part of the River Safari, including the pandas were only SGD7.00. Now you pay SGD25.00 and get a very tame boat trip on top.
On the boat we managed to see 3 types of animals and the commentary was hard to hear and poor.
We had also paid SGD5.00 to go on the Amazon Quest which was a quick 10 minute ride that was built up to be something it is not, to see animals that were free the last time we came!
All in all, it was a waste of time and money, and we came away feeling conned. Our advice is to not bother, but spend more time in the main Singaore Zoo.

title: Nature, Rivers And PANDAs
content:
A great place to spent a few hours.
Good scenery to take picture from.
Pandas are kept in a very very cool place where you can escape from the surrounding heat . Remember to pose well when approach by the staff for the camera where you can have a beautiful souvenir picture to bring home which cost $25. Boat ride is a bit too short.
Enjoy your holiday in Sunny Singapore!!!!!

title: Something new... but overpriced...
content: The river safari is smaller is size compared to the other 3 parks but offers a boat ride which none other parks have. You will be able to get close with different wildlife species while on board the Amazon River Quest at an additional cost of $5/adult and $3/child (height must be above 1.06m) however, there's a high chance that you may not see much most of the time as these animals take shelter during hot and rainy weather. It is relatively expensive considering the size of the park and what it has to offer.

title: A So-so Experience
content:
If you compare this with the Singapore Zoo, it is way below the Zoo's standard. The main attraction are the two Pandas on loan from China. Interesting to see them in action. Apart from this, the boat ride is interesting to which allows you to see different animals as the boat travels. However the boat ride is too short. Before you knew it, it's over.

Overall, it's only an average experience.

title: amazon adventure
content: The River Safari is a river-themed zoo and aquarium situated on a 30 acres of ground, and nestled between the Singapore Zoo and the Night Safari. It is the first of its kind in Asia This attraction is the fourth zoo in Singapore, along with the Singapore Zoo, Jurong Bird Park, and Night Safari, Showcasing more than 6,000 animals, including 40 rare and threatened species, you can discover one of the world’s largest collection of river-dwelling wildlife here. It features freshwater attractions and river boat rides as its main highlights, it has Giant Panda Forest and is fully air-conditioned, giant aquarium different species of fish and river creatures, Giant crocodile, piranhas, the red panda, Kai-Kai the big panda was our favorite attraction, and the re-creation of the Ganges & Amazon river ,it’s So placid and soothing. You can embark on a boat adventure of the Amazon River with the Amazon River Quest boat ride, We did both the Cruise and Amazon River Quest, I won't recommend the Amazon boat ride not many animals in site maybe they were asleep. We were enthralled by the sights and sounds of close to 30 wildlife species that hail from one of the most diverse rain forest habitats of the world. This unforgettable wet and wild journey will give you a truly unique perspective on life alone the mighty river. It’s pretty expensive for what it is, but it’s worth doing, we were thrilled with the adventure.

title: Interesting Place! and PANDAS!!!!!
content:
The place is not conveniently linked to any MRT so we had to take a taxi here.

We went on a weekday so we had a great time strolling around from one river to the next without bumping into too many people. There are quite a variety of animals and each are explained on a little board near the exhibit.

Some enclosure were considered small to house a few species of animals in it but it was still kept clean and maintained. I wasn't too keen on getting close to a huge Nile crocodile despite being safe behind the thick glass panel but I went very close to it and it was amazingly frightening.

I liked the panda enclosure. It was very spacious with well regulated cool temperature although I think one of the pandas was restless for some reason when I visited. There were red pandas too!!

There was even an enclosure where cute little squirrel monkeys roam freely but watch your bags! One almost reached into my bag for food (I think) but a nearby employee was quick to give it a little shout.

title: River Safari
content: We finally had a chance to see the River Safari. A note that the River Safari and the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari are all in the same area so why not book them all and save going back and forth. The reason for the lower score was because we were not able to see all of it as there was a torrential downpour that went on for an hour just an hour before it closed so we missed a lot of it - there is always next time

title: One for panda lovers!
content:
We went on a Monday afternoon by taxi from Marina Bay at a cost of S$20 each way. There is a taxi drop off point and taxi rank. There is a river boat cruise that takes you past animals such as giraffes that are in the zoo next door. There is also a river quest which is the only way to see some of the animals in the river safari area. We did neither as it was raining! If I were to do one it would be the river quest as this is the only way to see some of the animals but it should be included in the price.
The highlight was the pandas for sure. The red pandas are my favourite animal and it was nice to see them along with the black and white ones. One of the pandas was quite shy and spent some time out the back away from the noise. There were signs everyone saying not to shout but this didn't seem to stop everyone that came in. The noise in there was appalling and there was an echo. The panda area is chilled so take a jumper. Please also stop and say hello to the Golden Pheasant who is opposite the red pandas. Poor thing is ignored by everyone going to see the pandas We were there for just under 4 hours and saw a lot. We spend time watching animals rather than marching past. The manatees were also another highlight as we saw them being fed. There is a nice area to sit and watch them out of the sun/rain! The walkways around the park are covered so you are out of the sun/rain. We ate in the panda café which had some nice cute food at reasonable prices.

title: Cute Giant Panda
content: If you want to see the Giant Panda (Kai Kai and Jia Jia) from China, you can see them at here. Besides, you also can see a lot of water animals by taking the boat ride on certain time.

title: Pandas and manatees
content: I found the "river" experience (cruise on the reservoir and the Amazon River Quest) not as interesting as the land part where you walk past various river habitats, such as Mekong, Amazon, Mississippi, and observe creatures from around the world. The highlight had to be the PANDAS. Also loved to sit & watch the manatees. That's why the Amazon River Quest did not appeal - the ride in the boat is short and, for me, a little rushed. I like to stop and watch the animals. For strange new animals, how about the Indian gharial ? The Singapore Zoo has it all !

title: Good
content: In comparison to zoo and night safari, this park is smaller but interesting non the less.. There are two kinds of boat rides one can take.. The information provided about the fishes etc is very interesting specially the trivia. There is a massive enclosure where you can spot various fishes. Highlight is seeing the two pandas jia jai and kia kia who are adorable.

title: Beautifully set aquariums and animal enclosures
content: We came here as a follow on from the zoo next door. Was a lovely addition to our day. Highlight was the pandas, but all very good. River safari was ok, wouldn't have missed much by not going on it. But the Amazonan river ride was good. Worth a stop if you are going to the zoo.

title: Overpriced and Over-rated
content: This is a really expensive attraction and we were disappointed. Most of the enclosures are small and inappropriate (two miserable looking storks that barely had room to stretch their wings, let alone fly, actually brought tears to my eyes). The Amazon Ride promised a lot and delivered virtually nothing - a ten minute slog around more miserable looking animals in pathetically small enclosures. The river boat trip was a waste of time and unless you have a burning desire to spend more money and see nothing but two giraffes and two elephants in the adjoining zoo, don't bother. Singapore is a great place to visit but this 'attraction' is a total rip off. My only hope is that at least some of the money is going towards improving the conditions for the animals.

title: Ride into the wild
content: I liked the Night Safari better but this trip was also fun! Was able to see different species of fish and river creatures and read/discovered fun facts about them. My favorite would be the giant crocodile, piranhas, the red panda, Kai-Kai the big panda & the recreation of the Ganges & Amazon river! OMG I could just stay there all day staring at the giant aquarium. So serene and relaxing. :) I won't recommend the Amazon boat ride though! We just saw a few animals because most of them were hiding or sleeping. :(

title: No child under 1.06m tall allow seriously!
content: We went there with our kid today. They don't allow any child under 1.06m tall. Seriously if they can not build safe Zoo(River Safari) for family. Surely, its not so hard. Not family friendly here.

title: Loved it! Do both cruises
content: We did this after the Zoo and probably rate it higher. Its pretty expensive for what it is, but saying that we are definitely glad we did it. We did both the Cruise and Amazon River Quest and loved both. Definitely pay the extra few dollars to do them!! Its alot smaller than the zoo and i think we did it in around 1.5 hours. We loved seeing the pandas too :) Our biggest frustration was that in the Singapore heat and there was nowhere open inside to get a drink. They probably need to sort that out.

title: Go only if u want to see the pandas
content:
Time required : 2 hours or so.
If I have to rate the wildlife attractions in Singapore, my ranking would be as follows:
1. Zoo
2. River Safari
3. Night Safari
4. Bird park

I found the bird park to be very boring, night safari lacking much content, river Safari is good mainly because of the Panda, but the zoo is truly great. I must admit that the bird park shows are great. Shows at night safari also not bad.

The best attractions are the pandas. Panda feeding sessions are also good and you can try to catch a few of you can. The show and feeding timings are published on river safari website.

The boat ride is not great, from learning point or adventure point of view.

If you buy combined tickets for wildlife attraction it's cheaper. They are all located at the same place except the bird park which is at a different location.

title: Once is enough
content:
Went on a weekend and it was not crowded at all. Other than the much publicized pandas, I don't find the place worth a second visit. You can easily finish the whole place in 3 hours. One could see more marine life at the SEA Aquarium. You will also miss out on some of the exhibits like the the Scarlet Ibis and Flamingoes if you do not take the Amazon River Quest ride. The Amazon Flooded Forest is interesting though as you can see the whole forest submerged in water.  

The Giant Panda Forest is fully air-conditioned so it provide visitors a respite from the heat.

It would be more interesting to visit the zoo next door.

title: Everything for Kaikai and Jiajia
content: I love Pandas and this is basically the reason why we decided to visit River Safari. Prior the visit, I was only thinking of the Pandas as the main/major attraction but as we went inside, other animals were also very interesting. Half day stay is enough and make sure to bring some fan because it can get hot at some areas. We also tried the Amazon River Quest but as they've said, you can't really see all the animals in one go. When we went there, the jaguar/tiger was asleep in one corner.

title: Worthwhile visit
content:
We got our tickets to River Safari & Night Safari from an online site offering discount tickets so paid a lot less than the actual admission price. We visited River Safari first.

It is very scenic with great photo backdrop opportunities of the river. There were a great variety of animals and wildlife to see to keep us entertained. From piranhas to Pandas and monkeys to manatees it had it all. I especially enjoyed watching the staff feed the manatees and other fishes.

Our family found it worthwhile and took about 2 to 3 hours to see it all before moving next door to the Night Safari attraction.

Word of advice: they warn about being careful in the spider monkey enclosure as they can bite. What they don't tell you is that warm sprays of rain drops aren't rain. Yes... Damn those little buggars.

Had a fun time albeit a little bit sprayed on.

Btw - you can find the discount tx by searching Qoo10. We went to their office direct which is at Level 2 Unit 10, 211 New Bridge Rd, Lucky Chinatown.

title: More than just a boat ride
content:
Before you step onto a boat, you are taken on an adventure through various tyoes of aquatic life. The aquariums are fantasic, and there is one in particular that is let's just say........ big!

The actual boat ride itself was an opportunity to sit back and relax. You learn about wildlife that you see and how the reservoir the cruise is in came about.

The Pandas were a nice surprise and it was great to see then active and up close.

I recommend this trip if you are staying in Singapore. Work it into a visit to the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari as they are all located close together.

Don't forget to do the Amazon Safari as well. It's not a 'hold onto your seats, it's a bumpy ride' attraction, but again it was great to see the wildlife that make up mark of the Amazon up close and personal. Give your self enough time to walk from the entrance, through the various aquariums to the boat ride. It took us about 45 minutes of checking cool stuff out before we stepped onto the boat.

When you leave the River Safari, DON'T go back the way you came. Take the alternative route as there is still more to see and not wanting to spoil the surprise... You'd regret finding out later what you missed.

title: Worth it for the Pandas
content:
The River Safari has some interesting critters in 1rst class enclosures and aquariums. The landscaping is beautiful and there is a lot to see and learn. However, if the panda bear exhibit was not part of the River Safari – it would definitely not be worth the price of admission. So you may want to skip this attraction if you don’t think pandas are awesome.
My wife and I went exclusively to see the two pandas and were in awe! We watched them traverse their surroundings for over an hour looking for treats, eating fresh bamboo, and playing. It was an experience that not many get to have as they are endangered and only a few reside outside of China.
I would recommend a ticket package that includes this park plus the Zoo or Night Safari to fill your day.

title: Excellent!
content: Really interesting, great displays. It was lovely to get out of the city and see some of the natural beauty of Singapore (because there's not really much of that left!). Well set out displays, great to see some new fish and animals and learn about the rivers of the world. Only negative is that they are really hot on the conservation message - Reduce, Reuse, Recycle - yet print off several (expensive) photos of you with pandas etc - if you choose to buy them on your way out (which they offer) they then edit them, change the background etc while you watch on the screen and then they reprint them!! Even if you want the photo you saw previously they reprint it. What?!?!? How about showing me the screen BEFORE you print anything unnecessarily, then I can choose the best photo (or not) but by showing me on the screen first you're not printing off hundreds, if not THOUSANDS, of unwanted photos each day. REDUCE. Yes, I know, "unpurchased photos are recycled" - but that doesn't account for the waste of inks, power, time etc. Just too wasteful for me. I would suggest photos are shown to me on a screen, with the option of having them put on to a stick (good marketing idea, have the River Safari logo on the stick so when I take it to work or wherever I'm advertising for you) and not printed so that I can include the photos in my photo book which I have printed with my other digital photos.

title: Easy to walk
content:
This place is very well set up with easy to navigate path with lots of sign boards to describe the exhibit.

Our favourites are red panda and the giant pandas, Kai Kai and Jia Jia.

The amazon quest boat ride experienxe is not very good. We couldn't see all the animals and it was too short. They should have stopped in various exhibit for people to see.

Worth a visit especially for family with kids with annual membership.

title: Red and giant panda!!
content: Really well set out, amazing range of animals including the unbearably cute red panda and giant panda. Starts with rivers of the world, then the panda enclosure, then for SGD 5 you can go on the river safari ride (well worth it), hang out with spider monkeys in a walk through cage. You really can spend the whole day visiting the three attractions, zoo, river safari and then night safari.

title: go for the Zoo ...
content:
Went to River safari during the Chinese New Year holiday...
Good thing about River Safari is, the Q and the crowd are not as packed as the Zoo ...

If you have only a day to spare, go for the Zoo !! I think you can stay for almost a day there, give the river safari a pass ... unless u have nothing planned.
some said, this River Safari was built for the Pandas ... they are the centre of the attention, then the animals and fishes around, just the add-ons...

Personally I am a bit disappointed on the Amazon Boat ride, I think it can be longer ...

Will I go there again ... probably no ...
Will I suggest others to go, probably yes for a short 3-4 hours visit.

title: Went twice, but just felt rather blah
content:
Overall, it's an attraction that you wouldn't visit twice. I visited twice because the 1st time, I visited before the boat ride route was completed. I wanted to experience the boat ride, so I came a 2nd time. You can finish visiting it in around 2-3 hours. Really unimpressed. Would not recommend it at all. Better to go to the zoo/night safari!

Good things first:
- Not very crowded both times, so felt at peace :)
- Boat ride's cheap at $5/pax, 2 themes available (more on this later).
- Near the zoo and night safari, so it's good if you're planning to go to either.
- Squirrel monkeys are so adorable and are great photo opportunities!
- The long winding layout had many available sheltered resting areas throughout, so we were not so tired and hot.

Not so good things:
- To me, both times the pandas were supposed to be the main draw, but somehow they just didn't wow me.
- The 2nd time I went, female panda Jia Jia was not even in the enclosure! It was a disappointment for my parents and myself.
- The boat ride was a 10-min SLOW boat ride, which felt like those theme park rides without a splash at the end. Half the time, I didn't see any animals and was just baking under the sun. I feel that the extra $5 on top of admission fee was a bit over the top!
- The quality of the aquarium's glass is poor, so it felt like we were looking at the marine animals through dirty glass.
- Some exhibits were not even at eye level, so we had to squat to see them. Coupled with the poor quality of the glass, I didn't actually wish to make any effort to look at some of the exhibits.

title: A beautiful way to end the day!
content:
After spending the majority of the day at Singapore Zoo, my sister and I went to the River Safari - it wasn't as crowded which was great. It is a lot smaller than the zoo itself, but it still showcased a few animals that we did not see while we were in there!

The ten minute boat cruise of the river was very quiet (we were two out of six people on board) and we got to see the elephants and rhinos from a different perspective. The walk down to the boat is lovely too (though a long way) with beautiful views of the river.

We paid a bit extra to also do the River Amazon Quest, and I am so glad we did it! It was like a water ride, with a few tame drops (you might get a bit wet so beware!). We didn't have to wait very long in line at this point (~4.30pm) and there were flamingos, toucans and warthogs! Super cool.

Another fantastic experience was seeing the giant pandas! It was absolutely freezing inside (air conditioner is up full blast), but it is so worth it to see the pandas munching on bamboo and to see the little fox-like red pandas!! Absolutely adorable.

The end of the day was spent at Mama's Panda Kitchen, a themed cafe with snacks and drinks. Their food is super cute and it was a great way to refuel before heading off home. Definately save an hour ot two after the end of the day to visit River Safari!

title: Feel cheated!
content: Its a walk through in whats esentially a long, twisting hallway which gives you a feel of marine life in the many rivers of the world. Only positive was the random Panda enclosure (yes, Panda, in a river safari!) apart from which, this was a let down. Quite expensive too. If you're visiting the zoo, stick to it and skip river and Night safaris.

title: Fun time even for solo traveler
content:
Located right next to Singapore Zoo, this place can be reached from downtown by MRT drop at Ang Mo Kio station and take a bus ride. If you wish to visit Singapore Zoo or Night Safari in the same day, I suggest you get deal to buy Park Hopping ticket (day pass for park attractions) so you can save some budget. I won't suggest to include Jurong Bird Park in the 1 day ticket as it's pretty far.

Basically it's a river themed zoo displaying for water animals and animals dwelling around rivers all over the world, with additional giant panda and red panda as the superstar. They have a wide variety of animals displayed so you will enjoy your time here even if you have visited aquariums before.

If you want to take the 15 minutes boat ride (2 departures at noon every day), you will have to register at the locket near the entrance gate and need to pay additional cost. If you are traveling with kids, they will love this attraction, but for an adult solo backpacker, you might want to think twice, unless it already included in the ticket (which is quite impossible due to the frequency of the boat departure)

title: Not exactly a safari
content:
I wouldn't call it a safari, more like a zoo.

We missed out on the boat ride, having arrived too close to closing time. However, I do feel this is the best time to visit, as the place was virtually empty and all the more enjoyable as we did not have to push through the crowds.

There were a lot more animals than I was expecting, and I found it very enjoyable.

title: Walking path suits more than River safari
content: We reached attraction by bus, then we bought entrance tickets 25+5 SGD and thought that there would be no need to walk, but River safari hides true!!! There is a path which leads trough out different continents (walk ~40min.). You can experience different fishes and animals living within the river basins of the biggest rivers of these continents. Following the path it leads to the river safari boat, time on which you have to book when entering the attraction, and at the end it appears that boat trip takes less than 15 min.! :( It felt bad.. I think that this attraction should come together with ZOO with one entrance ticket, then it would be nice, but it was not so..

title: Nice environments, mostly walking exhibits, 15 min river ride, overall okay experience
content: It was a nice place with good ecosystems built up - the animals all seemed healthy and able to move about comfortably (I always think enclosures are small.) It was mostly a self-guided walking tour though. Interesting and easy to read info available throughout. The actual "river safari" is only about 15 minutes from boarding to docking - which they do disclose on their website. It alternates somewhat with outdoor exhibits with shade and fans and indoor ones with A/C. It could be a fun place for kids, but it wasn't particularly outstanding for us as adults. Still a nice place, but just not super exciting if you've been to aquariums and the like before.

title: A let down.
content: This place is heavily promoted and looked forward to the visit.Whilst the various displays were good I was expecting more.The fish were amazing and so many kinds.Pandas ok.Didnt take long to get to the bridge to the Amazon boat ride.Found this all too rushed.The ride went fast,couldn't hear the commentry well because of that.The animals along the way we're scarce and again if there were some to see the boat flew past them.After the Zoo,a bit crap.Dont know if kids would like it.Think the SGD5 for the Amazon ride should be included in the admission price.

title: Easy to visit as an 'add-on'
content:
The River Safari is an attraction which is very easy to add on to a day at the main zoo as it is right next door.

I visited the main zoo as part of a tour with Viator to have breakfast with the orangutans. Instead of returning in the coach I opted to stay at the Zoo for a longer look around, after which I had lunch and then in the mid-afternoon, visited the River Safari.

The River Safari 'walk' is quite shaded and was a nice respite from the heat experienced at the Zoo. I found the displays very interesting and was lucky that one of the pandas was out and about, so I was able to get some nice pictures.

The panda enclosure was a little crowded, however the walkways in the rest of the attraction were wide enough so as not to feel 'hemmed in'. There are also benches along the way on which to sit if you become tired or wish to spend more time viewing a particular display.

I enjoyed it, and I believe it is worth the experience, however people might not find it worth the fairly long journey from the city centre if it was not visited in conjunction with the main zoo or the Night Safari.

title: Unbelievable experience
content: Our four years old grandson was looking forward for a cruise to the Singapore River Safari. After 15 minutes walk from the ticket office, we arrived at the waiting place. After waiting for 15 minutes, we were told that the boat had broken for the day. We asked for refund of our tickets but were not allowed. We could only exchange it for food or other stuff in the limited shop appointed by the authority. That's really an unthinkable thing that could happen in Singapore. The whole purpose of our visit was frustrated. Other attractions therein are also not much fun.

title: Different
content: This is unusual in having fresh water fish in large tanks. It was exciting to see the manatees swimming around and the otters but the highlight for me was the panda enclosure as I have never seen a panda close up before. We went on an organised trip and could have done with longer there as we felt rather rushed by the tour guide.

title: Why not?
content: I was happy to see some of the South American animals, and it got me thinking about travelling there. The animals seem to be well treated, though some of them might appreciate more space.

title: Wasting time
content: Very boring...over priced ...amazon river much better more exciting and only five dollars......maybe try night safari it might be better

title: Interesting and Different
content: i really enjoyed this place. we went on both boat rides. both equally enjoyable.Its a very quick to get through i think we spent around 2 hours looking at all the displays.

title: Better if it was part of the zoo
content:
I think this would have been better if it was part of the zoo rather than s separate park.

That being said the pandas are beautiful as is their enclosure, we really enjoyed the Amazon River Quest (went on it twice) and that manatee tank.

The manatees are beautiful and graceful.

title: Similar to an aquarium
content: We were a little disappointed after the Zoo. Most of the river safari was like an aquarium. Unfortunately the pandas were dozing. My daughter enjoyed the boat ride. On reflection, for the cost, I would probably give it a miss as we have already seen the pandas in HK at Ocean Park. Just my personal thoughts.

title: A wonderful place for the whole family!
content:
The River Safari is a wonderful attraction for the whole family; from the very young to the elderly. What I love about the attraction is that there is just one path and one direction - really like an Ikea! There are no steps at all which is great for prams and wheelchairs and it is sheltered all the way so even if it rains (which sometimes it can very suddenly in Singapore) no one is soaked or dashing around looking for shelter. The whole attraction is very well designed with little air-conditioned enclosures along the way which is great respite especially on a very hot day. The pandas are adorable although they can be elusive at times.

There is a cafe within the attraction which serves asian fast food and isn't that great in terms of taste but there is a nice little Chinese restaurant at the entrance of the attraction and other eateries just about 100m front the entrance.

I love the River Safari and we have bought annual passes for the whole family two years in a row but the boat rides are really not worth it. You don't actually get to see much and its very short, plus a long wait for the rides which disappoint.

We have also learnt that 3-4:30pm is the best time to go because its feeding time and the animals are most active. Also, that's usually when there isn't a crowd at all so the kids can run along ahead and back and really have a enjoy themselves without having to jostle with the crowd and peer in-between shoulders just to get a peek!

Overall, it is a great attraction (we are there at least once a month!) but I would give the rides a miss.

title: Weather proof attraction, suitable for old n young
content:
Was there with my family of 2 kids. Its just next to the zoological garden which we were familiar with. No trouble in getting there at all. At least for the locals

Was greeted by the panda mascot at the entrance. The place was design like a guided walkway with shelter. All exhibits (fishes n animals) are situated along the way. You will not miss any while sticking to the trail.

We missed the boat ride as tickets to be purchase or collected at the entrance.

The panda is the most popular attraction among all. Its the one air conditioned area in the entire place. Once exit, there is a cafe selling the cute panda bun n souvenir shop right beside. I didn't try the bun as the Q was really long.

Overall the experience was ok, we took about 2 hours for the trail. Elderly n young suitable especially there arent much steps if i recall correctly.

title: Very well done
content: This is a great concept. Where as no as fun as the night safari it is still definitely worth doing. The panda enclosure is very special.

title: Beside the Panda notthing much...
content:
This animal reserve is a nice place to spend few hours walking around. It is not cheap. I think the facility do not justify the price, especially if you compare it with the other reserves.
However if you have kids, they will enjoy a lot. Ladies be ready to walk a bit, definitely you want to avoid going there with high heels. It sounds silly but I saw few girls wearing it…

LOCATION
River Safari is located just nearby Singapore Zoo. Very convenient if you want to visit both.
Not so easy to reach with public transportation; need to go to Ang Mo Kio and then change with bus 138.
Alternatively from down town there is a shuttle bus to Singapore Zoo. You can check the stations and the schedules at this web address:
http://www.zoo.com.sg/visitor-info/singapore-attractions-express.html

TICKET
The price ticket for the River Safari is s$28 per Adult, s$18 for children (3-12 years old). I suggest you to check the River Safari website, usually they have 10 to 15% discount if you purchase the ticket on line. You can even buy it 10 minutes before you enter. Then just show your confirmation email on your phone at the entrance scanner.

If you are considering to visit more than one reserve I suggest you to buy a multi-park ticket. There are 3 different formulas 4-1 (for 4 parks) 3-1 and 2-1. The ticket is valid for 1 week from the first park visit.

In the River Safari they will offer you to take a Boat Ride. It is an extra cost! 5s$ per Adult 3s$ per children, who has to be over 1m tall. The ride last only for 10 minutes and goes around few birds spots.

HIGHLIGHT
I suggest to bring a nice camera with a powerful zoom if you have it. You want to take some close pictures of the Giant Panda, which is the star of the "Safari".

title: Not worth the ticket price you re paying for
content: Was surprised at the ticket cost more than $25 adult.Tickets are to expensive it should cost $10 after what I have seen. River cruise have to pay. Amazon jungle have to pay. Why have pay for all these?

title: Interesting if you have the time
content: It's quite a walk from the main zoo, and you have to queue up. But this artificial ride through an artificial Amazon river features animals you wouldn't have seen otherwise.

title: Panda was the star
content: The panda is the highlight of this attraction, and they are very cute creatures, but there is not enough other interesting animals to quote make the excellent mark. The Amazon river ride is essential, or you will miss the Jaguars and some other interesting creatures, but it does move a bit fast! Also look out for a window into the polar bear exhibit, especially if you are not going to the zoo.

title: River safari
content: it is pretty expensive. We have not seen half of the animals on the short Amazon river adventure which is paid separately... Absolute highlight are the manatees which are wonderful!

title: They don't tell you when part of the attraction is closed
content: I took some friends here while they were visiting Singapore. The first part was quite good and the large aquarium at the end is good, but the boat ride in the middle was closed, this has lots of things to see so we were quite disappointed.. We spoke to the duty manager after and explained that we wouldn't have paid the full price if we had known. She got angry with us when I said I wanted some money back, terrible service. I was only asking why they didn't tell us before we purchased tickets! Won't be going back!

title: Family River safari
content: Great animal attractions in the river displays. Boat Safari itself was a little disappointing, so don't rush displays to get there.

title: should do this river safari
content: i am talking about the river safari which is right in the middle of the city not the safari which is connected with night safari or zoo. this one shows you a nice close encounter with singapore skyline on ur both sides. should go. check the map and get down at the place of your convenience

title: Expected more
content: The river safari was disappointing. I expected more from this safari but was disappointed because it was very basic. Out of the 3 parks (zoo, River safari and night safari), I would skip this one.

title: Misleading Information Timewise
content: Count on a long walk from the ZOO to the boat platform, thru a long corridor full of interesting information and fish from all over the world. The boat trip is lovely but the boats really move too fast. I think that the place would benefit from more cafes to refresh.

title: What a tour
content: This is worth every penny friendly staff, very pleasant tour does not take much time to finish the full tour, all under shelter therefore no need to worry about the sun , panda shelter was the best , mama panda kitchen you have to try the ice tea with chocolate custard, super

title: Definitely worth doing
content: We visited in September 2013 so the boat ride was not open at this point. We stayed the most of the day at the River Safari as we took our time and listened to all the talks. It is peaceful and different to other attractions, it was amazing to see some of the aquatic animals there that you will not see elsewhere. One of the most amazing parts was the Mekong River display, this is breathtaking. I understand this Safari is not for everyone but if you enjoy seeing and hearing about different animals, or you are a fish enthusiast, it is definitely worth a visit. The panda exhibit is amazing and it is incredible to see them but do not expect them to do more than eat or sleep as this is their natural behaviour.

title: Zoo View with a Difference
content:
As part of Singapore Zoo this is definitely worth a visit as one gets to see the animals in a more natural environment and in the comfort of a small boat with recorded commentary that gives a bit of insight into te animals and their habitats. My only criticism would be that the boats move too fast and it is easy to miss things especially if you want to take photos as you have to pay attention to both sides.

Would be a great experience for children 5 or older.

title: Not really a safari, but still fun
content: It's really a long walk along aquariums and habitats about the worlds biggest rivers, but it then opens into a habitat for monkeys and for the Panda bears. There is plenty of room to stay and watch the Pandas, and they were delightful to watch eating bamboo and carrots. I'd do it again in a heartbeat!

title: Don't purchase in advance and only 15 minutes long
content: Bit meh for the price considering it is a 15 minute ride. Big note that this is non refundable so it started pouring down with rain when we got there (thunderstorms were pretty cool but scary as it was just above our heads) so we sat and waited for about an hour waiting for the storms to finish before we could board. Cutting it a bit fine as it closes at 5.30 and the storm ended at about 5.15 but as it was non refundable we decided to wait it out. Pretty cool though you only really see 3 animals which you saw inside the zoo (giraffe, rhinos and some lizards- of which the rhinos disappeared and we couldn't see any lizards). Conclusion- zoo is enough :) not really any need to go on river safari

title: Well worth a visit, excellent.
content:
8 January 2015 I visited the Singapore Zoo where I enjoyed 4 hours exploring the River Safari which was excellent. I was accompanied by my 2 grandsons, aged 13 and 11. We all found the attraction informative interesting and thrilling. The animal species are magnificent, well cared for in spacious enclosures and aquariums. The Otters were particularly wonderful to watch, lots of space, lots of water, do not miss them. The Pandas were feeding when we came upon them, what a treat to be so close to this animal. The waters were full of fish and wild life I never thought I would see up close. The habitats are so well designed, at one point we were walking under the water features, then above looking down into the aquariums.
If you are visiting Singpore for an extended visit or just stopping over on your travels to another destination, please do no miss the amazing River safari.

title: An all-weather, outdoor wildlife park
content:
This was my second time to this wildlife park, but I enjoyed myself as much as I did on my first visit. Unlike most people, the highlight of the zoo for me isn't the Giant Panda Forest, but the Amazon Flooded Forest with the manatees. I feel that these graceful giants were much more interesting to watch than the pandas. Besides these main attractions, the rest of the enclosures were also well-designed so that most of the animals could be clearly seen in their simulated habitat.

Weather wise: it was raining really heavily when we reached the park in the afternoon, but most of the park and its attractions were connected by sheltered walkways with handicap-friendly ramps, which suited my grandmother quite well.

Lastly, I suggest purchasing tickets online with your credit card as there is a 10%(or more) discount.

title: Empty enclosures
content:
Been to the river safari twice...greater disappointment this time round.

1) There can be up to six display boards infront of any enclosure (i.e. info on six different types of animals) but most of the time the enclosures are either empty or only one or two different types of animals are present.

2) Speed of the Amazon River boat ride was too fast! We had to keep turning our heads just to make sure we don't miss any animals...it would have been perfect if only the boat travelled slower so that visitors are not stressed up in their viewing experience.

The only reason i gave two stars is because i managed to see kai kai n jia jia (the giant pandas), both feeding and were quite active. So...no regrets! But doubt i'll even return again.

title: Thumbs up for River Safari!
content:
Visited the River Safari this month. Arrived in the morning about 10.30am on a weekday and was thankful that there was not much crowd.

What we enjoyed was the two lovely Pandas, you cannot miss this! Quite close proximity to the pandas which was great, go during feeding time so that you can see some action. Different kinds of fresh water fish, reptiles and other animals like beavers and otters from other parts of the world for viewing. The manatee or dugong aquarium was a cozy place to just sit and look at the slow moving creatures, a relaxing sight.

What we thought can be improved was the river boat cruise, it was a pleasant and smooth ride about 15 min, but not much animals to see. For $5 per person, you can just take it just for the fun of it and cruise the waters enjoying the view of nature instead.

What we missed was the Amazon river boat ride (also $5) as it is closed for maintenance on Mondays but we will be back again soon to see this.

Note, only Mama Panda Kitchen inside the Safari if you want to have a meal inside, a set meal sets you back at about $17.90 on average for a person. There is another restaurant near the entrance as well, both serve Chinese cuisine. We chose to have lunch instead outside of the safari at one of the eating areas near the ticketing booths.

Lockers available for rent at $3 if you have bags that you want to keep away for a while.

Tips: Got a free complimentary pass (applicable to the Zoo, Night safari as well) for visiting on my birthday which was awesome and 10% discount for my spouse for PassionCard user. Do check their website for other types of discounts available.

For sure we enjoyed ourselves and will definitely be back again.

title: Misleading Information Timewise
content: Count on a long walk from the ZOO to the boat platform, thru a long corridor full of interesting information and fish from all over the world. The boat trip is lovely but the boats really move too fast. I think that the place would benefit from more cafes to refresh.

title: What a tour
content: This is worth every penny friendly staff, very pleasant tour does not take much time to finish the full tour, all under shelter therefore no need to worry about the sun , panda shelter was the best , mama panda kitchen you have to try the ice tea with chocolate custard, super

title: Definitely worth doing
content: We visited in September 2013 so the boat ride was not open at this point. We stayed the most of the day at the River Safari as we took our time and listened to all the talks. It is peaceful and different to other attractions, it was amazing to see some of the aquatic animals there that you will not see elsewhere. One of the most amazing parts was the Mekong River display, this is breathtaking. I understand this Safari is not for everyone but if you enjoy seeing and hearing about different animals, or you are a fish enthusiast, it is definitely worth a visit. The panda exhibit is amazing and it is incredible to see them but do not expect them to do more than eat or sleep as this is their natural behaviour.

Would be a great experience for children 5 or older.

There is plenty of room to stay and watch the Pandas, and they were delightful to watch eating bamboo and carrots. I'd do it again in a heartbeat!

Been to the river safari twice...greater disappointment this time round.

1) There can be up to six display boards infront of any enclosure (i.e. info on six different types of animals) but most of the time the enclosures are either empty or only one or two different types of animals are present.

2) Speed of the Amazon River boat ride was too fast! We had to keep turning our heads just to make sure we don't miss any animals...it would have been perfect if only the boat travelled slower so that visitors are not stressed up in their viewing experience.

The only reason i gave two stars is because i managed to see kai kai n jia jia (the giant pandas), both feeding and were quite active. So...no regrets! But doubt i'll even return again.

title: Thumbs up for River Safari!
content:
Visited the River Safari this month. Arrived in the morning about 10.30am on a weekday and was thankful that there was not much crowd.

What we enjoyed was the two lovely Pandas, you cannot miss this! Quite close proximity to the pandas which was great, go during feeding time so that you can see some action. Different kinds of fresh water fish, reptiles and other animals like beavers and otters from other parts of the world for viewing. The manatee or dugong aquarium was a cozy place to just sit and look at the slow moving creatures, a relaxing sight.

What we thought can be improved was the river boat cruise, it was a pleasant and smooth ride about 15 min, but not much animals to see. For $5 per person, you can just take it just for the fun of it and cruise the waters enjoying the view of nature instead.

What we missed was the Amazon river boat ride (also $5) as it is closed for maintenance on Mondays but we will be back again soon to see this.

Note, only Mama Panda Kitchen inside the Safari if you want to have a meal inside, a set meal sets you back at about $17.90 on average for a person. There is another restaurant near the entrance as well, both serve Chinese cuisine. We chose to have lunch instead outside of the safari at one of the eating areas near the ticketing booths.

Lockers available for rent at $3 if you have bags that you want to keep away for a while.

Tips: Got a free complimentary pass (applicable to the Zoo, Night safari as well) for visiting on my birthday which was awesome and 10% discount for my spouse for PassionCard user. Do check their website for other types of discounts available.

For sure we enjoyed ourselves and will definitely be back again.

title: Pre-book the Amazon ride
content:
After a busy morning in the Zoo a few hours at the River Safari is perfect.

The trails are all enclosed / covered so provide nice respite from hot weather or rain.

Amazon ride is a must do and pre-booking is the way to go (was sold out the day we went by the afternoon).

Pandas were a highlight for us too.

title: Worth every penny !
content: Wonderful place for a full day family outing! Each zone is themed on famous rivers across the world and provides vivid details of the natural habitat of various species of fishes and amphibians found on these rivers. Kids would love this place, boat ride not to be missed !!

title: The place is fun to visit, informative and get to see some animals upclose
content:
Took my parents there for a visit as they'd never been, was expecting a full day in the blistering sun. Turns out the place is pretty well designed and built. Most of the walkways displaying the exhibits are sheltered walkways, protecting you from the sun or rain. Some of them have AC, like the exhibits for the Giant Pandas and the Red Pandas.

Spent a little more than 3 hours there looking at all the exhibits. Personally, I would say the place is worth a visit, the otters were a delight to watch upclose while the alligators were terrifying at close range. The park is designed in a linear fashion so you won't get lost nor is there a need to backtrack to view other animals. Definitely worth the price of admission, however, I would advise to give both river cruises a miss. The main river cruise was nothing more than a leisurely 15 minute boat ride around the lake separating the River Safari from the Night Safari.

The Amazon Boat ride was even shorter, a short maybe 10 minute ride in a log flume (don't sit in the front row like stupid me), this ride is just not worth it. Most of the animals are hiding amongst the trees and the flume whizzes by where you have a 3-4 second window to try and spot whatever you're supposed to be looking at. The only animal I saw were the pink flamingoes who stood out against the green backdrop like a sore thumb.

And also, pack your own lunch or water if necessary. $8 for a cup of soda, you've got to be kidding me, seriously?

title: Great concept zoo on river animals
content:
Since river safari is a relatively new zoo, it was not crowded when I visited in the late afternoon.

The zoo has a great concept as it showcases most river animals around different main rivers in the world.

There is a panda exhibit which is a great highlight, In addition, there is a huge aquarium which is enjoyable to watch.

It is not a large area which takes around 3 hours to complete, though it is a great zoo to visit, it is a bit pricey given it's size.

title: River safari cruise Singapore $1 per animal
content: Cruise cost $5. We saw 2 giraffes, 1 rhino, 2 elephants, ie. $1 per animal. What a rip-off. Never again.

title: Good afternoon out
content: Nice zoo. Easy to get around, beautiful aquarium displays and informative talks. The spider monkeys were fun to watch and the Amazon River Quest was really good - shame it zoomed so fast past the animals you hardly got a look.

title: Eye Opener
content: Exhibits the aquatic species found in the rivers all over the world. Smaller than the zoo but worth the visit for its exhibits. The included boat ride is short. See the panda bears from China, eat at the cafe - panda buns and panda prints on your coffee. So cute.

title: Do this early, it's great orientation
content:
The electric boats provide a commentary as you travel down the river and around the harbour area. We found it really helpful in identifying what we wanted to see and understand the different activity on each side of the river.

We did this on the first day and it helped us to prioritise areas. Give it a go, it's value for money and gives respite from the heat.

title: I love Panda
content: River Safari is just beside the Singapore Zoo. I came here last Saturday and when I reached the entrance it was raining heavily. Luckily most of the areas are sheltered thus I could walked around with no umbrella. We managed to complete the place in 4 hours. There are many interesting big sea creatures. The Pandan Exhibit area is quite cold, it good to bring along a jacket. Must try the Pandan Bun ( Chocolate and Red bean favor) at the "Mama Pandan Kitchen" located in the middle of the safari.

title: Neutral feeling.
content: An educational trip if you will. Great for family bonding with children. The main attraction is obviously JiaJia & KaiKai.

title: Great Concept to tour the World's Rivers
content: At first I thought it would be a boat ride on a river to view animals along the banks - going by the name. But was pleasantly surprised at the theme of going through all the wild life in and along the rivers of the world. A great way to see the variety of wild life in action - like otters, dugongs, turtles, etc. Only the gharials in the River Ganges did not look like live ones??? Kids with us loved it. The river ride was also a great treat. Overall a very good place to spend half a day. The Zoo and night safari are next door to complete a day full of wild life viewing.

title: Asia's only River-Themed Wildlife Park
content:
It was a sunny morning at the River Safari, located at 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826. It is also next to Singapore Zoo and Night Safari.
We started by walking along the Rivers of the World as the rivers are named after many Countries' Rivers.
We saw creatures like the Alligator Snapping Turtle, Mississippi Paddlefish, Giant Freshwater Puffers, Congo Tetra, Jewel Cichlid, African Arowana, Tiger Fish, Giraffle Catfish, Indian Gharial, Mekong Giant Catfish, Giant Freshwater Stingray, Crab-Eating Macaque, Giant Salamander, Sturgeon and list just goes on.....
The main Singapore Giant Pandas in their Giant Panda Forest is a must-see. The cooling environment of 18 degrees is sure a pleasant place to watch the Pandas. There are also some Golden Pheasants in the compound.
We then proceed to the River Safari Cruise which is a 15 mins ride along the Upper Seletar Reservoir.
Along the way, we spotted some Asian Elephants, Giraffles, storks and herons.
Even though the ride was short, but it was refreshing. After that we proceed with another ride at
The Amazon River Quest.
With this ride, we are in close range with the animals like jaguar, Brazilian tapirs, capybaras, Brown-Headed Spider monkeys, Giant Anteaters, Tufted Capuchins, Peccary, Scarlet Ibis, Caribbean Flamingos etc....
The duration of the ride was about 15 mins but you will love it.
We travelled along the Squirrel Monkey Forest after that and they are just right in front of your eyes. but beware not to feed and touch them.
We took a rest at the Mama Panda Kitchen. the Panda "paus" is a must try. they are hot and soft with red beans filling or in custards. They are shaped in the form of Panda's Head. The kids will loved them. You could also try the Szechuan Bamboo Rice and Prawn Dumplings too.
there is also a Tea House along the way.
Before you leaves, visit the R/S Shop where there are plenty of soft toys of Pandas, stationeries, nice key chains, T- shirts, hats and caps etc....
It is a nice place for families and tourists. You will love the River Safari.

title: Great attraction if you are a nature lover.
content:
River Safari is well designed for local climate as most of the walkways are sheltered so no need to worry about the sunny or rainy day.

The park is not too big hence you will probably explore the entire park around half a day.

Kids will love it if they like fishes and the panda bears.

title: Up close and personal - in comfort!
content:
Love the River Safari after my first visit! Other than the opportunity to catch the panda(s) - JiaJia is perpetually shy - we went in the afternoon after lunch which essentially provided an escape from the worst crowds. And even though it rained, the entire walk through was covered and comfortable.

Loved the many rivers from around the world, and only wished that each one could have been fleshed out more with more species of animals and fish. I especially loved the beavers and otters, and we lingered with the manatees for more than 30 minutes. The animal river ride was fun and we were lucky enough to get close-ups of all the animals along the route, including the jaguars. Truly beautiful experience!

title: Decent informative attraction
content: This attraction is well laid out with several separate rivers of the world areas. There is lots of information about each river together with good exhibits of fish and animals that frequent these rivers. I found the information easy to digest, and clearly written in lots of languages. The areas are very clean and well spaced out. It was really interesting to see the different fish. Walking at a leisurely pace and taking time to read the information I was in the park for around three hours. All of the walkways are covered, and it was raining whilst I was there. The boat trips were not running due to the rain. All in all well worth a visit

title: Park is very small for price of admission
content: I bought the park hopper, and it covers the Singapore Zoo and River Safari. I picked it because I thought it would be quite the different experience. The safari itself was good, though the issue is that it is WAY too small for the price of admission, only buy the ticket if you are getting the park hopper or you will feel ripped off. We were done with park in less then 3 hours. Inside the park, you will see lots a marine life, though if you only want to see that, you'd rather go to the SEA Aquarium. The main attraction was the Panda, it seems. I was very disappointed.
