The panda, Kai Kai was literally sleeping for the entire time we were there, inside a tiny little area which was too small for him. The other Panda, Jia Jia, was hiding in her quarters the whole time. There is also a boat ride through the park, the Amazon River Quest. Its experience is really tailored to your luck, all the areas that you will see the animals are hiding grounds for them, I did not get to see one half of the animals you are supposed to see. Also, tip if you do not want to get wet, sit at the third row or further. The front "splash zone" is actually the SOAK zone, you WILL get soaked if you sit in the front row seat. The second seat is the splash zone. Price for the boat ride is $10 for adults and $5 for children. Keep in mind if you do wanna sit on it, it is closed for maintenance from 5 Jan to 2 Feb. The overall experience is okay, just too small.

title: Dun have too high expectations
content:
Comparing to that singapore zoo and night safari, river safari is an attraction i would recommend to give a skip. Nothing much even if you are panda crazy, have the time they are sleeping hence dun really get to pandas.

More can be done with the animals, shows and even activities at river safari. And the queue for the river cruise is totally NOT worth the 10-15mins ride.

title: A relaxing attraction
content: If you run out of attraction to go then this is a OK choice. The route in the attraction are all shelter except for the River Ride. So you don't have to worry about sudden rain. Need to buy the River Ride ticket and book the ride timing before entrance. The River Ride is quite fun though a bit short and fast, hence a bit difficult to take photos of the animals on both side. The panda shaped bun at the Panda Cafe is cute and nice to eat as it is very soft. The red panda is cute though the star is Jia Jia and Kia Kia.

title: Bit different
content:
After visiting the zoo we decided to come here and thought we would spend a few hrs here. It was early afternoon and there was alot of school children which at times meant you couldn't get to see the animals.

This part of the zoo focuses on the animals who live in the river. There was alot of fish and eels but was interesting to see. You can pay $5 and go on a nice boat ride and see some animals such as marmoset monkeys. was nice sitting on the boat and not knowing if you would get wet or not.

In the middle of the park amongst the water animals is....... a panda house with 2 pandas! go figure. They were lovely and everyone loves a panda but where they fit in in the river safari is a mystery! Only took about an hr to go round and at times felt bit bored.

title: It didn't surprise us
content: We were tree days in Singapore and we decided to go to the zoo. When we arrived there, we saw the advertisment of river safari and we thought that it could be different. In fact, that place is ok, but it didn't surprise us. On the begining there are animals from world rivers and suddently... It appears one panda ! We didn't get the connection. We paied more $5 for the 10 minutes trip on the river. We didn't like it. We didn't see most of the animals because the area is big and it's a short time close to each animal. It's ok, but I think it would be better to choose the zoo.

title: Panda pleasure
content:
I had not been to the Zoo here for years, and not at all to the new River Safari exhibit. As you might anticipate, this is mainly a series of aquariums with animals and fish from world wide fresh water environments. Mostly outdoors, but with cover from the weather, this was a very pleasant experience. By considerate design, both arms of this part of the zoo ends in air conditioned enclosures, the first for the panda exhibit, and the second for the sea cows. On this occasion we were very excited to be present for one of the panda feeding times, and it was wonderful to see the pandas exploring their enclosures for treats of carrots. The enclosures are well designed to allow the pandas a green environment for exploration, as well as ample opportunities to be observed. The sea cow exhibit is simply mesmerising, and one could easily spend hours meditating in front of their huge aquarium.

Recommended.

title: Simple Trip
content:
I ever visited this attraction late last year. This time, I was here as a volunteer joining a group of children on an trip to River Safari.

Pros:
1. Fully sheltered attraction that is convenient for sunny or rainy days
2. Linear pathway that is not difficult to navigate
3. Usually quiet and not too crowded (except for my most recent visit as there was an event with large groups of children)

Cons:
1. Not a huge variety of animals
2. Sometimes forced to go through tourist traps like photo booths and souvenir shops, but the staff are not pushy

How much you enjoy this attraction really depends on personal effort in terms of planning and enthusiasm. If you go at a leisurely pace and actively engage in the exhibits, you can easily spend 2 to 3 hours here. Instead of just snapping photos and leaving, take some time to read the educational information panels, e.g. the panda enclosure has many interesting exhibits about their diet. For parents with children, you can also encourage them to observe the animals' behavior, e.g. how the baby crab-eating macaque hangs upside down from the parent's stomach. If your child has any favourite animal in River Safari, you can also follow up by showing them Wildlife Reserve Singapore's YouTube videos.

I also suggest that you take note of the feeding times, animal shows and boat rides while planning for your trip. (The boat rides require additional fee; you can view a YouTube video featuring the full ride to decide whether you want to experience it.) While they are not extraordinary, including these can ensure you maximise the value for the admission fee. They also provide interesting photo taking opportunities, e.g. the squirrel monkeys will all appear in front of your eyes during the feeding time.

If you are looking for a simple, quiet trip, then River Safari is suitable for you. Otherwise, if you are looking for a variety of animals and activities, it is definitely more economical to purchase Park Hopper tickets. This will allow you to visit different attractions like the Singapore Zoological Gardens, River Safari and Night Safari.

title: Good Concept
content:
I must appreciate Singapore creativity to come up with this new concept of zoo. It's basically a zoo, but they twist it to become a river theme zoo. So we can see all the animals that lives in the river all around the world.

The only anomaly of that good concept is the Panda show, eventhough we like Panda attraction so much. What is the connection between Panda and river :D.

Well beside that, everything is good. My kids like to see a rare animal, that they never see in the ordinary zoo. All the journey in the zoo is equipped with a canopy, so you're safe from direct sunlight or rain. It's pleasant.

We skip the boat, because it's very hot at that time, and most of reviews say that we can't see most of the animals.

The journey is only takes 2-3 hours, and the price of ticket is more expensive comparing to other zoo attraction in Singapore.

We take our lunch at KFC outside the zoo, 'cause it's more suitable for our taste. They have a very good Panda theme restaurant inside.

title: Good visit, worth it just for the pandas
content: Bought a joint ticket online with the night safari. Reasonable price and better than at the gate. Some nice exhibits on the way around but the pandas were by far the best. Lots of opportunity to see them from different angles and as it was a Thursday afternoon, very quiet. The amazon aquarium was really cool with different ways to see the manatees. We don't have kids but it looks especially great for them.

title: Peaceful surroundings
content: When you enter you are greeted by sounds from the forest and river. You walk down towards the the river cruise and you see animals, insects and birds in cages, of course, glass cages. Of course the main attraction were the two pandas from China, Jia Jia and Kai Kai. They were in very clean and comfortable surroundings, well fed and looked after well. The Amazon Quest is a must for parents with children. Children would love the little slides that the boat has to go down the river, to them it is exciting.

title: It was Ok experience
content: Give a miss to river cruise inside river safari bay and take trip through amazon river. It is great view of Jaguar in the Amazon river ride! Go for your kid otherwise miss it for a better location

title: River Safari
content: This was a great place to visit. Great variety of species and much of the walking was in shaded areas that kept us from getting too hot.

title: River Scam
content:
This is one of the newest attractions in Singapore so my friends and I did the combo pack to include the Zoo, River Safari and Night Safari.
The River Safari definitely was not as advertised and also was confusing as there were two types of boat options you can take, however which ever one you are paying the extra for no one seemed to be able to specify. So the boat ride to us was no good because you don't see any animals on them, but the rest of the park was nice which is why I'm making this as Average instead of Terrible.
The biggest attraction here at the moment though seems to be the Pandas which had a large crowd swooning over them. That is pretty much it though...

title: Good for half day
content:
I felt that the area is quite small and the number of species were not so great. Good thing is that we went there on a day when it was raining very heavily but to my surprise this place is sheltered and we managed to see most of the attractions. They opened the amazon river quest and river cruise after the rain stopped. My kids enjoyed the amazon river quest but the river cruise is very disappointing.

Better avoid the river cruise. Don't miss the amazon river quest.

title: Brilliant
content:
went to River Safari Park, primarily to see the giant pandas. Used public transport which was reasonably easy, just make sure you have the right change for public buses as no change is given. As is typical in Singapore it has a tropical climate so the day we went it was raining (all day). No problem in this park at all as all the walkways are covered so no need for an umbrella. Also if this had been a hot sunny day then the covered walkways provide shelter from the sun.
This is a themed pard following the rivers of the world. Brilliantly themed areas, and as you would expect in Singapore spotlessly clean.
All the animal/fish enclosures are clean and animals and fish look well looked after.
Got to see the pandas Kai Kai and Jia Jia, again this is a well looked after and clean attraction, the pandas have a large well themed area to stroll around in, with outdoor space if they want to go outside. Their enclosure is air conditioned so has a nice constant temperature.
Food inside the park is a little on the expensive side but you can leave the park (get your hand stamped for re-entry) and go to one of the food outlets just by the parks entrance.
We found this a fascinating experience, well themed and totally clean park well worth a visit at S$25 to enter.
The only gripe is the number of people who take pictures with flash when there are many signs telling not to use.
All in all a great day out if you are in Singapore.

title: Another option for zoos
content: We both enjoyed is well set out and caters to family's well. Enjoyed the experience and would recommended . We have been several times to Singapore and I still feel that there zoos are one of the most amazing in the world

title: If You Are An Animal Lover, You Will Appreciate It!!!
content:
First and foremost, I would like to state that this review is honestly .... One year late.... I first visited this attraction last year on my birthday with my wife. I learnt that locals (Not applicable to foreigners) visiting this attraction will be granted free entry on their birthdays. So I decided to give it a try. True enough, I was given free entry . So I also bought another ticket to Singapore Zoo for my wife as we had not been there for quite some time now.

Back to this River Safari attraction.... To save your reading time, I will just say this....

My Personal Ratings ( I am an animal lover) => 5 Stars

Highly Recommended => YES!!!

Number of Times I had visited since last year (Sept '13) => 7 or 8 times

Did I join its Annual Membership program ( Known as Friends of River Safari)? => Yes

Am I an Employee or Affliated to River Safari in any way? => No

Do I know any person from the Management Level or know any staff there? => No

This attraction is sheltered so the chances of you getting wet in case of rain is minimum. Once u reach the attraction, please first turn LEFT after showing your tickets to the entrance staff to a " not so prominent" sliding door entrance which is dimly lit .... After that it is sheltered all the way for this attraction. The only non- sheltered areas are the River Cruise, Amazon River Quest and Squirrel Monkey Forest.

This attraction is quite well laid out so u are fine as long as u follow the shelter walk way. This attraction showcase the different types of animals found in different major rivers of the world. Hence, for eg, for the Congo River exhibit area, we had a chance to see the famous Tiger fish up close. This is what we can only see previously from the National Geographic channel .... A little info on this fish .... A lot of people do not know, this fish is perhaps one of the most difficult to catch as the Congo River is fame for it's its huge underwater currents and rapids. So catching them definitely poses great challenges.... What u will be seeing is just small to medium size specimens, the larger ones are not available but nonetheless, to me, it's still a wonderful sight.

After walking for a while, u will come to the star attraction which is the Panda forest. A tip here .... Try to reach the Panda forest by 1400hrs or 1600 hrs .... These are the Panda feeding times and the best time for taking pics ..... The attraction has 2 pandas .... The male one is always outside but the female one is the shy one ..... She will only come out during feeding time so the only way to get a glimpse of her is during the times I mentioned above.

Next, u will come to a long bridge across our reservoir. Once on the other side, if u are looking to take both the River Cruise ($5 per adult) and the Amazon River Cruise ($5 per adult), then turn to your left immediately. There are also a couple of small exhibits near the cruise entrance. But if u are not taking either of the cruise, then please u- turn back and continue your journey.

Qn: Are the rides worth taking? I personally ( with my wife) had taken both cruises. Honest opinion? For River Cruise, u will not miss anything if u skip it. Why we took it is Because of 2 reasons ..... The first is curiosity and the second is bcos since we are both animals lovers, if the $10 spent can go to the better being of the animals, then why not since we are already there.... For the Amazon River Quest, as being reported by a number of reviewers here, it ended in about 10 to 15 mins .... If you are going to choose between the 2 cruises, then I will recommend this one coz there are more animals to see ..... But honestly, u will not lose much if u forego it.... Like I mentioned earlier, if u think the extra dollar u spent will go towards the better welfare of the animal, then go for it .... But if u are on a tight budget that every cent counts, then just skip it.

There will be a couple of attractions more before u come to the ultimate Amazon Flooded Forest. I just love it here ..... My record, I personally sat here for close to 30 mins before I left.... Once u are there, u will know why I love it. I will not reveal too much for now.

This whole attraction can be covered in about 2 to 2 and a half hours at a leisure slow pace for first timers.

All in all, the information I provided above is best to my knowledge that I have. I only reveal the more important ones so that first timers can take note.

To end, please let me say this, if u think the attraction is fantastic, please help to spread the word around. For me, this attraction for once, let me have the feeling that the organizers had put more soul into it which is what I like. No doubt the entrance fee is high to many people, once u immerse yourself into it, in fact to me the price is still ok. In fact after every trip, my wife and I will make a small donation at the exits. There are a few man-made "Pangolins" around the entrance and exit areas. Some are not so prominent. But if u think u have your money's worth and u think the animals are in need of better help, please do your part by donating a bit which my wife and I have always done.

For Summary:
The Zoo, Night Safari and River Safari are side by side. If u coming by public transport, first take a train to Ang Mo Kio. Then from the bus interchange, take bus no. 138. It is a looping service. Meaning the service will end at the Zoo before making a "u turn" back to Ang Mo Kio. The bus ride alone will take about 30mins (plus and minus 10 mins) depending on traffic conditions.

Best time to come: To reach the attraction1200 hrs to 1230hrs or 1400hrs to 1430hrs. Why? Coz that will give u sufficient time to reach the Pandas enclosure in time for their feeding times and picture taking.

For locals, please try to come on your birthday itself coz u will save on the entrance fee.

The best is this: since u are coming to River Safari, u might as well combine the Night Safari attraction to your itenary. After u have finished River Safari, u can take a rest, have a slow meal at the restaurants u find there or there is also a " food court" at the Night Safari area. The latter opens at about 1730 hrs if I am not wrong. Please correct me if I am. After recharging your batteries, u can then have energy to continue the a night Safari tour. :)))

I will not write about Night Safari here. I will leave it for the next review.

Bottom line: doing River Safari and Night Safari is time saving. Purchasing both tickets in advance on their main web page offer u discounts as well.

Just a final bit on my part, in this review, I highly mentioned River Safari and finally Night Safari.... Tongue in cheek, u fellows out there will know what I mean .... :)))

For now, just enjoy your time when u are there. To every one out there, have a great time, take care and good luck.... :)))

title: Fun Time with Kids
content: A friend of mine recommending this when I was planning a short trip with my 3 girls: 6.5yo, 5yo and 3.5yo. We stayed at Killiney Rd and took a more or less 40mins cab ride to reach this place. We came in on Sunday, luckily the crowd was not so bad. The place is not too big to explore, but if you're visiting with multiple young kids (and their grandpa & grandma) just like my hubby and I were, you'd appreciate it. We arrived around 11.30AM and finished around 2PM, which already incl. snacking and lunch and 2 toilets stop. We didn't do the boat, but we enjoyed the Wild Amazone Quest ride which took just a few minutes, but for the kids, it's entertaining enough, and that's important to us, entertaining the 3 kids without getting too exhausted. For first timer (young kids) I think it's quite ok. They have few cafes and KFC. The toilets area are decent. I also like that 2 of our bigger girls were excited to read map on their own whilst they're here. All and all, adults might feel it's not that impressive, but the little ones were quite happy they thank me for taking them to this River Safari.

title: A safari with a modern touch
content:
Spent about half a day at river safari, although adults without young children could probably cover it in 2-3 hrs. The people behind the place has taken into consideration Singapore's weather, thus it is mainly sheltered. There was a pretty good array of animals, with the Stars being the pandas including the red one.

Overall enjoyable, however I suspect the avid animal lover might just be a tad disappointed over the number of animals (could have been more).

title: A 1 day trip to river safari
content: river safari was a great experience for families, couples, or for yourself, especially the 'river quest' ride. The river quest ride was really fun to me as there was a small slope for the boat to slide down and water to splash you a the beginning. However, I think that it would give a bad impression for those who did not like roller coasters and log rides. but I also enjoyed the different types of rivers like the mekong river and so on. After all, it's still a great experience to me:)

title: Great Rivers of the World
content:
This new attraction is adjacent to the Zoo and Night Safari. Don't get over excited - I reckon it would be darn near impossible to do justice to all 3 in the one day let alone, I reckon it would be physically impossible. Zoo or River Safari followed by the Night Safari would even be a challenge for those of us getting on a bit.

There are so many 'must see' attractions in Singapore and this is yet another. essentially giant aquariums 'landscaped' (some how that doesn't sound right) allow you to view the fish and other water based creatures of the worlds great rivers. ie the Nile, Congo, Mississippi, Ganges, and Amazon to name a few. Even Australia's Murray River was represented. T

We took a ride on the Amazon River Quest (a flume ride in some theme parks). It was great but went too fast and was over too soon.The rapids creating the fast water flow were fun but a slower more sedate ride would have given more time to see the animals that were supposed to be the attraction.

One of the other attractions which seemed a bit out of place were the pandas - both red pandas and the great white pandas. The enclosures were well designed and the animals actually seemed to be enjoying life.

Another land based attraction was the cheeky little spider monkeys. They were a delight to watch. It was amazing how creatures so small could make such a big noise

he Amazon Flooded Forest is reputed to be the worlds largest fresh water aquarium - an eye opening finale to the safari. All in all a great but tiring day

title: Expected more
content:
I saw banners advertising River Safari back in 2011 and got excited then. Perhaps it was the graphic on the banner but I was expecting a 'bigger' representation of the river. It wasn't too bad but I felt like I was just looking at aquariums and pools rather than cross sections of the different rivers. It does not feel like a new experience - more like a typical well-maintained aquarium. For the entrance price, it is a bit small so you feel that it is a tad pricey.
There are two rides - River Cruise and Amazon River Quest were reasonably priced at SGD5 per person but I would suggest giving the River Cruise a miss. It was just a short ride around the lake (reservoir) and the only animals you see are the giraffes and elephants from Singapore Zoo next door. The boat guide, while pleasant and friendly, gives the impression that she has gone through her spiel multiple times.
Amazon River Quest was better but it ended all too soon. If you have to pick one ride, take this one.
Other attractions that I enjoyed were the panda area - here you can see red pandas and giant pandas; and the two-level pool with manatees.

title: Pleasantly surprised
content: This attraction is new since my last visit to Singapore, so had to be added to the list of parks to be seen. We went on a week day after visiting Singapore Zoo, and found it quiet in comparison, pleasant and easy to get around. We took a ride on the Amazon River Quest which was far too fast to get a good look at the animals, much less take photos. I didn't mind paying the extra $5, but the trip was over too quickly. The exhibits were well set up, and it's virtually impossible to get lost and see the same exhibit over and over, unlike the zoo. The panda exhibit was a surprise, and they looked very happy and cool. Having seen them at the Chengdu breeding base in China, I thought this exhibit was very well laid out. My big thrill was seeing the giant river otter exhibit where mum, dad and the two youngsters were full on! We watched the interaction between this cute family for quite a time and it was very entertaining. Also seeing manatees for the first time was special. Their part of the aquarium is boasted to be the largest freshwater exhibit in the world and they - and in fact all the animals - looked content and very well cared for. I actually preferred this park to the aquarium on Sentosa.

title: Fantastic - well worth seeing
content: The River Safari did not disappoint. It was set out well and the animals looked very well looked after. The panda bears and the spider monkeys were my favourite. The only disappointment was the Amazon Quest Boat ride which was great fun but went way too fast. Other than that it was a fabulous day!

title: Well worth a visit
content: My husband and I had a great time at River Safari. We went to the zoo in the morning and had some spare time so decided to go to the River Safari in the afternoon - we are glad we did!! We loved it so much more than the zoo. It is smaller than the zoo but the lay out is fantastic, minimal walking between exhibits, all under cover so when it rains you don't get wet. There are some great fish to see as well as some animals. The pandas were fantastic. The "Amazon River quest" boat ride was well worth the $5. It's a water ride (you won't get wet) that takes you around to see about 12 different animals (you have to look out for them - you may miss some of them as the boat is continually moving.) The ride is enjoyable even if you don't see all the animals. River Safari is well worth the trip and would be great with kids!

title: Mixed feeling
content:
The river safari is one of the latest wildlife attraction in singapore..as a local, i must say its still nowhere near our famous singapore zoo and night safari..but still there is a good side to this new attraction..

Pros:
Its a sheltered attraction..plenty of seats to rest..clean environment..clean restroom..friendly staff..the red panda were super friendly giving potential photographer ample opportunity to snap good photos..good variety of river creatures to learn from..

Cons:
Find it abit expensive considering the prices is almost on par with the singapore zoo but much smaller in terms of size..no halal eateries for muslim traveller like the singapore zoo..the river adventure quest boat ride were too short n fast..should not charge it as an additional attraction..

Tips:
Give the river cruise a miss..save S$5..its just a 10min cruise on the river..book online to get additional 5% discount..

I clear the river safari in 2.5hrs at slow pace..

Nevertheless it still worth to give it a try..would be better if they expand the river safari collection..

title: Outing with Family
content: We went with children below age of 12 and Grandparents. Compared to Singapore Zoo, the area is smaller and we had no problems walking around it. There are plenty of seats available for you to take a quick rest at all junction. The main attraction for us would be the Giant Panda Forest and the Amazon Flooded Forest. We had a great time watching the Red Pandas. One of it was super friendly and was looking at cameras, posing for us (unbelievably cute). The Amazon Flooded Forest was beautiful and with varied fishes. Thou, it was sad that some visitors refused to switch off the flashes when taking pictures. I hope management can station some staff to monitor this situation so that the animal in the aquarium will not be affected by the constant flashing lights. Overall it was a good visit. We spent about 3 hours there.

title: Love pandas....
content:
More fitting as an educational field trip for children. Suggest to combine with a visit to the nearby Singapore zoo to make the day worthwhile.

If you love pandas...then make the trip there. They are truly adorable. There is a lot of walking if you intend to see all the "rivers" in this safari.

title: Its different
content: Imagine being on a small boat and going past a live Jaguar or a flock of pink birds or some really cute monkeys. Or seeing some realy massive sting rays in action and some really rare sea creatures. Walking past the legendary rivers of the world. This one is a must.

title: Great pit stop when it rains!
content:
If you're at the zoo and a sudden downpour happens, make your way over to the River Safari as it's entirely under cover. It's not as great as the zoo but there some nice exhibits with interesting facts. It's also got one of the best panda enclosures I have been too (have seen HK and Scotland). I didn't go on the amazon cruise but my husband went and said it was pretty good.

Seeing the different species in different types of rivers was interesting and the bite sized facts provided were interesting. I don't think it's worth a trip by itself, but if you're going to see the zoo, it's definitely worth paying a bit more money and spending 1-2 hours at the river adventure.

title: A poor choice, I'm afraid.
content:
I am often the kind of reviewer that can find something really positive about an attraction, a hotel or a meal, and make it the highlight of my review. Sadly, I struggle with the River Safari because it did not meet any pre-conceived expectations nor did it set any expectations either. I had heard great things about the Singapore Zoo and the Night Safari from other travelers, so I presumed the same could be said for the River Safari. I booked a tour through the hotel tour desk group for the River Safari and the Night Safari combined. I was genuinely excited when I first arrived. I then began my journey winding back and forth through the various river systems. I thought that this would be a Safari adventure on the water, but soon realised that it was like any other amphibious and aquatic zoo. I felt the exhibitions were really underdeveloped given that the focus was on major river systems of the world. Surely this can't be the extent of the exhibits and the information? Don't get me wrong there were some great moments like the Panda exhibit (would we consider them to be River Safari relevant though?), and the Giant River Otters (very cool!); but all in all, it seemed just a bit, well, dull. There seemed to have been more effort made on the Halloween adventure for kids than anything else! Anyway, my face lit up when I read on the map that there are Safari boat rides! Maybe this first part was just the lead up to something bigger and better! I get to the River Cruise line only to be told that I have to pay an additional fee to go on the boat. Excuse me? You trade under the name 'River Safari' not 'River Safari at an additional price'. I decide to pay the money ($5 pp) and take a boat ride around the reservoir because I certainly don't feel like I've got enough out of this place yet. The boat ride lasts about 15 minutes and we learn about Singapores water supply, see a couple of giraffes and a couple of elephants from a distance. Boo, hiss. I start winding my way through the second part of the exhibit and read about the Adventure Cruise. Upon arrival, what's that? Another $5 pp please. This is getting ridiculous now - but if you want to see some of the more cooler exhibitions, then tourist, you're going to have to pay for that. The Adventure Cruise is akin to the log ride at Dreamworld, though I found it to be too fast to enjoy the animals or get a good snap of them. I must admit it was quite peaceful floating around the exhibit on my own - 1600 seems to be a kid-free and line-free time.

All in all, a real disappointment, and given I only had limited time in Singapore, I'm gutted that I chose the 'Not-so-River Safari' over the Singapore Zoo. There needs to be a lot of development of this site; and/or combine the admission price/entire location for the RS and the SZ; oh and stop the tourist trap rubbish and making folks pay for what ideally should be an included service. At this stage, I do not recommend.

title: An educational tour
content:
You may consider this trip as an educational tour where you meet exotic animals and fishes such as Pandas, polar bears, dugong, giant catfish, etc. Learn Geography about the world's river system and Science about the land and water creatures of the world.

Not to be missed are the Panda exhibits Jia Jia and Kai Kai and the world's largest fresh-water aquarium. You may give Amazon River Quest a miss as it is only 10 minutes and too fast to see anything. Also, some animals may disappear and go to sleep zzzzz. Ha ha. Not worth the S45.

title: The river cruise is not worth it!
content:
Overall, it was a very nice place to spend time with the kids. The whole area is almost covered and the panda exhibition was a joy to watch.

Things which should be taken note of:

1) The polar bear exibition: The Big bear was too far away and could hardly see it.
2) The Amazon Cruise was too fast so u would not be able to take a good look at the animals.
3) The river Cruise: It cost SGD5 per person and all u do is to ride around a lake for 10 mins. For the price, it is not worth it. The value of the ride is only worth SGD1 in my opnioin

title: River Safari
content: I can say that River Safari is worth to visit. After so many years I have not been to the zoo. Please bring more water as the weather is hot there. The prices there is slightly higher so advisable to buy before you come. Camera is another thing which you should bring along. I am happy to see more attractions at the zoo.

title: Very Good experience
content:
We went there yesterday. Amazing place for kids to learn about the fauna of major river systems in the world. Singapore is quite hot and humid, and you need to walk a lot to cover this safari. But it is worth as you get to see many varieties of fishes, crocodiles, Panda (my daughter loved it), Polar bear, jaguars, water monitor lizard and many more.

Pros:
1. Huge collection of species
2. Very informative display
3. Entire area is shaded to beat the sun
4. Panda is a huge attraction
5. Very clean and well maintained place
6. A must visit for kids

Cons:
1. It can be very tiring walk due to Singapore weather
2. The River cruise is not worth, please avoid it. Instead take Amazon boat ride, which is fun and kids would love it

TIP:

The combo ticket for river safari and ride entitles you only for one ride out of cruise and amazon boat ride. Opt for the later as river cruise is of no use. You can not spot animals.

They have height restriction for amazon boat ride, so please make sure about the height of your kid before purchasing tickets.

title: Not worth it unless you want to see Pandas
content:
We purchased a package that included the river safari. Keep in mind if you actually want to ride the river boat this coasts extra and don't see anything. The Amazon river ride is hight restricted so my two youngest childern (4 and 2) could not ride it, again you had to pay extra.

I was thinking what a waste of time and money until we entered into the Panada exhibit. I, nor my family, have ever seen Pandas so it was a treat to see the Panada's, this saved the experinced for me. I think we spent an hour just watching the Panada's.

If you have already seen Panadas or they don't interest you then I think the rest of the exhibits may not be of interest and best to save your time and money. I would still recommend the zoo and the night safari.

title: Enjoyed with kids ages 9 and 11
content:
We are an American family with 2 girls ages 9 and 11. I agonized over which to visit, night safari zoo or this River safari. In the end we decided on this mostly for the Pandas. I'm glad we did!

We arrived at 9:30 on a Sunday, it was not crowded at all. The weather was hot and humid which was worrisome for us but there was plenty of shade and air-conditioned areas.

It's set up as a route all going one way so it's difficult to go back to anything (you would be going against the crowd). I wanted to stay at the panda longer but our amazon river quest boat was booked for 11 so we needed to move along. Going all the way back thru would of been exhausting so we didn't.

The amazon river quest was fun but quick and better suited for younger kids. Saw a few animals but not a ton more. Annoying that it was an extra cost.

We finished up in about 3 hours.

We packed water and snacks and brought them in no problem.

Have fun!

title: A great experience
content: Our hotel organised for us to be taken and collected from the River Safari. We had the entire afternoon to wander through the exhibits. The fish and wildlife of the rivers of the world were brilliantly displayed and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. There was quite a bit of strolling around (fairly level) and we were entertained at every part of the experience. Loved the Pandas and the jaguar! Would recommend to friends.

title: Must go.
content: My 5 years old son enjoyed it do much. Worth the price or not really depend on whether you like the environment or not. For me, I think it is unique in Asia. I think you should not able to the similar well organized river park in Asia.

title: Overall it was pleasant visit
content:
Visited it on tuesday so there were barely no crowd. Separated from the main zoo, so you need to pay separately if you want to go to both. Loved the big river and the nature, like you were not in singapore. Actually there are more indoor exhibit than outdoor so you won't get exhausted cause the heat..a lot of fresh water fish, some are really big, like fish from amazon.. the main object, of course the panda. This big cute bear will attract crowd, although do not move too much, but seem happy. I took a log flume that go through some animal exhibit, but seem the animal are pretty shy at that time, so no much too see
The main aquarium tank is pretty big, recommend to see.
You could also eat panda look buns, which actually to cute to eat.
A lot of haloween decoration, since it was halloween time when i visited it. The exhibit information is informative yet suitable for young age

title: Great addon to the zoo
content: This is not as big as the zoo and can be covered in 3-4 hours. We reached here at around 1 pm after we had covered the zoo. Unfortunately the Amazon River Quest ride was suspended until further notice on the day of our visit. The main highlights for us were of course, the pandas, red panda, squirrel monkeys, crocodile.

title: It was fun
content: Enjoyed this attraction last May. We chose this over Singapore zoo because we have seen lots of zoos already. We wanted to experience the boating quest. The Amazon river quest boat ride was kind of short though and didn't see the jaguar. Anyway the giant Pandas were cute.

title: Great for kids, but overpriced.
content:
Summary: If you've been to the Singapore Zoo and could live with not seeing the Pandas, you may skip this. If you must see the Pandas and able to shrug off the little naggy feeling of being ripped off, it's still a good experience.

River Safari is, as the name implies, a river-themed park. The experience is rather linear, ie your typical adventure will start from the entrance beginning with the 6 iconic rivers of the world, Panda, cross the bridge over to Boat Plaza for the Cruise & boat ride, head towards Amazon Flooded Forest, end. It's much smaller than Singapore Zoo and generally 2-3 hours is sufficient. More if you intend to read every explanatory boards. Most of the park is covered, so it makes checking the weather forecast less of a major concern. As you go through the 6 rivers of the world, there is very few memorable experience except maybe the up close encounter with the big croc at Ganges River, provided it is resting by the glass and you can examine it closely. If not by the glass, you can't even see it because the water is murky. The rest are mostly freshwater fishes, more fishes and oh, have i mentioned fishes? That's all I have to say for the 6 rivers, let's get on with the rest of the attraction.

We visited early in the morning on a weekday. I suggest you make a beeline to the Panda first thing in the morning when there's no crowd. We're lucky because the Pandas were active when we visited providing lots of photo opportunities and selfies if that's your kind of thing. Also because there're just us with virtually no one else so it's a leisurely and peaceful experience. If your timing is less fortunate and visit during their nap time, you may see KaiKai napping in the exhibit enclosure and JiaJia retreating to her "private chamber" you can view her through live CCTV feed. The Panda exhibit is very kid-friendly. In fact, so do most of the theme park. Take note it's air-conditioned and could be a little cold for some. So a sweater may be a good call if you plan to spend a long time with the Pandas.

Besides the Pandas (which is undoubtedly the main attraction), there are few other highlights. Let's look at some of them.

Cruise: Not included in the entrance ticket, pay separately. Decided to give it a try for the kids even though I suspected it will not be worth it and I was proven correct. The cruise started off with the friendly guide giving some safety instructions and introduction to the tour. The cruise goes around a circle hugging the coast line in a clockwise round turn so I suggest you sit on the left side to have closer view to shore. As it cruise along you hear some commentaries but i wasn't paying much attention to it cranking my neck trying to see any giraffes, or elephants. The ride is super smooth (umm, you're in a reservoir, not open sea) and it provides a new perspective looking at the reservoir from the water. It takes about 15min for a round trip and for you to realize "dang, could have skip this".

Amazon River Quest is a fun boat ride taking you through many turns and exhibits. Again admission fee is separate from the entrance ticket so you need to purchase separately (you will be asked at the ticketing counter if you want this, can add on to the entrance ticket). The problem is, the ride is very short only about 10min or maybe less but the worst part is during our visit most of the animals are in hiding. According to the park map there are about 11 types of animals for this boat ride but we only managed to see 4. 2 types of monkeys, flamingo and scarlet birds. Yes you've been pre-warned that you might not get to see all animals. I can understand that and was prepared not to expect to see all of them but still, less than half is hugely disappointing. If you're lucky and get to see most of them, this is definitely a fun & exciting adventure, despite having to pay extra for a very short experience.

Squirrel Monkey Forest was one of our look-forward to exhibit but unfortunately it was closed for maintenance. Lesson learnt: do not trust the website 100%, because no where it was stated that it's closed for maintenance (you get to see lots of pop-up reminding you when the Amazon River Quest boat ride will be closed). With not much else that's unique in River Safari, this closure is a blow and another let down, especially when it's not made known on its website despite being a long closure (over few weeks, not just a day). Tip: call to ask any exhibit that you planned to see is closed.

Next notable mention is the Amazon Flooded Forest. which is my personal favourite and one of the few places that's air-conditioned though not as cold as Panda's. There you get to see otters, manatees, sting-rays among others. It houses the biggest aquarium display River Safari has to offer. Not to be missed. I would prefer that there are more different "behind the scenes" educational videos instead of a short same video that keeps repeating. If you've been to Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan or Okinawa Churaumi, this will pale in comparison but then again it's not a fair comparison. My point is don't get your expectations up too high.

Wrap up:
If a friend asks me whether it's a good place to visit, I would say it depends on a number of factors, putting personal interests aside. I'll just repeat my first opening paragraph here and add on to that:

If you've been to the Singapore Zoo and could live with not seeing the Pandas, you may skip this. If you must see the Pandas, and able to shrug off the little naggy feeling of being ripped off, it's still a good experience. If you're going with kids, it's still great for them. River Safari is very new in 2014, if you can wait, give it time to mature and hold off your visit till 2018 or when there is a great promotion to take advantage of (like, 1-for-1 promo).

For me the overall park experience is 4-star out of 5. Minus 1 star for the steep price considering the size, number of exhibits and paying extra for rides, and another star for all the negative experiences. At the current price structure and its overall experience, I suspect this will be our only visit in the next 10 years. Many rooms for improvement, and it will only get better.

title: Thoughtful exhibits but only two highlights for me
content: What has been done here with the quality of some of the enclosures and exhibits is admirable. However, I cannot help but feel a sense of cynicism that River Safari was created as a separate attraction and the pandas placed there to create a second entry fee point. Let’s face it; in any zoo around the world, the pandas are generally a star attraction. If you want to see the pandas in Singapore, you have to pay to also come to River Safari as well as the zoo, because they are not at the zoo, situated right next door. OK, that’s my gripe, now to the review. The River Safari is organized according to the major rivers of the world i.e. Mississippi, Congo, Nile, Ganges, Mekong and Yangtze. Whilst the attraction has over 6000 animals on display, including 40 threatened species, many of these are various types of fish. It has the world’s largest freshwater aquarium. The kids, and there were many thousands of them attending the day we were there, were enthralled by the giant catfish and other huge fish on display in the aquarium. We rushed past those to the Yangtze enclosure to beat the crowds to view the pandas. This enclosure is toward the end of the River Safari enclosures. This was worthwhile. We got a great view of Kai Kai sitting eating his bamboo for quite some time. Jai Jai is not so laid back and seemed agitated and just wanted to get back into the area where she would not be on display. The red panda was cute. The flooded Amazon Flooded Forest was an excellent exhibit. We didn’t do the River Safari boat ride because the location where it is situated on the river was just so unbearably humid that we couldn’t face it. We really felt that we had seen the best of the exhibits by walking through 3/4 of the area on foot anyway. After about 90 minutes we headed next door to the zoo. We got the park hopper ticket including two attractions for SIN $50. We bought it online and got 5% discount. The 20% discount that they advertise online is only for Singapore based credit cards.

title: A Must visit if you want to see the Panda & Amazon Animals
content:
Earlier it was Singapore Zoo itself
Presently it has been divided into Zoo, River Safari and Night Safari.
All have a fee for their visit.
River Safari ride is good and the amazonian river quest is a nice ride.
Best place to see the Panda.
would prefer a combo of Zoo + River Safari + Jurong Bird Park
Night Safari could be optional and is nothing great as advertised and as it was earlier.

title: Good for Panda
content:
We visited only for the Panda. Otherwise it is very normal with lots of fish, croc, turtle etc. If you visit SEA and the Zoo, you can skip this.

BUUUUUT the highlight is the Panda and the Jaguar. Panda is so cute. Saw the Jaguar in the Amazon boat ride. Boat ride is good eventhough it is very quick one.

title: River Safari
content: I was a little disappointed that the boat was not in operation during my visit however River Safari still has lots to offer. Very pleasant but not as absorbing or interesting as Singapore Zoo. Good to see the Giant Pandas 😄

title: Some nice spots but over-priced on the overall
content:
Was here with family. There are a couple of pretty well-done up exhibits - the Mississippi river-themed one and also the Amazon Flood Forest were especially memorable. But the overall experience was disappointing; the park is much smaller than the main Zoo just beside it, and too many attractions required additional charges. Making matters worse is the relatively high-admission ticket prices for just main entry. Lastly, the Squirrel Monkey exhibit was close on the day of visit.

On the plus-side; the place is more weather-friendly than the main zoo, in that most of the park is sheltered. We can easily spend 4-5 hours at the main zoo and still feel as though we haven't spent enough time soaking in all the sights. At the River Safari? We saw all we wanted to see in less than 2 hours.

title: Interesting fact-filled Safari
content: Was a fantastic fact-filled morning, kids soaked up all the information readily available at each point along the paths. Very informative - extra points given for wonderful information. We all learnt something from our visit. Displays were nicely laid out. If you are visiting the zoo, make sure you include this in your trip - a couple of hours in the morning here and then the zoo afterwards, a great day out. We missed the River Safari Boat by choice, looked a bit boring but did the Amazon log ride - which was great! The monkey house was a huge hit too - the kids were fascinated being so close to little creatures running around right in front of them!

title: An interesting alternative to the zoo
content: you visit the different rivers of the world and discover what lives in and around them and also the issues surrounding water and wildlife. Really nicely done, zones to chill out in (esp Manatee section) River safari boat ride was closed which was a shame but we had a great time when we doubled back to see the pandas late afternoon when they were active. Allow about 3 hours to do this properly (more if it is busy)

title: Loved It!
content:
What a great addition to the amazing experiences that Singapore has to offer. This was a great and educational walk around with some of the best displays I have seen - and of course those Pandas! I could have sat and watched them for hours.

As a family we really enjoyed our time here and it is great value especially if you take it as a package with the Zoo or book on line prior to arrival.

title: Exciting adventure
content: This safari is not one in a tour as I had thought but sort of like a mix between a zoo and an aquarium that you walk around yourself. It was very educational and I saw lots of amazing animals, many I had never seen before. Really enjoyed my time here :)

title: Worth it for the Pandas
content: Well this is brilliant and so lovely walk round and boat ride and well worth the cost is considerably cheap for experience. It is worth it alone to spend some time of the Panda home...we were in there for over an hour watching them eat, play and sleep was an experience we will never forget. Like the zoo do not be afraid to get the mtr and bus there it's easy to do and soo cheap. You don't need to taxi or private transfer,

title: Panda Heaven!
content:
The River / Night Safari and Zoo are a reasonable distance from the city centre (a taxi or the MRT & bus away), but, it is well worth the trip to see them (They are side by side, and it's possible to do all three in a day if you choose).
The tour takes you along several of the worlds rivers, with the animals related to them. The enclosures for the animals seem to be large and well suited to the animals. Sadly the Amazon Boat Quest was closed when I visited, however, the highlight of the River Safari are the Pandas. They are in a large climate controlled habitat which allows you to get close to them without disturbing them.
There are numerous food outlets and gift shops which allow you to spend a pleasant day there.

title: Fantastic
content: This is a great place to spend a couple of hours! Highlight was definitely the pandas!!!! Unfortunately the amazon river boat ride was closed for maintenance but nonetheless we had a great time! There is only one path around the entire park and its all shaded which is great when trying to stay out of the sun! Plenty of air-conditioned areas and the squirrel monkey forest is a blast. The monkeys are all out in the open and will even jump on the rails or onto the path you're walking on. Make sure you stop at Mama Panda's for a coffee and snack!

title: Great experience
content: We were a group of adults and we thoroughly enjoyed this attraction. I can imagine how kids would love this place. It is really a walking safari, but undercover (the river safari part is a minor part of the attraction). The pandas were delightful, the large aquarium interesting and the monkeys very cute- you can get very close to them as they are free to run within their enclosed area. Take the kids if you are in Singapore.

title: Suitable for children
content:
If you are a family with little children, then you have to visit this place. We spent half day in here, much longer than what we planned. Because lot of fun things that my boy loved it!
We get cheaper tickets, thanks to our hotel's concierge, we can get 10-15% disc for the entrance ticket, and its better deal than buying online.
Overall its a good experience, our family enjoyed it!

title: There's room for improvement
content:
Pros
- River cruise was a disappointment, nothing much to see. its a 10 mins ride (or shorter)
- Best to arrive at 9am to enjoy the morning with very little crowd, best to take photo.
- Eateries are located everywhere.
- Overall, it was very educational and fruitful trip.
- This trip takes about half a day to complete.
- Take bus from 'Choa Chu Kang' bus terminal for bus no. 927 or 'Ang Mo Kio' bus terminal for bus no. 138. Both frequency are rather fast.

Cons
- Make sure both amazon cruise and river cruise are fully open.
- One of the Amazon cruise was closed for maintainenance (but able to view again within one month from date of purchase)
- Suggest to purchase ticket online to avoid long q at entrance.
- Sovernior shop have very limited gifts for purchase.
- There's no 'live show' like zoo

check out my photos!

Cheers~

title: Absolutely wonderful.
content: I think we have been to almost every zoo in the world, and we found the River Safari amazing. The enclosures are certainly world-class, and there were a great many unusual animals. We usually are not too thrilled by aquariums, but these had us spell-bound. Watching a mother otter teach her cubs to swim was magic, as were the red pandas, giant pandas, and spider monkeys. In the heat, I thought that my husband would do well to spend 2 hours there. He eventually came away after 5 hours! Of course, some exhibits are air-conditioned, so that definitely helped. I would HIGHLY recommend the River Safari to anyone who likes animals.

title: VERY BAD!!!
content: It was a bad experience.it was not a safari at all but just a simple stupid boat ride.we paid much at the entrance and we were shocked when we came to know that it was just a entry fee,boat ride fee was inside. We were four people and we paid at least 80 dollars for entry fee. I am suggesting u that please don't go there and waste money.

title: Excellent place for kids
content:
If you've time to go to only one place in your Singapore visit, River Safari should be in the top of the list. Not because it is fun or anything but that it is educative, it has beautiful exhibits covering the different river systems of the world and for kids, it has a couple of fantastic river rides.
And instead of the 2 hours we planned, we ended up spending twice the amount of time there. The other attraction of the River safari are the two Giant Pandas. Though we've seen the Giant Panda's in an exhibit in the Atlanta Zoo some time back, here it it more closer and with no glass wall in between, it was fun to watch. Again, the kids had loads of fun here with not much crowd, we could hang around for whatever time we wished to be around.

title: adorable
content: loved seeing the pandas eat and the polar bear swim. enjoyed the river safari too. mind the time some attractions like the pandas close at 5PM

title: Singapore never disappoints you!
content:
I had visited Singapore Zoo and Night Safari earlier in 2010 when River Safari was under construction. Once it was completed, I could not wait to be there again.

I visited River Safari in August 2014. It was an unforgettable experience. Both the Amazon River Quest and the Cruise ride were amazing. The approach of the Amazon Quest is another adventure in itself with amazing display of aquariums around you.

It usually rains almost everyday in Singapore, see if you could check the weather forecast before getting on the river cruise.

title: well organised, clean, natural landscape, well maintained
content: It's my first time visiting river safari. I visited during Chinese New year abd there were colourful blossoms and decoration of the Chinese animal zodiac at the entrance. The staffs were friendly, helpful and welcoming. The park was divided into different zone themes, mainly Yangtze river where u find the pandas, Amazon river, Mekong river with big cat fishes, Ganges river which have crocodiles. It's well laid out and the animals and fishes look happy. The mama panda restaurant is ok priced and offer oriental food and a special panda faced design Chinese bun.very sweet amd iunique. Best time to visit is the early morning to avoid too much sun but there'd pllenty of shelter and drink kiosk so hydration. is not a problem. Overall, a new, nice exotic park to see marine animals

title: skip it for the other parks
content: The only thing that is worth visiting are the Panda bears, all other animals are much better to see either in the Zoo or the night safari. We would not do it again and recommend the other parks instead.

title: River Safari: An enjoyable walk for family and kids
content:
Reading some comments about the River Safari, it looked like there were mixed reviews.

The River Safari is conveniently located next to the Singapore Zoo - I think from a day trip planning perspective, if you want to do Singapore Zoo, River Safari and Night Safari all in a day (little aggressive I know.. but do-able), you can allocate 1.5 to 2 hours for the visit (without the river cruise).

The River Safari was opened in 2013. I don't have the full history but some animals might have been moved over from Singapore Zoo. Obviously many more fishes and animals were added. My wife and I liked their idea of zoning the park based on the major rivers of the world - the Missouri, Nile, Ganges, Mekong, Chang Jiang etc.

We enjoyed the River Safari a lot. Give it a go!

title: A bit costly for a "mini zoo"
content:
The usual price for the ticket is about $24-25, i bought it at a discounted price $21.50 at groupon. You have to pay extra 5 bucks for each boat ride. The river cruise which cruise around the reservoir and the amazon quest which tours around the small river. We went for the river quest whereby you need to queue at the entrance for about 15 mins to get the time slow for the ride. If you buy online first it may save sometime. The river quest ride is very short say 5-6 minutes and too fast to capture the animals and take picture. Some stations you do not see the animals , it is dependent on your luck. If you do not take this ride you will complete the second half of the tour real fast.

It takes less than 30 minutes to pass through the exhibits and animals to get to the boat ride. After the boat ride you get to see the monkeys followed by a giant aquarium and then to the exit.
The rest of the animal and fishes exhibits are just ok. The fishes are somewhat similar to those at SEA aqurium at sentosa.

The highlights will probably be the pandas. The red pandas are real active and they do pose for picture taking. Whereas jia jia panda can be quite shy hiding in one corner. Kai kai is more active , he will move around and around.

If you stroll real slowly and look at each exhibit , you only need less than 1.5 hours for the whole river safari. a bit pricey for a small attraction.

title: Singapore made the River so amazing!
content: You cannot expect to view variety of animals like zoo here. As it is name as "River safari" , most of the animals living in water except two cute and lazy Panda (Jia Jia and Kai Kai). Not to miss the short river cruise ($5 for about 7 mins only).

title: Pleasant Zoo
content:
The plus side here yes it is a well shelted, good place to visit compare to other attraction on a hot humid day. I went on a Sunday, not crowded, easy to buy food compare to my experience at the main Zoo.
But if you have to choose between the main Zoo and river safari, main zoo has more to offer.
The exhibit here is kind of small scale, does not have wow factor.

title: Panda's !!!
content: This is a leisurely walk around the enclosures and aquariums and there is a short river cruise as well. The highlight of course is the pair of pandas on loan from China. They are so cute. You can also add the Night Safari and/or the Zoo to the day's activities as they are all in the same place.

title: Interesting but not fantastic!
content:
My 2nd time there with the kids. 1st time the boat ride was still not ready.
The panda exhibit is the most interesting followed by the squirrel monkey encounter.
Red pandas are very active.
The squirrel monkeys are playful and not afraid of strangers. They do all sorts of funny actions in front of us and we are able to take close snapshots of them playing and swinging from tree to tree.
The river adventure ride was a little disappointing as we didn't get to see all the animals featured. Guess the weather was too hot and they were resting under the shelter.
The big boat ride took us around the river part that covers night safari & singapore zoo. We were able to see the elephants, giraffes and rhino from the singapore zoo when we were on the boat.
The restaurant sells interesting panda bun with either chocolate custard or red bean filling. 1 bun for $2.90.
Overall interesting but not fantastic. There is still room for improvement.

title: Amazing - Lovely unique educational experience
content:
It's exotically different! I loved it and it made me think. I have been to China's Yangtse River and did not get to see what I saw at River Safari. Even if I traveled to the Amazon, Nile or Congo I realized I saw here what I would NEVER see even on-site!!!
The only species I had seen before was in the Mississippi area and only because I lived in the US for more than a decade, and fished around the tributaries of the Mississippi. I've been to Monterey Aquarium many times, that is an on-site aquarium and this River Safari is still unique.

Yes, I've previously seen Pandas as I had been to the Panda research centre in Chengdu China....This place just made me THINK - we've all seen spectacular aquariums!And some of my friends had been to Egypt, saw the pyramids and historical places and fabulous artifacts, but did not see much of Nile water/"marine" life ! I've been to Brazil - I saw the mighty Iguassu Falls but saw nothing of the riverine life. And the mighty Amazon tank here is amazingly large...I spent close to an hour here, cool if not colourful
The park is shaded throughout, with several airconditioned sections and all very well-paced. There're live riverine creatures to see every few steps, well explained and compared (how its different from those in other parts of the world) and featuring strong conservation messages throughout. Is it important to be good stewards as we all share planet earth, and want our future generations to see nature and what we can see today?
In fact maybe a third (30%?) of the living creatures at this river safari are on the verge of extinction so even more reason to go.
There is a short boat ride and while it's not my "must do", going just before park's closing time showed the fading colours of the day, a lovelier side of Singapore.
To beat the humidity, I would get here around 4 and see this just before night safari, with a dinner interlude outside night safari, in between. I think there are specially priced 2 park in a day packages. I think this River Safari is a wonderful complement to Singapore's outstanding zoo and night safari!

title: Quite Good!
content:
Had a good family time in the morning for a good 3 hours. Very interesting exhibits and the pathway through all the exhibits is sheltered or air-conditioned so it's good for young kids and not as tiring as the other WRS attractions. The distances between exhibits is short, so the kids have something to see almost all the time and are kept occupied constantly. Boat ride is quite disappointing, else it would have been 5/5.

Overall, a reasonably solid attraction worth at least a visit.

title: River safari is excellent
content: The boat ride,did not dislike anything,all the shows are great,exotic animals,bird show,everything is excellent

title: Slight disappointment
content: Good afternoon spent in the river safari, wasn't sure what to expect, I bought it was all a kind of river ride along a path spotting wildlife. Turns out this is not the case, you can pay extra to do this for 5/10minutes though which isn't worth the extra money. A log day and a lot of walking if you do the zoo and safari together on the same day. Not many places to eat inside and the Chinese restaurant had a queue out the door! I would recommend spending the full day at the zoo or safari not rushing around doing both as we did!

title: A must to visit
content:
Asia's first and only river- themed wild life park.
This safari takes us through several of the world's river systems,viz.The Mississippi, Yangtze, Murray, Nile, Congo and Ganges. The panda exhibit is very popular.A must to see giant Pandas Kai Kai and Jia Jia.
We get a chance to see various animals and different species like Anaconda, American Beavers, Mekong Fresh Water Stingrays, Giant Catfish, Jaguars, Giant Otters etc..
The entrance fee is SGD.5 and for Child SGD3/-
Worth the Visit.

title: River fishes & Panda
content:
My first time visit to this place. Went with the wife & 2 daughters. The place is wheelchair & stroller friendly. The whole place is fully sheltered thus no worry about rain nor hot sun. It is still outdoor though so dress light.

The place is basically an aquarium for river animals (mainly fishes, turtles & crocodiles). Major attraction is the pandas that were on loan from China for 10 years.

There are 2 optional rides inside: river quest & river cruise. Each ride cost $5 for adult & $3 for child (3-12 years old). My kids are below 3 years old so they ride free.

Did not go for the river quest due to height limitation (1.06m height min.). It is unfortunate because some of the exhibits can only be seen through this ride. You need to book the timing for the ride.

Went for the river cruise. Basically a 15-20 mins ferry ride that will went pass the rhino, giraffe & lion enclosure (zoo side exhibits). Whether you can see the animals really depend on your luck.

All things consider, it is a nice albeit small place. Can finish the whole place in around 2 hours. There is 1 restaurant inside the place (just outside the panda enclosure) but more choices outside at the zoo entrance. They allow re-entry, just get the hand stamp at the exit.

Tips:
- buy ticket online. You can buy combo tickets for zoo &/or night safari. Its cheaper & save on queue time.
- go early if you are planning to go on river quest so that you can get favourable timing. You can purchase the ticket & make the booking at the ticket counter at the entrance.
- dress light. Its warm out there.
- cash is king. Most places dont accept credit card. There are atms at the entrance to the zoo (not river safari).
- if you are planning to visit the zoo & river safari, I suggest to go for the river safari first early in the morning. 2 reasons: 1) book early to get favourable timing for the river quest. 2) zoo animal feeding times are in the afternoon.
- Night safari is open after the other 2 are closed so you can squeeze that in if you are strapped for time. The entrances are within walking distance of each other.
- bring own snack & drinks to save money.

Have fun!

title: River Safari Visit
content:
We visited River Safari last Sunday early morning. We were glad that most of the places are sheltered, even if it rains, we can still continue the trip. Jia Jia & Kia Kia are the main attractions, Kia Kia was sleeping but Jia Jia was moving around non-stop, it was really entertaining.

We tried the Panda Pau & Panda Cappuccino as we wanted to take the photographs. But they tasted quite good.

The fun part is taking the Amazon River ride, we enjoyed whenever the boat goes down the river and water splashed onto us. Other than that, there is not sure to see.

Overall still a fun trip with family.

title: Rivers of the World
content: For a nature lover, the animals, the environment, and the serenity of the adventure is worth the time spent.

title: Really Love The Panda..
content: Really Love The Panda.. Jia Jia and Kia Kia.. The Panda Pau and the Panda Cappuccinooo.. Other than that, the amazon river is also nice.. but the animals is less and sometime, we could not find the animal..

title: Worth a visit
content: We traveled here after seeing the zoo 4 years ago. While not as impressive as the Singapore Zoo, it has an attractiveness of its own. The safari takes you walking through several of the world's river systems, including the Mississippi, Yangtze, Murray, Nile, Congo and Ganges, and displays fish and wildlife of these rivers. The panda exhibit was popular, as were the polar bears. The Amazon River quest was SGD5 and for that its was worth it, but most of the animals were camera shy on the day we went. We also chose the SGD5Cruise which went past the zoo and the night safari, and we were able to see rhinos, giraffes, elephants.

title: Worth the visit
content: An excellent display, loved the pandas will recommend this attraction to friends. Although a wet day almost all is under cover

title: Small, but world-class attraction
content:
I am a local here but I have not been to the River Safari since its soft launch or official opening until now. The actual park feels small as compared to the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari. The layout is extremely clever though. You have an overview of the whole park upon entering. You can virtually see all the exhibits and what you'd be seeing as you transverse the clever layout.

You can start clockwise or anti-clockwise and it basically takes you on a journey to learn about all the major Rivers in the world. The multi-million investment by the Singapore Government on building this new attraction right beside the Singapore Zoo seems to pay off quite well.

The Amazon River Boat Ride, while great in concept or amusement parks, moves the boat far too quickly. The moving speed of the boat should have been slower for you to see the animals. I could also hardly see any animals when the boat was rushing through the exhibits. On top of that, when I do spot the animals and want to take a clear photograph even at 1/250, I cant because the boat is moving fast. I only remember seeing the Leopard and a few others. My partner and I could not spot the monkeys at all. The ride needs to be improved for this very fact. That being said, we are able to get so upclose and personal with the Ibis and a few other animals, literally able to touch them (of course we didnt!)

The other exhibits, while great, are not mind-blowing, like the Singapore Zoo ones are. The memorable ones are the Indian Gharial and the freshwater exhibit. The best exhibit is surely the Panda. Kai Kai and Jia Jia are truly treated as the ultimate gems of the attraction. They are treated with the most love and care. The intricate thought to detail, landscaping and all is amazing.

The perfectly air-conditioned exhibit is definitely refreshing for both the visitors and the animals inside. Honestly the pandas are much better treated and cared for than the pandas I have seen in China at Beijing Zoo/Aquarium.

It's a great complement to your whole-day trip to the 3 zoos - Singapore Zoo, River Safari and Night Safari.

title: Full of amazing in River Safari
content: There are so many kind of rare fish in River Safari,and cute panda ,Especially I like the ship trip of Amazon.It's amazing!

title: Quick Trip through River Safari
content:
We found that we had a small amount of time between the zoo closing and night safari so we decided to shoot through this place in 30mins
The amazon river quest is a must do it was an awesome ride to see some beautiful and interesting animals. however don't sit at the front of the boats (unless you want to get wet)
We used out i-venture card to see this and would highly recommend it!!
Also make sure you pack the bug spray

title: Big fuss
content: Why this is created - duplication of Aquariums - we have two in Singapore. Except for Pandas, nothing much to see. A Long walk. Vegetarian food is difficult, unless you come out and go to Singapore Zoo Entrance.

title: Brilliant!
content: Worth visiting alongside the main zoo. Set around a beautiful lake, the arrangement of the park as you walk through each river is brilliant. We were absolutely mesmerised by the pandas, could have stayed and watched them all day! There were a few too many things not included with the ticket that you had to pay extra for and couldn't see certain animals without, but honestly I would have paid the entrance fee just for the pandas!

title: Pandas !!!
content:
Actually, like most people have mentioned, it's better to combine visits to the Singapore Zoo, the River Safari and the Night Safari at the same time as it's in the same location. The location is also pretty far from the center of Singapore City.

When we went last year, the river cruise hadn't been set-up yet. However, I found the aquariums and the info on the fishes and creature were well set-up. We enjoyed seeing the pandas in their habitat and managed to see both of them.

Good place to bring the kids along.

title: Worth the visit.
content: Visited the River Safari yesterday, enjoy the site. Interesting and informative for family with children. Regrets that the exhibits range is rather small and most of time difficulty to see the exhibits. Can improve to have more exhibits and also information on the exhibits to be place on TV or monitor screen as notice that the information are place too low thus blocking other from looking at it. On the whole enjoy the visit. Thank you.

title: Interesting Park, worth a visit
content: River Safari, Singapore Zoo and Night Safari are all located at the same place. It is a good idea to visit all three parks within the same day, as the parks feature mostly different animals. We arrived at the River Safari at about 10 in the morning and managed to cover the park in about 2 hours. Most of the park is covered, and although it was drizzling, we were not much affected. Since it was raining, we skipped the boat rides. Still we enjoyed the park.

title: Much better than Singapore Zoo
content: River safari is much better and has more variety in animals than the Singapore Zoo. The boat ride is nice and the amazon ride is ok. They have a walkin queues if you have booked your ticket and its not necessary to rush if you have fixed up a time for the ride. We were miscommunicated about the same and rushed through the park for our 3pm ride, however we could do the ride beyond 3pm. Overall a good experience.

title: A different safari
content: Looks like a combination of zoo and aquarium. Can go quite close to animal is some section. Although some section is like aquarium but it do have some fishes that you will never see in normal aquarium. Not even in SEA aquarium in Sentosa. Amazon quest river ride is exciting. The animal are closer to you then that in night safari. But the journey is a bit too short.

title: Lovely walk
content: Nice walk. Don't need a full day so can combine with Zoo next door. Silly height restriction on the safari boat so my 2 year old missed out. Lack of eating places so take your own snacks. Beware the mosquitoes!

title: Pandas, spider monkeys, quick boat ride, 2 hours, done!
content: You should go to Night Safari or the Singapore Zoo rather than River Safari, if you have to choose. But if you don't, River Safari is a nicely-designed, efficient and manageable (somewhat small but not too exhausting) way to learn more about freshwater habitats around the world. Good emphasis on ecology--I didn't realize before how dams also trap pollution upstream, in addition to blocking fish migration routes. Do take the short Amazon boat-you can't see many of the Amazon exhibits and especially the monkeys otherwise. Morning or late afternoon would be better times to go, when these animals are more active. We went on a weekday when Singapore school was in session and River Safari was blissfully empty. Both pandas were snoozing in plain view. Don't miss the spider monkey enclosure. Undeterred by the early afternoon heat, the monkeys chased each other, hung upside down, took flying leaps and grabbed leaves. Great huge aquarium at the end with wonderful manatees. Note that if you buy tickets online, you need to be able to open them on your phone. No water fountains inside- bring your own water. In short-River Safari is nicely designed and laid out, and not too exhausting!

title: OK for kids.....
content: We visited this ZOO because we wanted to see the pandas, there was meant to be 2 but there was only one when we got there, and even that panda was hiding or sleeping somewhere apparently. The boat trip was closed, overall, we didn't see/got much for what it cost us to get there and get in. Again, this attraction is for kids, we should have known better...

title: Amazing
content: So many animals to see here. Panda's were my favourite and squirrel monkeys were very cute also. Boat trip was lots of fun, we did it 3 times!! Very happy animals here. Definitely worth a visit, you will not be disappointed.

title: River Safari was awesome!
content: Best part of river safari was Panda's! and second best was Amazon river quest ride.. a must take ! it mostly had aquatic animals.. you would love it more if you are fond of fishes.. But do keep in mind that you are going to cover underwater world/ sea aquarium at Sentosa too.. So plan accordingly.. I covered underwater because I did not want to miss the dolphin lagoon show.

title: (for us) the latest one at the Zoo and very informative !
content:
When we planned our Singapore trip we noted that there is a new part at the zoo - the River Safari. After the zoo, before the dinner and the Night Safari we decided to spend some time here. The latest spot reflects the various rivers of several continents and besides interesting animals one has a lot to read (and to learn) !!

We had to acknowledge that we learnt a lot during our visit.

title: Good but short
content: It's more like a ride at a theme park than a river safari, I imagined being on the river in a boat, instead it was a ride but still enjoyable.

title: Much better than the Singapore ZOO itself
content:
