After the tour, we have a different perspective of the thriving aquatic wildlife and land animals. We were amazed to learn so much about the river-dwelling habitats and their behavioural patterns. It was an interesting and educational trip and our knowledge and IQ index definitely shot up after our trip to the River Safari!

title: Tag it with the ZOO visit
content:
If you are planning to visit the ZOO, remember to visit this first and then the zoo, You shall save a lot of time and will be able to visit all the attractions.
The safari is divided into few parts and the attractions are placed so. The must visit is the Giant Panda section and Ganges RIver...

title: 2-3 hours
content: It takes about 3 hours to see the animals in this new well-maintained attraction. Good to go early so that it is less hot. Bring some water along as there are no water coolers but there are restaurants and drinks/snacks for sale around. The interesting animals are the manatees, red pandas, active squirrel monkeys and pandas (was sleeping when I was there). The place is not very big so it will not be too tiring for the children but the zoo is more interesting with the shows and more animals to see in terms of value for money.

title: Disappointing
content: Not up to the standard of the zoo or night safari, however the Pandas make up for the rather dull river experience - the parks in its infancy, I imagine it will develop as time goes on.

title: Don't miss it
content: Went on bus from DuckTours (catch outside Suntec). Queued up for boat ride which was worth the $5 but take photos quickly as it's only a short ride. Everything very enjoyable and interesting aquatic creatures from all over the world. The pandas are cute. Only downfall - not enough seating for elderly or disabled especially on a crowded, hot day. Souvenirs a bit pricey.

title: Pandas were nice!
content: The park is a nice layout with a big loop. When we were there, the water ride was not open yet. We did this as part of a pass with the Singapore Zoo and the night safari over a couple of days. I enjoyed looking at all of the aquariums, and the Pandas were situated in a perfect place as a thunder storm hit about the time we got there, so we spent extra time with them. The food was good. we ate right next to the Panda exhibit as itw was still storming and the bridge on the next part of our walk was closed due to the weather. Foor id a bit pricey, but not unusual for such an attraction. The grounds are beautifully maintained. My husband is going back during his next trip, since the River ride attraction is open now.

title: Pandas in the safari!
content: Unexpected pandas in the River Safari! No queue, no crowds and nice cute panda bun! The cruise ride is a little too fast and $5 is quite expensive for the ride.

title: Fun date
content: We went during a weekday and it was not crowded. We got onto the 11am River quest boat ride, which was about 10 minutes. It was fun and we could see all the animals however a slower ride would give us more time to take pictures. There are outdoor and indoor areas so it wouldn't be too hot. There are many exhibits as well of how man activities have destroyed many of their homes and the environmental implications which is very educational. It was a bit short but I loved the experience there.

title: home of the panda
content:
The main attraction for river Safari are the pair of panda which Singapore has received from China, Kai Kai and Jia jia. In addition to the panda enclosure, the park offered knowledge on major rivers around the world and what species can be found.

The information is interesting and enriching. It provides a different view to the Zoo that focuses more on land Animals. The park is not huge thou and so can be completed in a morning, or just slightly after lunch if you start early.

title: River of Life
content: River Safari is not established like the Singapore Zoo or the Night Safari but it still boast an impressive collection of wildlife there. You can get up close to the river creatures like the humongous Mekong catfish and the gigantic Arapaima. The main attraction is of course the 2 pandas, although one is always sleeping while the shy one is always hiding in the den, hence leaving the mischievous Red Panda to mostly entertain the visitors.

title: Day out with family ...great bonding with family
content:
We went to River Safari on Vesak day yesterday. .it was very crowded and bought the tickets at Membership Service Counter-saved us time as we are also members of the theme park :)..
it is worth to join as members, make 2-3 trips and is worthwhile, ,rather to pay full price tickets plus your family must love the marine creatures-sharks, manatees, ,otters, crocodiles, fresh water&salt water fishes etc..totally abit different from zoo..

the staffs were great and helpful..
it is a great day morning trip out with my 2 teens n my youngest 8 year old gal ..
We had panda faces Paos in the family restaurant, just outsude the panda exhibits..adorable food..
took short walk to have Ben&Jerry's ice cream at the zoo's entrance. .have 10% discount. Great deal..
oops forget to mention. .free parking for members too ..
great great deal to join as members. .nvr regret!!

title: Not much in there
content: Well very small and not much there to see any way. The boat ride which cost extra was just artificially ridiculous, not worth the extra money.

title: Nothing Special
content: Was excited to go there with my toddler in tow. Was hoping to see the panda but I only saw one that was sleeping. Halfway through it rained but the walkway was covered so it was fine. Although I would recommend going here compared to the aquarium. It would only take est 2-3hrs to go one round.

title: Not Quite Up to Singapore Standards
content:
In the category of animal attractions, the latest River Safari does not quite compare to the Singapore Zoo or Night Safari, especially since the price is similar.

Personally, I felt the S.E.A. Aquarium at Resorts World Sentosa is more interesting for marine/fish seeing, but of course the River Safari mainly boasts fresh water species and is different from marine species.

There isn't a lot to see at the River Safari, and its saving grace are the 2 pandas (although almost always sleeping haha), and also the huge manatees which were impressive to see.

The 'Amazon River Quest' boat ride was disappointing to say the least. Most of the animals were hiding in their shelters, and the ride was so short, by the time you reach the end everyone felt 'That's it?'.

Considering that it is located just next to the Singapore Zoo, so if you only have time to cover one attraction, I would strongly advise that you pick the Zoo, which definitely provides more value for money.

title: Good day out
content: A great day out although the title of it is slightly misleading - You walk 95% of it, only a 10min short boat journey at the end gets you physically in/on the water - And that costs $5 extra. It's worth taking the Zoo pass whilst you're there (Same place). All in all though its very good & quite educational. Would visit again.

title: We loved this gentle attraction
content:
We visited this with our children, and got tickets for the Forest Ride too. Some attractions (the polar bear in particular) are also part of the zoo - but you see the polar bear swimming at the river safari. The pandas were fantastic. We liked the way this attraction is arranged in "locations". It was not a huge place, but that is what we liked about it. A manageable size, with good, clear information and unique animals, well arranged.

BUT NOTE - we got tickets for the River Safari starting at 2.30pm. We got there at 2.15pm. We sat in the waiting area. What we did not know was that because not all tickets for the 2pm session had been sold we could have just got on when we arrived at that part of the attraction rather than waiting until 2.30. So note if you get there earlier, you may be able to get on quicker if the boats are not full.

We really enjoyed this.

title: Worth a visit
content:
I had a good time at the River Safari though it felt less like a zoo and more like a well-curated animal museum. There aren't many animals but worthwhile displays include the adorable red pandas, pandas and squirrel monkeys. The manatee enclosure is just magical and there are 2 amazingly active otters which provide a great deal of entertainment and photo-ops.

The "boat ride" is actually more like an amusement park ride than the leisurely trip down the river I had imagined. There are several animals which you can only see along the boat ride including an elusive jaguar so it is worth a try. If you want pictures though, be prepared and be quick as the ride does not slow down.

The park is sheltered almost all the way throughout and a couple of the enclosures are air-conditioned if you are looking to escape the heat. There are food and beverage options available but I would recommend you consider bringing your own as it can be overpriced.

Personally, I find the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari have an edge over the River Safari. If you are planning a visit, it is worth visiting at least one of the other 2 attractions at the same time for a complete experience.

title: River Safari
content:
River Safari is a part of SG Zoo, designed to show species in different rivers. My favourite is African Arowana which is my first time watching the real fish. Other faunas such as giant catfish, freshwater stingray, salamander, panda, etc. are also shown.

The Amazon Forest Ride is ok, not really so excite like in theme park. You could see animals from Amazon forest in short period as the boat keeps moving. Therefore, close your preview function, lock and keep shooting. The habitat is so dense, so you could have only a fews 10s to find them and take a shot. Additional 5 SGD is charged and you have to book the schedule at ticket office. Anyway, we really love the Manatee tank in Flood Forest. They are truely cute.

TIps
- Better get the ticket from kiosk at the airport or on Orchard road to avoid long queue and get special discount. Make sure you get all tickets, as some staffs may blur and haven't given you every purchased ticket.
- Some tanks are not really in or outdoor and you may have reflection on the acrylic. Make sure you have rubber hood for your camera lens and tripod. Really difficult to take good photos.
- Avoid visiting during the weekend, as you will meet a lot of people. The bus from AMK Interchange takes about half an hour to the zoo. It may take longer during rush hour.
- Switch off preview mode in Amazon Ride, you have about 10-15s to find the mammal and take picture. I recommend to sit in the back so you have other people help you to find them.
You may not see all animals as they may hide during the day.

title: Go early!
content:
As the River Safari and the Singapore Zoo are just next to one another, we decided to go there on the same day. We bought the tickets via their website and got a discount and were also aware that we needed to buy tickets for the boat ride at the River Safari counter.

1 May is a public holiday in Singapore. We planned to take the 9:30am shuttle at the Safari Gate as recommended by the website when we bought the tickets. It costed $7 for a single trip. Unfortunately, it took us more than half an hour to go from Mandarin Oriental to the Suntec stop as there were constructions around, the map downloaded from the map did not show the location clearly, no signage in all the buildings inside Suntec, and even various people were being asked, nobody could show us the exact direction. We arrived sharp at 9:30am, but there was one customer at the counter...we missed the shuttle. We took the 10:30am shuttle and arrived slightly after 11am. There was a long queue at the counter for admission tickets including the boat ride. We asked the staff, one told us to queue and after some more than 15 minutes of queuing, another told us we could queue at another side for ticket-holders for buying the boat ride tickets. There was only one counter for ticket-holders, another one for members. We finally got the tickets for the ride at 4pm at 12 noon.

Then we need to queue for lunch and run between the River Safari and Zoo as both would close at 6pm. Both places are worthwhile visiting, but you would need more than one day if you go on a public holiday.

As mentioned in the other reviews, you can finish the River Safari in two hours, not counting the waiting time for boat ride.

We found there was a free shuttle back to the MRT when we left. The departure frequency is much better than shuttles.

title: Great and could improve
content:
My wife and I visited this during the month of April. We booked it through a 4 in 1 ticket pass. The place could be accessed with busses going straight to the site which made it hazels free to get to the location. It's great to see the large variety of fish divided respective to their country. Gift shop was a little expensive.
The boat ride idea was great, HOWEVER their was not much to see and was a bit of waste of time and money.

title: Tuesday morning visit - great experience
content:
2 adults and 5 year old had a great time. Highlights were the giant pandas and the squirrel monkey enclosure. We arrived at 8.50am and were near first purchasers of the 10am boat ride ticket. Had a really smooth ticket buying (had purchased 3-in-1 pass online)/entry experience. All the staff smiling and helpful. We only saw about 3 other people in the first hour we were there (there were lots of schoolkids on the boat ride, though), and got to spend as much time as we wanted (about 20 mins) in the giant panda enclosure, with only one other family in there at the same time - an amazing experience. The boat ride was OK, but quite a let down after the giant pandas. The squirrel monkey enclosure is great - it is off to the side after the boat ride and we almost missed it. The monkeys were very used to people and were running and climbing along the path and were great to observe in their element.

Many of the animals in the rest of the park we had seen before, but still good value for money (particularly when combined with Night Safari/Jurong Bird Park etc, which are available on the river safari website).

You are undercover most of the time in the park and there is probably no need to wear insect repellant (a hat is useful on the boat ride). Even though we dawdled it only took 2.5 hours to get around everything.

Taxi to and from central Singapore (Queen Street, near Bras Basah station) was SGD28 (during peak hour) and SGD19 (around lunch time) and took about 25 mins each way, so a convenient option if you're pressed for time (had zero wait time for taxi from River Safari, as they were queued outside the venue).

title: River Safari - liimited animals but overall alrght
content:
The place felt like a giant aquarium or underwater world than a zoo, albeit it being a river safari.

There were lots of enclosed glass areas where one could view the sea creatures in thier natural habitat - we managed to see many different species of fish and really huge manatees, and otters, stingray etc. It was rather interesting, and the kids enjoyed themselves.

As for the boat ride, it was full so we did not get to ride in it - I had wanted to cruise along the river because there were quite a few animals I'd missed out on seeing - those that could only be viewed by those on the boat. I hope they would increase the frequency and number ot boat rides overall.

There were some birds here and there, but the exhibits were rather limited .

The red panda and normal (Black and white) pandas were the highlights. They were absolutely adorable, even though the red panda refused to look at us at all. It perched on the tree branch but faced the other side so we could not take photographs of its cute little white face.

For the giant panda (Kai Kai) he was happily sleeping but he looked so lovable, especially when he kept shaking his upturned feet.

For more detailed information and photos, do visit:
http://thearcticstar.blogspot.sg/2014/05/river-safari-visit.html

title: amazing also for adults
Fun & educational - perfect for kids
content: We did enjoy our visit to River Safari... our favorite were the cute pandas! We liked the manatees and giant fishes from the Mekong River, too. The boat ride was a tad bit short; around 10 minutes, and unfortunately we didn't get to see some of the animals during the ride (some were either hidden or asleep). While you can roam the entire park in 3-4 hours, it's still advisable to go there early if you wish to avoid long lines for the boat ride (the rides are also limited, it could be fully booked for the day if you're not early).

title: My son loves it...
content:
We have an annual membership and we go every fortnight. My 5 year old son enjoys it very much!

The boat ride is short but fun. With the aanual membership, it's complimentary. One setback is there's limited food in this park. You need to walkover to the zoo for more variety of local food and desserts.

title: Pandas great. Rest educational.
content: Spent a few hours on an afternoon which was a good time to go. Little crowds. Information for each river area very interesting and informative. Boat ride okay as we saw most animals. Highlights were red pandas, giant pandas and manatees.

title: felt like cheated
content:
We have visited the River Safari on 1st may, 2014. I have read other reviews and was expecting a fun day out.I have to say that I was disappointed. The name River safari is misnomer. more than 50 % of public cant enjoy boad ride. How can you call it River Safari. The first thing which dampen our mood, was boat ride. it was full for the day, so you can not see 15% of park as they publicize in their brochure. Second thing after being so many wonderful places in Singapore, River safari seems a waste of time. It seems that they wanted to en cash the success of night safari (which by the way is 100 times better than River safari) without giving any thought and to my disappointment, It was crowded and people are spending their hard earned money on this rubbish.
There were different river sections. such as Mississippi river, Congo river, Ganges, Mekong and Amazon. All these section are having fishes and another animal according to their habitat. Maybe we are not enthusiastic or we like sea aquarium more. We agree that this is meant for River animals but it was not at all attractive.

title: Fun and Enjoyable for Kids
content: River Safari is a newly open zoo park and the admission fees are not expensive. You can see different type of fishes, especially the 2 Lovely Pandas which came from China. Kids enoy the boat rides and is fun. Worth visiting..

title: Not worth the trip
content:
The river safari comprises of a walkway through a series of aquariums, a panda enclosure, then the "riverboat ride", then a walk through a monkey enclosure and more aquariums, culminating in a final large aquarium with large manatees and a few other fish species. The riverboat ride tickets must be purchased on site at the attraction, and the queue to do this - on a busy day - was 40 minutes. With four of us at $5 each, that was 40 minutes and $20, all for an approximately 8 - 9 minute "ride" through a channel which is bounded by some small animal enclosures. About one third of the animals could not be seen as we went past; the water in the channel flows relatively quickly too, so you do not get to see much of the animals anyway.

Food options inside the attraction are limited to just one Asian venue, where the food was expensive, oily and not at all enjoyable; in addition, the wait time for service was over half an hour (again, on a standard busy day) and there weren't enough tables.

For a family of four, this was a SGD$120 day out (excluding food and transport) just to see a few acquariums, and a few animals, and really not worth the cost or time. The zoo and night safari - both next door - are much better world class attractions and highly recommended.

title: educational
content: brought my gals here few days ago, i am quite amazed with the park establishment. we bought combo tix (zoo and river safari) so the best way is to come here in the morning and finish the rest of the day at the zoo. Its great that we came on a weekday hence no queue. the pathways are mostly shaded so even though it was drizzling a little when we we there , it didnt bother us at all. and they are also 100% stroller friendly so its definitely a plus for me who came alone with two kids! my children really love the aquarium with the manatees and enjoyed seeing the pandas. i went there by taxi we didnt have any trouble to hire one on our way back. i wish the park is bigger though, we covered all the rivers in 2 hours (minus the boat ride) . a great place to visit with kids!

title: Just rock up
content:
We nearly didn't go, we wanted to book the boat section, but online booking kept saying full, no go.
We asked at our hotel & they believed the boat was not running.
Nicole wanted to see the Panda's so we turned up at the Zoo to do the River Safari section anyway.
Lo and behold at the ticket desk there were 140 slots for the 3.00pm run @ more for the 3.30pm.
We got to the landing at 2.45 and we're told we could join the 2.30 tour!
I get the feeling that it just doesn't run to schedule,so they say you can't book online.
It was great & even if for some reason you can't do the boat (which is only around 10 minutes) it is well worth doing.
Also did the Night Safari another day, brilliant, walk it first, then do the tram ride.

title: Fun day out
content:
The river safari was a very well laid out and wheelchair friendly attraction. We spent around 3 to 4 hours there on a weekend. Would recommend going early in the morning as the place got more crowded in the afternoon.

Entrance tickets are $25 for adults but there is a 5% off if you buy online using certain debit/credit cards. We also purchased the boat cruise ticket ($5) on the actual day and booked our slot for the boat ride. There are 2 areas to purchase tickets, one near the zoo and the other at the entrance of the safari. I would recommend going directly to the entrance of the river safari as the queue was shorter. Although we booked the 11am slot, we could actually board the ride up to an hour early as the staff were quite flexible.

Highlights of the visit would include the red panda, pandas and manatees. The cheetah could only be seen during the boat ride. We were disappointed with the boat ride as we found it too quick and some of the animals could not be seen (guess it depends on your luck).

title: Panda Panda Panda :-)
content:
we visited the park when it was not fully operational .. in fact the river cruise was not up and running and our viewing was restricted...

however we enjoyed the day out and this was more due to the detailed explanation which was provided :-) ... the place is broken by rivers and we were exposed to things which we did not know and sighting the animals, reptiles with this knowledge made it a good experience

the Red & White Panda are a star attraction and when you see them you understand why :-) :-) ...

My reco's for the place are

1. Come early in the day to avoid queue .. the place is quite outside the city and so you will have to plan your travel accordingly .. Taxi queues at the time of exit are very heavy and so if possible plan a pick up thru the Taxi call center
2. Pick the Map and spend time reading thru them .. this is a large place and this exercise will help you optimize your walking
3. Vegetarians need to plan their meal in advance and mostly bring it along :-) :-)
4. Memorabilia is expensive and can be skipped

title: Much More than Just a Boat Trip
content: The safari was much more than just a boat trip which was also fun for children and adults alike. You get to see a lot of different birds, animals, and fish (in an aquarium). I liked it much more than the Zoo which was nearby.

title: Enjoyed the different focus of this zoo - and loved seeing the Pandas.
content: This is really an aquatic zoo divided up by River systems and it is an interesting format. Some of the regions don't have much detail to them, but others have a lot of different displays. There are boards with interesting facts and there is a strong environmental protection focus. Highlights were the manatees and of course the pandas! We did the river ride, and my son was disappointed that he DIDN"T get wet in the front seat splash zone!

title: Great afternoon out
content: I'd read about the River Safari before leaving and put it on the 'must do' list. Be aware that there is an extra cost S$5 per person to do the boat cruise but it's worth it. We had ample time to have a look around and read all about the different 'river systems' they display. Panda's at the end are great! The Panda enclosure is state of the art.

title: Only just opened and already looking tired
content:
My family and I have been to Singapore Zoo many, many times over the last few years as our children are young and love the place. We have always enjoyed it hugely and been members for a number of years. Unfortunately, the decision was made to expand the park with the River Safari - not a great decision! Although the attraction was only just recently opened fully, it's already looking a little tired and as for the pandas... well, suffices to say that I found them looking quite distressed with the huge number of LOUD people passing through the enclosure.

Today we had a particularly bad experience at the park: Bought tickets to go on the river ride and found that children have to be 1.06 metres tall to go on the ride. Our son was measured when we bought the tickets as he is exactly that height. No problem - or so we thought. As we turned up at the actual ride (with a long queue), we were stopped by the unbelievably incompetent robotic staff members and told that our son was too short and therefore couldn't go. At the same time, a family with a girl of exactly the same size turned up and were told the same. They had also bought tickets beforehand and had experienced no problems with this. Seems the measuring signs at the ticket counter and at the actual attraction differ in height...

We were offered a refund which was all well and good, except this could only be done at the ticket counter which is at the other end of the park and they did not offer any kind of assistance! What appalling customer service. Anyhow, we decided to leave (our one of our children had bawled his eyes out for long enough), but as we had turned our backs, and walked off... the other (local) family was miraculously let through. So either their dughter grew very quickly, or we were basically being discriminated against. When we went back and confronted them with this, we were let through too. Shameful behaviour.

The staff handling customers and queues at the boats are shockingly incompetent and were falling over each other trying to direct people and the ride itself is hugely disappointing (some enclosures were empty as well).

There is no decent food to be had in the park so bring your own or eat elsewhere.

Will certainly not go back and would not recommend to anyone.

title: Good and will get better
content:
At the time of my trip this attraction was still having its finishing touches put on. But in essence it is quite lovely. Based on the idea of showcasing the ecosystems of rivers this is a fun idea and allows the place to show a range of animals not always found in standard zoos. The way it is laid out makes sure you see basically everything without doubling back and you can saunter along at your own pace reading all the information and there are easily enough amenities available. Food options are OK too and of course the gift shop will help you lighten your financial burdens.

Being Singapore it is all spotlessly clean and well organised and the staff were very friendly and chirpy. The walkway is suitable for less mobile people and the setting is nice as well.

Oh - and the Pandas are here. What more could you want?

Just have your transport options sorted before going as just like the Night Safari and Singapore Zoo proper it is not just around the corner from the CBD and hotel districts.

title: Good collection ,,,...
content: Well maintained. I specially liked the Polar bear put inside a very big Pool. And they have new attraction......Panda .

title: Whole family enjoyed
content: Visited with 76yr old mother and her grandchildren 11 and 14. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed. Great setting and majority is in the shade so it is a comfortable experience. The river Safari part is more of an adventure Park type ride than a boat ride but fun nonetheless.

title: Great morning out
content:
This was our first trip to the River Safari with 2 young children...and we loved it! Firstly, it is not as large as the regular zoo (which is good for the legs) but also it's nearly all undercover which means that you are mostly sheltered from the sun or rain making it an all-weather option. For a rainy day in Singapore, this would be my choice of destination.
The river boat wasn't too exciting for adults but my kids absolutely loved it...so I am giving it a big thumbs up.
The squirrel monkey enclosure is a must do stop as they come right up to people giving you the chance for great photos.
Food options were limited but fine enough considering you didn't need to be there for hours and hours.

title: Excellent
content:
The presentation of the main rivers of the world with their associated species (not just fish but many mammals as well, and birds, reptiles etc) and info on the rivers is a much better (and more educational) way of presenting things than the usual haphazard scattering of enclosures in most zoos. We really enjoyed it and found it quite thought provoking.

We didn't do the boat trip so can't comment on that. The full walk round took about 2 hours.

We went to the zoo as well, this is more of an interesting/different experience, so if just choosing one I'd go for the River safari.

title: Squirrel Monkeys are the highlight
content:
River Safari is a great aquarium - unique concept too with the set up of different river systems from around the world. It's a much better aquarium to visit than Underwater World, unless of course you desperately need to see dolphins.

We visited the River Safari after spending most of the day at the zoo. Visiting as a tail-end of an overall zoo experience is plenty - it only took about an hour and a half to get around the whole thing, including visiting the squirrel monkey exhibit twice.

The squirrel monkey aviary is by far the highlight of this attraction! The cute little guys follow you around and become particularly inquisitive if you have a bag - there might be food inside!

title: Nice day out
content:
I really enjoyed the Singapore River Safari. It's a different way of presenting and experiencing a zoo/ aquarium. The walk through the rivers of the world was good. Highlights including seeing manatees and pandas. I concur with other travellers that the river boat ride experience goes far too fast and it's difficult to spot and enjoy the animals along the way. I would recommend doing it as part of the experience.

Tips
- go early to avoid the major crowds
- I couldn't find any drink fountains so take bottled water

title: Relaxing and educational attraction.
content: Unlike the hectic (although nice) zoo, the river safari is a bit slower in pace and educational as you go through exhibits of all the major rivers of the world. Don't worry if it is raining. Most areas are sheltered. Best exhibit is the Panda exhibit.

title: Very poor by Singapore standards
content:
We had high expectations of the recently added Singapore attraction, the River Safari. On paper the concept sounded very interesting. However in reality it was very poorly executed. The only saving grace was the feeding of the Manatees and the Panda display. The information about environmental concerns was appreciated but the main attraction, the amazon river experience was terrible with little or nothing on display as you travelled in a conveyor-belt "boat" along a narrow con crete channel only to finish sitting in the sun as you were rammed by the boat behind!
The Pandas would have best been placed in the excellent Singapore Zoo together with the Manatees and the River Safari rip-off closed down. We have been to Singapore 7-8 times and this attraction is by far the worst we have experienced.

title: A good day out but misleading name
content: My family of 5 aged between 90 and 19 had a lovely morning at the river safari this week (mid April 2014). There is a lot of walking but they provided good wheel chairs to push the old folk around. It's really an aquarium divided into various rivers of the world. The exhibits are interesting and well laid out with informative signs. The boat ride is a mild type of theme park ride lasted about 10 minutes which goes through various enclosures (rather too fast to see things clearly) but we were lucky enough to see a jaguar swimming. The pandas were great and in a well laid out enclosure. The flooded forest was very impressive. There were no queues while we were there. My advice - go early. For those confused by the title of the park - it's a walk through aquarium, themed by rivers of the world with an optional (at small extra cost) short boat trip in a boat on a mechanically steered fake river. It's fun though.

title: Well laid out and great displays
content: We took a tour bus and had just over 2 hours to look through the exhibits. The 7 longest rivers are represented with various fish and animals from the regions. The big draw cards are the Giant Panda who have an amazing life inside their climate controlled enclosures. Jia Jia and Kai Kai can been seen clearly. The boat ride wasn't operating on the day we went due to bad weather but the rest of the park is pretty much undercover and easily accessible for all.

title: Beautiful Zoo in lush tropical garden
content: Our first intention was to see the Giant Pandas and from the map given to us, we thought we would have covered this zoo in 2 hours and we ended up spending the entire afternoon here. The zoo is comprehensively laid out with different sections representing different regions such as the granges, the Amazon, the Mekong. The displays were beautiful done if not very impressive. The manatee display / sunken forest was a huge underwater gallery where you get to see not just these giant mammals but also assortment of giant amazon fishes. The jewel in the crown is definitely the panda enclosure done like a forest where you get to see the delightful pandas chewing bamboo. There are actually 2 enclosures for the male and female pandas. The female was not in the enclosure when we were there but the male panda was and he was certainly amusing to look at. The boat ride is also recommended. We did not buy a ticket at the main entrance but at the entrance to the boat ride itself. Its a lovely 10 mins ride along a 'river' where you get to see monkeys. flamingos and even the jaguar ! We really enjoyed this visit to the River safari. Its like a walk in a lush tropical forest . River safari maintains the same high standard and beauty like the main zoo. If you love zoos, a good recommendation to to spend the morning here at the River Safari and after lunch to go to the main zoo. Amazing zoo ! Highly recommended !

title: Nice afternoon out for kids
content: My 5 year old nephew had fun but it really wasn't much for the money we spent. The boat ride was just 6 minutes, not the 10 advertised and the boat went too quickly for us to take decent pictures. Overall the concept is very good but still needs more work. Video screens were out of order, not enough information on the exhibits, the glass tanks were scratched badly in some area making picture taking that much more difficult. I loved the red pandas but am still wondering why the pandas were there in the first place.

title: nice place and close to the zoo and night safari
content: Great for lovers of animals. Easy to walk around. Pandas and manatees r cool to c. Can't wait to visit

title: Nice place!
content: It's really nice to go there once a while to see our famous panda, kaikai and jiajia. And great place to explore other animals as well, must visit!

title: River Quest at Singapore Zoo
content: We knew we had tours of Singapore later, so this day wanted to stroll and relax. The zoo is quite a way out, but taxis are not that expensive. The River Quest deals with all the rivers of the world, and we found it entertaining and interesting. Its a pity they don't give you a time-table when you go in of whats going on where because we missed the polar bear feeding time. The only slight disappointment was the boat ride at the end, which was a bit like a poor Disney ride, but it did not spoil the trip and I would recommend this part of the Zoo at least.

title: Overpriced, too short trip
content: We spent 120 SGD for combo 4 ticket of river safari and 4 ticket of amazon river quest. After all, the trip is ridiculous, very few animals which can be seen, it is totally not worth at price 25SGD per pax.

title: Nice to see the panda's, boat ride is totally useless
content:
We heard and read a lot about this 'star attraction' and it was really nice to see the panda's. Earrly on a Friday morning, no queue at all, relaxed atmosphere. The river themes differ a lot in attractivity. Some are just dull and liveless, others are interesting (active crocs!).
The big disappointment however came with the boat ride. This is an absolute waste of time and money. It is a less than 10 min. ride and there is nothing to see. No jaguars,no capybara's, no howler monkey, nothing except for the signs that mention that the animals should be there. So, enjoy the panda's and forget the boat ride.

title: River safari is fun educational
content: Went there with my daughter march 27th, since it was our first experience. The entrance was next to the singapore zoo entrance. The down part was one of the panda was on medical assistant. The route was very clear and decor was thrilling. Totally different than the zoo and amazing new experience. Tried the boat ride, a must thing to do here. Total time spend for one route around one and half hour, so still enough time for lunch and visiting the zoo next door. And later for night safari. It is really on stop place for animal fun recreation and education.

title: overpriced
content: I went there only to see the pandas. Most of the attractions there are just average and not in any ways fascinating enough to be worth the money I paid.

title: Good but a long way to walk and only a short ride
content:
I noticed that the River Safari was extensively advertised in Singapore including on the MRT trains and stations. I had been looking forward to the boat trip part and I left the zoo early that day. When I entered there was a ridiculously long way to walk through the complex to the boat and the boat trip itself was enjoyable but rather short.

I never knew that Ibises could be a scarlet colour before. There were some other good parts of the safari such as the fish that produce caviar and the pandas. It would be good if the boat ride could include some of the other river displays (which I had expected) and/or if there was an alternative to walking all the way especially for older people.

The Zoo and the River Safari are a fair way out from the city by public transport so it may be difficult for those who are in Singapore for a short visit. It's a shame that the MRT doesn't go closer.

The River Safari is a good idea but needs some improvement and should perhaps be integrated into the adjacent zoo.

title: Small, but novel
content: It gas well defined sections based on major rivers on earth and its fishes, reptiles and mammals. Can be done in 2.5 hours if you skip amazon boat ride. Good concept. The Pandas are out of place in river Safari, but a good attraction. There are little informative entertaining shows which was a little downer but then one can not make crocodiles jump through hoops. Still something could have been there to add a show flavour. Best to combine with night Safari.

title: Overpriced, small, and disappointing
content: Singapore is expensive, I get that, but to spend nearly $100 SD for a family of 4 to go here is rediculous! We went through the entire thing in an hour, and that was with going SLOWLY as we were trying to make our visit last until our scheduled river ride. We couldn't drag our feet any longer and finished up the entire park, went out into the common area for lunch (which is a whole other disappointing story), then returned 45 minutes later for our boat ride. The boat ride was sad. It was over in 5-10 minutes and the only animals we saw were a few birds, and a sleeping leopard in the distance. My 6 and 8 year old asked "it's over?!" when we got done. We all felt ripped off. The panda section - loved the red panda- is nice and I liked that there were so many different languages on the exhibits. Save yourself some money and just enjoy the zoo next door. It's amazing and much more worth the dollars spent. The safari seems like a side attraction of a zoo rather than an entire different park. You can tell they are squeezing every dollar out of tourists by having them separated.

title: not completely ready .........
content:
not completely ready .........
since we have been at the zoo many times we went to the river safari also we were told that the boat-ride was not available. it was rather disappointing .....

wait until ready and then combine with a visit to the zoo.

title: Not really worth the effort
content: Average at best. Lots of fish tanks. Nice setting but not worth getting all the way there and too expensive for what it is. The place is organized along 5 rivers. Most of the exhibits are not too interesting and the odd ones have too few animals. Apart from a lot of fish you get to see sea lions, a few crocodiles, one sleeping panda, two cute red pandas and a large polar bear. Buy your tickets online to skip the very long queues in the weekend or better, go during a weekday, don't waste your money on the river thing, it's too short and you see pretty much anything. Overall if you go to the zoo you can dispense with this.

title: Singapore River Safari
content:
I found that the river safari was not that what I expected. Only the Amazon boat ride was nice. For that we had to buy tickets paying another S$5.00. But we could not see most of the animals at the time we had the ride. S$ 25.00 is too high for this river safari. Not worth for it.

There we went on our own using public transport which is cheap in Singapore. So I would like to advise all visitors to these attractions using public transport and travel there on your own is very much cheaper than using tour agents because if we go on our own we can go there early and also save our hard earned money.

title: Loved the Pandas...they should be part of the Zoo not the River Safari!
content: We only went to see the Pandas and they didn't disappoint and having them in a large air conditioned setting was a bonus. I'd give them 5 out of 5! The 2 pandas are in separate enclosures and were sooo cute, we found the one as u enter more entertaining. We were lucky he/she not sure, was so close to us and wide awake, either lazing back eating bamboo or moving around a lot. The river boat wasnt very good, luckily there was no line at all and we got on imediately b4 time. If i had to wait a long time I would have been let down, so if it's busy...don't bother. The large tank near the end was interesting. Wish there were other ways to get back to the Pandas, but it was just not worth the long walk to get there n back. We finished in probably 2 hours and continued on to the zoo. Shame these 2 are not combined, or would have been better for the Pandas to be part of the zoo not the River Safari.

title: Been there, done that and bought the T-shirt
content: Have to hand it to Wildlife Reserves of Singapore (WRS) for another amazing attraction. Getting up close and personal with the animals was a great experience. Only disappointment was the river adventure..was hoping something a lot more "natural" but felt more like an amusement park ride instead.

title: Great marketing!
content: This is just an add on of the zoo. Not really worth to pay a TEN minutes boat ride if you been to the zoo or the night safari.

title: Interesting
content:
This was a very interesting place, combining a very diverse range of freshwater fish from different parts of the world.

Unfortunately when I was there, not the entire park was open, they were still finishing up some parts. Therefore I could only imagine that more fish was added later. Overall has lots of potential and I would still recommend the visit.

title: awesome reptiles n fishes
content:
My whole family visited river safari just few days ago.We joined river safari membership in order to make uteem trips and cut off the Q...awesome trip...
my kids just love mantees and otters..very interesting...
plus some marine n reptiles from amazon river, mekong river and other rivers..
The boat ride was v good ..slow and can take lots of pictures. ..

title: Awesome day
content: Great day at river safari. The theming is great, the exhibits are plenty, and best of all it's mostly sheltered. We recommend starting the tour from the left side once you pass the turnstiles. This will bring you to the smaller aquariums first, then the pandas which are one of the highlights (strangely), followed by the ten minutes boat ride then finally to the BIG aquarium. This way you get to do the real highlight of the river safari (big aquarium) last, which gives a very good conclusion and climatic ending to the trip. To get the boat ride, you have to be at the purchase counter real early, something like 830am should be a good gauge. The ride is disappointing as it shows you land animals and is really short ride. Lunch is expensive at the restaurant near the boat ride, which is at the far end of the water safari.

title: Not as great as the Singapore Zoo.
content:
We are great fans of the Singapore zoo and take our 4yr old boys to the zoo at least once a month. So this year, when we were renewing our zoo pass, we also decided to take the River Safari Pass for a year even though we had never been to it.

Which was a big mistake as our first experience was pretty disappointing. It is probably okay for a one time visit but it is definitely not a place you will come back to again and again, unlike the Singapore zoo.

The queue for the boat ride is just too long. We stood in the queue at 11 and were told our turn would come only around 2.30. So unless you intend to spend the whole day at the zoo, it is best to avoid the boat ride. We decided to not take the boat ride and just walked around.

We went on Friday morning to avoid the weekend crowds and it was still really crowded. One of the reasons for this is the initial part of the route is designed such that it becomes very congested with small aquariums around. But as you go inside it opens up into larger spaces and is no longer congested or crowded.

Also it is mainly an aquarium - there are very few animals around - a few beavers, otters, the pandas and monkeys. The River Safari mainly exhibits fresh water fish and even though some of the fish are really interesting, if you have small children and have taken them to Sea Life Aquarium, then they don't find this as exciting when compared to the sharks, dolphins etc..

Having said that, the panda exhibits are quite nice and so is the walk through the squirrel monkey area. My kids really loved that and also the giant tank with the manatees. I wish some of this came first instead of being at the very end of the route.

On the whole, I'd say do not expect this to be like the zoo where you can take your kids every month and not be bored as there is so much to do - from water play area to shows to different animals to see. This in my opinion is good for a one time visit; and even with the yearly pass, I don't think we will be going back to this any time soon.

title: Never never go again
content: The queue to buy boat ride is long and absolutely not worth it. The boat ride is nothing more than a 10 min resting time. Just a few animal and birds along the way and does not live up to the hype and time spent to get the ticket. Food quality is bad and expensive. The route design is one way and that added more frustration to visitor who need to go back to the boat ride after completing the park tour. See more concrete and glass than "feel the wild" as overwhelmingly claimed in poster and web. River Safari is overselling what it is delivering.

title: Love the pandas! Good exhibits
content: Had a great morning at River Safari. Unfortunately I was there on the one day where the boat was closed due to maintenance but you can still see 85% of the displays. I had a great morning. The displays are great and very informative. And of course the Pandas are just beautiful.

title: It can be Great
content:
Curious about Amazon River Quest boat ride, I decided to took my mom to visit River Safari. I thought it will be more relax coz of the boat ride. Well, my thought was wrong.

River Safari is next to Singapore Zoo & Night Safari. Its not to difficult to reach. You can used MRT to Ang Mo Kio and continued with bus 138. Or choose direct bus which is SAEx Bus. Luckily, I stay at Beach Road so I can wait the bus at Shaw Tower at 9.08. Only cost SGD5, the bus directly took us to River Safari.

Booked the ticket from Anaya Tour (4 dolar cheaper then the counter/ticket), we have to walk to the front gate. Again, the ticket include a boat ride so I don't need to buy boat tickets.

Unfortunately, we have to walk through the complex before entering the Amazon River boat ride. My mom aint complain about it, cause all the different freshwater fish. The good things are the complex are also and clean, though in some area we can smell bad urine.

The boat ride at Amazing River only took 10 minutes. My schedule are 11.30, but until 12.00 we are still cant get into the boat. They said they have a technical issue and the women in the ticket line gave us a voucher worth SGD5 as compliment. Luckily I makesure again to the front gate, which they told to customer to comeback at 13.00.

The man help us out to check either we can comeback to queue the boat ride and returned the compliment voucher. Another lucky was, instantly the techical problem was solved and they ask us to come into the boat. How lucky we are, even it only 10 minutes ride.

Overall, River Safari is worthed to visit especially if you love freshwater fish from around the world. There are also two big panda, who fell asleep when we visit and cute red panda with big and long tail. If you are hungry after touring, no worry there are food corner outside near Singapore Zoo Gate, but its quite crowded by lunch time. In fact I finished River Safari Journey less than 3 hours.

Personally, I definitely comeback to enjoy more time at Amazon Flooded Forest, which it claim as a world largest freshwater aquarium.

title: Avoid the boat trip
content: The zoo is quite interesting as it has an aquatic theme which complements the neighboring zoo. Don't bother with the amazon boat ride. The queue is long despite bookings, hot and crowded, it took us over an hour past our booking time to get on a boat, terrible if you are with children. The actual ride lasts about 15 minutes and is underwhelming with regard to the wildlife you can see. The rest of the zoo is quite interesting and could be done as an add-on to the neighboring Singapore zoo.

title: Small and underwhelming
content: Yeah yeah there are Panda but that's about it. Singapore zoo is full of activities and have a large variety of animals. Over at river safari, it's just a mere few animals that belong to the other side of the world. It's small and I went at 0930 and finished at 1230 after going for all the feeding sessions. The extra boat ride is boring as it's too quick to look and most of the time I don't even see anything. Ultimately I would say the Singapore zoo is still the best while the safari is small, boring and if it wasn't for the pandas, the entire idea would be non necessary.

title: The Panda was Reason Enough
content: I visited the park while killing time before leaving Singapore. The attraction is next to the Singapore Zoo. There's an SAEX shuttle that stops by Bus Stop B05 at Hong Lim Park in Chinatown. You might want to check their website for their timetable. The shuttle charges 5 SGD for a one-way trip. Another option is to take Bus 138 from Ang Mo Kio station, which is about a couple of dollars cheaper, depending on where you're coming from. The entrance ticket is 25 SGD, but you might want to check your hotel if they can find you tickets at a discount. It will allow you to go through the park and visit several attractions and even interact with animals. The park exhibits animals in varying regions, mostly those living close to famous rivers. There were several parts of the park that I thought was great. The Giant Panda forest where you get to observe Kai Kai, a giant panda, is one. He is so adorable and is probably worth the entire ticket. If you could only go over the fence and give him a hug. Another part of the park that I found interesting was the Squirrel Monkey forest. The monkeys are so close you can practically tell them bedtime stories. I also found the Amazon Flooded Forest interesting. It was an education in rivers and the lives of animals whose habitat depends on it. The Amazon River Quest Boat Ride is charged separately at 5 SGD, so don't be surprised if it's not included. I think that it's worth getting the boat ride to experience the rest of the park. I visited the park midweek and there wasn't any queue. I highly enjoyed the experience considering I visited just to kill time.

title: A very enjoyable ride
content: I would not mind waiting for 40 minutes again in queue for the river safari ride. There were a wide variety of animals to be seen and the ride was very informative as well.

title: Long Queues, Boat Ride not Worth the Wait
content: The river zoo itself is quite good but our experience was marred by the ridiculous wait to go on the boat ride. When you buy tickets at the park, you can buy an additional $5 ticket for the ten minute river ride. They even purport to give you a reserved time. It is a big lie. We showed up for our 1230 boat ride at 1215 and there was a long pre queue. When we were admitted at about 1230 we were shuttled to a second queue. At 1245, we entered a third queue with over two hundred others people. Most of these people were leftovers from the 1200 reservation. We finally got our boat ride at 1320, one hour and five minutes after we started waiting. They are poorly organized and over promise and under deliver.

title: Long queues
content: Having pre-bought tickets we were not expecting to wait hours more to book the actual river safari before we entered the park. We then queued another 1.5 hours inside the park to get on the ride. It totally spoilt the day. If you want to ride the main attraction, avoid the weekends!! We won't be doing it again...

title: Badly organized
content: I have been in two hours of queues so far and have just been told it is another 30-45 minutes wait for the boat ride, which appears to be the only way to see quite a lot of the animals. Also, food and beverage is very crowded and poor quality. Won't be coming back here. In fact, just considering blowing off the rest of the visit and going home even though I have hardly seen anything. Stick with Night Safari, it is really good.

title: Good, but could be great.
content: I liked the RIver Safari, but I can't help thinking how much better it can be. We went here in the morning, the first stop of a zoo marathon (Singapore Zoo & Night Safari as well). This is the newest park in Singapore and it is designed as a one-way tour. Meaning there's basically only one way to walk, from A to B with the various animals (manatees, otters, freshwater fish, crocodiles, birds, turtles, reptiles, snakes, and pandas) along the way. The place is well designed, but it feels as if the only reason people come here is for the pandas. This is noticable in the way the area is designed. Don't get me wrong, the red pandas and black & white pandas are extremely cute, but I feel the other animals should get the same treatment. It's not a bad place, and it can be a great park with some more improvements. BTW, when I visited this place the boatride attraction wasn't completed yet. Maybe this thing is awesome and worth the visit alone.

title: Fantastic new addition to Singapore
content: We've seen all the others, Jurong bird park the Zoo and this was just as great . Where else can you see Giant Pandas and Manatees . The river ride was good too . Take the kids they will love it .

title: Latest Addition to Singapore animal attractions - like others, first class
content: In any other country, River Safari would be five-star - but among the ranks of the world-famous Singapore Zoo and Jurong Bird Park, it ranks third. But as a bronze medal winner, my, it's very much still first class. In short - if you can do all three of Singapore's attractions - do them, and enjoy. If you can only select one or two, don't do River Safari. Ok, enough negative. River Safari is located to the right of the Sing Zoo entrance. It's a very well designed "path" in which you discover fishes, pandas, birds, monkeys - what more could you want. I didn't realize it was almost entirely covered, and thank goodness - otherwise, you'd fry in the sun. The crowds are heavy, as you expect, but today wasn't terribly bad - we got to see everything we wanted. My four-year-old daughter and I also loved some of the up-close encounters - like the little monkeys and even this huge stork. This is a great, leisurely two-hour or so stroll which is logically structured - so a nice bolt on trip to the Zoo. In fairness, we did not do the River tour because my daughter was just a couple inches too small, so I can't report back on that. I'd highly recommend it, but again, remember the rankings in case you need to make choices.

title: Small, doesn't compare to its zoo and night safari counterparts
content:
Located next to the Zoo and the Night Safari, the River Safari is the smallest of the three, and probably the least exciting.

The focus of the park is on the great rivers of the world, and the flora and fauna around the rivers. Unfortunately, you can't really interact with fish.

There are a few exciting exhibits - the giant river stingray and eight manatees in two (separate) giant tanks are great. There is also a Panda exhibit which is the largest draw card. Our favourite was the squirrel monkey house where you walk on a path and the monkeys play around you rather than in cages.

We went on a weekday so there was no line and we got in very easily. The boat cruise is a little disappointing - you have to get there very early to secure a seat but I wouldn't cry if I missed it.

Food wise - we ate the the Panda themed restaurant. I'd avoid that - it was pretty crap. The panda pau is probably the only thing worth eating!

On the whole a three, the zoo and night safari and even the Jurong Bird Park are more exciting.

title: River Safari - Small Attraction that is worth going once...
content:
My wife and I went to the River Safari on 27 Feb 2014 which was a Thursday. When we arrived at 9.40am, we went to the ticketing counter to get our Boat Ride timing and we got a 10.30am timing.

We took a walk around the first attraction, The Amazon Flooded Forest where we saw Huge Manatees, Arapaima, Pacu, Electric Eel, Sea Otters and of course the piranhas. The best attraction here was obviously the manatees and the sea otters.

After this, we went to queue for our boat ride at 10am. We heard from a couple in front of us that you can actually queue for your boat ride ahead of schedule and they will probably let you take the earlier ride. The Boat Ride as people have mentioned is pretty average. There are many animal enclosures along the boat ride but it really depends on your luck whether you can see the animals.

After that we went for our lunch at the Mama Panda Kitchen. Food there was surprisingly not bad but pretty expensive.We then went to the main attraction, the Pandas. In the Panda Exhibit, you will see the pheasant, red pandas and giant pandas Jia Jia & Kai Kai. For the Giant Pandas, it is advisable to view them at around 2pm. When we were there, we saw the zoo keeper placing fruits and bamboo shoots at various locations in Kai Kai's enclosure and when they let him out, he basically went around eating the food that they had placed for him. There are many photo and video opportunities at this time.

For the rest of the attractions, it is basically a collection of fishes and reptiles that you will seldom if ever see outside their native habitats.

So is the River Safari a MUST Visit attraction in Singapore? I'm leaning towards YES due to the fact that there are not many places in the world where you can see Giant Pandas.

Anyway, the River Safari isn't that big. You can probably complete the attraction in about 3 hours or so. So my advice is that if you are going there, bundle the trip together with the Zoo and if you get a late afternoon timing for the boat ride, go to the zoo first and then to the River Safari nearer the time of your boat ride. Do take note that it takes about 10-15 mins to walk to the boat ride from the entrance of the River Safari.

title: OK, but a bit disappointing
content:
We thought we would try the River Safari as we have always enjoyed the close by Night Safari, but were a little disappointed with this one.
The boat rides were virtually full when we arrived (at 10am, we were just able to get tickets (currently free) on the last of the timed rides between 16:00 to 16:30, which was quite a long time to wait (we didn’t in the end). You can still see around 85% of the animals, though, without going on the boat ride, but in this case I think visiting the Zoo instead would have been a better option.
The star attraction was the Giant Pandas though, and I guess predictably, there was a very long queue to see them (again we didn’t bother in the end), which again shows how much interest there was in seeing them but devalued the experience especially for hot, bored young children and their long suffering parents.
If you go to see it, I would suggest getting there VERY EARLY, a soon as the park opens, otherwise I suggest seriously considering visiting the Singapore Zoo instead.

title: Fun for a few hours
content: We visited on a quiet Monday morning, ideal as we missed the queues mentioned in other reviews. When it's not busy, you only need about 3 hours to see the whole place. If you're looking for a full day out, the Singapore Zoo would be a better option but for a half-day this is good fun. We particularly enjoyed the pandas and red pandas, where the staff gave us lots of information about the animals.

title: not worth the time / cost
content: To go to singapore and expect to see anything extrodinary when it involves more than a shopping mall is expecting a lot. I knew that going in, but frankly, the whole thing is just to small and uninspired. Give it a pass.

title: Trip to River Safari with my son
content: The main attraction of the park to us is the pair of pandas and tree pandas. The ride on the river turn out to be so so only. The waiting time is far longer than the actual ride. For those in a hurry, you can miss the boat ride without missing much. If the food outlets inside the park is not to your likings, there is a KFC outside the River Safari and you can get permission from the staff to go out of the park and re-enter again later. There are public buses going to the park from MRT stations.

title: Short and enjoyable
content:
This is a lovely and relatively short day out in Singapore meaning it's great for putting in a few hours but doesn't leave you absolutely wrecked at the end of it! We arrived at 12 and were done by 3, waited around for our reserved boat trip at 4. The ticket price is good and includes the pandas and the boat trip. We liked that the majority of the park is under shade so it's a relief from the sun.

There are plenty of interesting fish & mammals to see and information dotted all around on how each one helps the environment and hence should be protected.

Some tips:
If the queue for the boat trip is massive just skip it. It's actually quite lame, much shorter than we expected and we saw very few animals. it's the only feature that lets the park down and it's really not worth the queue. If there's no queue then it's ok if you have kids as they might enjoy it, it's not in any way as exciting or dangerous as is implied in the park and you won't get anywhere near soaked either!

We got a taxi to the park, $21 from Raffles Place which was well worth it. The queue for taxis back was insane. Round the corner from the bus stop there is a 'deluxe' coach service which will take you back into town for $5, much handier than waiting for a taxi and we were back in around 30 minutes.

Although your ticket says you can't, you can indeed leave the River Safai part of the complex by getting your hand stamped which allows you to re-enter. This gives you more options in terms of places to eat as there's only one food place in the park serving only Asian food (so not great for vegetarians like me).

You could combine this with the Night Safari for a longer day out. The Night Safari is also very leisurely and not overwhelming in terms of size (plus a good part of it can be seen from the little train available) and very enjoyable. The Night Safari also has more options in terms of places to eat.

title: Enjoyed the Pandas most
content: This is a separate attraction (with a separate price), its next to the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari. What can I say, it was okay but the best part was actually the Pandas and the Red Pandas part of the walk through.

title: The Weakest Link...
content:
That is not to say the River Safari is bad, it is not, I am glad I went but I would not go again. All in all the park took us about two hours, we then had to kill more time waiting for the River Quest boat ride.

In some way I feel this park was built to get an additional fee to see the pandas and everything else was a bit of an afterthought. I'm sure that is not the case but overall I feel this park has some evolving to do.

The boat ride was an anti climax. I'm really not sure how necessary it was and whether the same trail could have been constructed for people to observe the animals on foot. The Night Safari tram is in my opinion a better example of this sort of attraction.

That said the flooded forest was wonderful and the Eco messages throughout are necessary. I enjoyed it but the zoo and night Safari are better overall in my opinion. Still worth a visit to make up your own mind!

title: Excellent New Addition
content: The last time we were in Singapore in 2012 this was under construction. It is now finished and well worth a visit. The River Safari is a separate area of the Zoo and you can buy a ticket just for it or, a multiple pass that will get you into the Zoo, the Safari and the Night Safari, for example. The Amazon Experience is a free boat ride included with the River Safari. It is basically a boat ride down a winding channel with three sets of rapid-like waters. These are gentle slopes that the boat slides down. Despite the various warning signs, there is no real risk to anyone's health by going on this ride. It is intended to duplicate to some extent the upper regions of the Amazon with the appropriate plants and wildlife. The River Safari is a pathway that you walk along and as you go, you will see depictions of 8 great rivers of the world. Both of these new exhibits are well worth a visit, even if you don't like Zoos. Great for families or just a couple. We highly recommend it.

title: Long waiting time for the boat ride
content:
Went on Sunday morning, reach the ticket counter 10am (it opens at 9am), and was allocated a boat ride earliest at 4pm! I asked the reception what could I do while waiting for the boat ride, and was proposed to tour the park for about 2 hours, had lunch, then come back for the boat ride. And wait for another 3 hours?? =.="

My advice is, avoid the weekend if possible, I was told normal weekday the usual wait for the boat is immediate or within 2 hours.
Otherwise, bundle your visit with the zoo next door while waiting for the boat ride. Or, you gotta come very early to redeem a decent timing.

title: Refreshing experience
content:
We visited the River Safari along with another family in Dec 2013. Had been contemplating to visit as soon as it has been open for the past few months, however could only make it when kids were relatively free during the Christmas break. Its a very well designed park with themes built on the basis of major rivers of the world (depicting key flora and fauna). It's a small place compared to Zoo or Bird Park or the Night Safari. However, we could see some rare species of wildlife belonging to these river basins. The Amazon River Quest (boat safari - which was then free on promotion, not sure if its still free now!!), was short but quite impressive. Its a must see at least once to have a good grasp of civilizations that dwell along these rivers, the human and animal activity, etc. Especially interesting are the two new Pandas added to the River Safari, don't miss this. However I wish there were more shows added, in addition to the live exhibits of few animals brought out to the visitors.
In case you wish to visit over the weekend or during school holidays, make sure you arrive early or be prepared for the long queue. I strongly suggest purchasing the tickets online and taking the print outs.

title: Stick with the Zoo and its feeding trail
content: The boat ride lasted 7 minutes and was nothing like the numerous advertisements plastered throughout Singapore. We went through the park in about 2 hours. The highlights were the manatee and otters. The pandas were underwhelming. Simply not worth the money.

title: Small but enjoyable
content:
It is a much smaller attraction compared to the Singapore Zoo but with a different theme to present from the Singapore Zoo. It features on exotic and rarer seen animals in tropical Asian countries like animals from Amazon, Egypt, India etc.. My favourite would be the pandas and manatees of course.

About 4 hours should be sufficient to cover the attractive, provided that there is no long queue at the free boat ride. Go early at 9am when the crowd is smaller, the later you go, the bigger the crowd. The boat ride is complimentary for the time being, not sure when they will start charging, so go visit when you can now. The boat ride also has limited quota, so if you go later in the day, they may just not be available anymore.

The Amazon exhibit is great and has good variety of animals on exhibit. It is also very informative, so we hardly have any chance to get up close with animals from that region. Overall, it's a great place to visit with friends and family, especially those with young children.

title: ticket in the internet is cheaper than at the door
content:
buy online its around 8usd cheaper

idk why there are so many bad reviews here.....

I ve been to many aquariums in japan and usa... and I guarantee this one is really good

and UNIQUE - only fresh water ... there are not many places to see a massive exclusive fresh water aquarium in the world.... amazon and mekong tanks are amazing ! also the indians crocodiles

howerver ... the boat ride depends on ur luck,,,,, i did not see many animals....

title: River boat ride is amazing
content: The boat ride was outstanding. It is out of the ordinary. Food was ok, but expensive. The design and concepts was interesting. The panda enclosure was the best i've ever seen but it is too big for just 2 giant panda, 2 red panda and pheasants. All the enclosure was amazing but too boring as there is mostly only fish. I would recommend the zoo or night safari more.

title: WOW what a great extra Giant Pandas and Manetees
content:
Wandering through the river areas of the world, we saw some great exhibitions. The layout was good and the way the whole are was landscaped and fashioned on the particular part of the world was great. We really loved seeing the panda's. They were out and eating and playing. A special moment. Another equally fantastic part was the manatee tanks. So many.
Could have done without the boat ride. I like to watch the animals not have a spotting competition as you flash past.
Worth the visit. Better than the night zoo. We did not bother going this time.

title: Not so interesting
content: the Amazon river ride is nothing more than a boat ride, didn't sight much animals during the 10 mins ride. Suggests to take the afternoon ride rather than morning ride as most animals still falling asleep.

title: Decent if you beat the crowd... but very small park & short boat ride
content:
Most of the animals & fishes in the exhibits were a great view. The Pandas were especially nice.
However the park is TOO small. "IF" there is no crowd, could easily have finished the park in 1 to 1.5 hours. The "boat" ride was decent, but some animals were "lost" or probably somewhere zzzz as the boat went past them. It's also too short a ride if taken into account the queue for ride tickets.The staff were good,mainly saw youngsters at the service side, patient and courteous. Tip is to go early 8.30am and get the boat tickets and then proceed visit Pandas once you enter park (no panda queue when we did), because there will a large crowd and queues soon. Ticket price not exactly tasty..Value for money? hmmmm

title: Get there early
content: We arrived before the gates opened as we had been warned about long queues to get the boat ride ticket and again at the boat ride itself. Arriving at about 8:45, there was absolutely no queue at the ticket counter...bonus! We decided to wander the 'wrong way' through as that looked to be the shorter way to the boat. Good decision as got to see the flooded amazon exhibit with no one else around as well as the squirrel monkey forest. Then not much of a queue at the boats. Yes the ride is only about 15 minutes, but worth it. Getting in early also meant no waiting and few people in the panda enclosure. I would recommend making a day of it and head into the zoo afterwards to make the trip out to Mandai worthwhile.

title: Nice place to visit, relax and enjoy the walk and boat ride
content: The first time we went to the River safari, as we planned to visit the night safari, just think maybe we just go earlier and take a look of the River safari. We spend about 3 hours there, enough time to take the boat ride and have a leisure walk going through all the Rivers around the world, meet with the giant panda. Very relaxing, nice view, as the time is approaching closure of the park, no need to queue up for long time, not so hot either! We enjoy the park very much.

title: Lovely outing, panda show the best!
content:
We were lucky to see both pandas out in action - walking, eating, climbing trees....

The place is well constructed with shades all along the way. The free river cruise (limited time only) is also quite enjoyable. We didn't expect to see real animals along the cruise so it was a nice surprise.

I suggest to visit in the mornings to see the pandas in action. Many of my friends visited in the afternoon and said the pandas were hiding!

Anyway the pandas' home is air conditioned and thus the nicest part of the park!

title: Great trip!
content:
Went to the River Safari with family (4 adults and two young children) and reached there around 9.45am. Was in time to book seats for the boat ride at 10.30am, would advise to reach there earlier in order to book the boat ride andthe signage to signify that the ride for the day is full was out by 12pm. From the entrance of river safari, you will need to turn right and walk all the way to the end of the park in order to take the ride. If you turn left, you will be walking towards the panda enclosures and you will need to cross a long bridge before you can take the ride. Was a pretty long walk but the very good thing is that the park is 90% sheltered which allows me to enjoy the trip more rather than melting in the sweltering heat and humid. Along the way, you will see sea cows, aquatic animals, stingrays, toucans, and many other amazonia animals.

The boat ride was fun and we were able to see the colourful ibis birds, iguana, flamingoes etc. However, it would add to the comfort level if the boat is sheltered. Nevertheless, as it took less than 10 mins (8 mins to be exact, as counted by my son), you will not be exposed to the sun for too long. Managed to take a pic with the panda mascot at around 12.15pm

The main highlight was the two giant pandas housed in airconditioned comfort, which further enhances my visit. Kai Kai went into the den and didn't come out, the good thing is Jia Jia was very active, eating bamboos, walking around and you will see throes of people fighting to take her pics. The red panda was very adorable too, sociable and strolling from branch to branch.

We bought a panda lookalike red bean bun ($2.90 for one) at the mama panda eating house along with two plastic souvenir cups of soft drinks (each at $3.90) , which to me is a good buy especially as memento. The prices of the food are not cheap and neither are the merchandise. But this is to be expected as it is a tourist attraction. We had our lunch outside the area, (do get a stamp on your hand for re-entry) at the Tea house restaurant. The trio combination (roast duck, char siew and chicken) was excellent as well as the tofu hotplate. Curry chicken was too mushy and nothing spectacular about the fried prawn noodles. Set me back at $85. Take note that a bowl of plain white rice is sold at $2.00.

As compared to the zoo trip last month, I will say that my family and myself enjoyed this trip a lot lot more primarily because the area is sheltered and therefore a lot more comfortable. So yes, I will say it is worthwhile to go again :)

title: Disappointing in comparison to Night Safari and Singapore Zoo
content:
The River Safari did not meet my expectations. It has interresting and nice-looking animals to see such as the giant pandas, red panda, capibaras, tapirs and fish from many different ecosystems around the world. However, it is smaller in comparison to the Night Safari and Singapore Zoo. It's fares are also not value for money.

The rides in the boat to do the safari are too short, less than 10 minutes after nearly two hours waiting in line. It took a while to get the ride, because the boats security system were constantly displaying alert messages that had to be checked by safety experts. It's good that the River Safari wants to make sure everyone is safe, but they should have informed better the costumers about the problems, so people wouldn't have stayed in line for too long.

The best was probably the Giant Pandas. If it wasn't for the existing animals under display, I would give this attraction a lower score than the one I am actually giving.

title: Singapore, you have done and could do better!
content:
As a several times visitor to the zoo perhaps our expectations were too high.
